But it&#8217;s not always when the downtime of both platforms trends on other social media.<\/p>\n<p>Users have been complaining about social media websites and applications not responding or severely lagging. This is reported at a global scale downtime. Not only in India or Asia, but Facebook and Instagram are also reported to be lagging\/facing downtime throughout the globe.<\/p>\n<h2>What&#8217;s The Reason Behind Downtime?<\/h2>\n<p>&#8220;Instagram is down, according to some of its users. A huge number of people rushed to complain that the photo-sharing website had broken. The outage comes on Thanksgiving morning in the US, leading many to joke that they had been forced to engage with their family members.&#8221;, reported by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.independent.co.uk\/life-style\/gadgets-and-tech\/news\/instagram-down-today-broken-not-working-thanksgiving-error-loading-a9223816.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Independent UK<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>However, it is still unclear why the websites are down. Instagram posted about the downtime on their Twitter handle but keeping people in dark what is causing this.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\">\n<p dir=\"ltr\" lang=\"en\">We\u2019re aware that some people are currently having trouble accessing Facebook\u2019s family of apps, including Instagram. If you&#8217;re facing downtime too, you can join the trend on Twitter. Or you can comment down on it.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/apple-siri-recording-apology\/\">Siri Won&#8217;t Record Your Voice Anymore As Apple Issues Public Apology<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>It&#8217;s not the first time Instagram &amp; Facebook went down. Websites Have Been Hacking iPhones For Years"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Security researchers at Google revealed today how iPhones are vulnerable against a critical exploit. The researchers also revealed the number of websites that have been hacking iPhone since past two years using indiscriminate watering hole attacks.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-websites-have-been-hacking-iphones-for-years\/#How_Can_A_Website_Hack_iPhone\" title=\"How Can A Website Hack iPhone?\">How Can A Website Hack iPhone?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-websites-have-been-hacking-iphones-for-years\/#How_Do_This_Attack_Works\" title=\"How Do This Attack Works?\">How Do This Attack Works?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-websites-have-been-hacking-iphones-for-years\/#How_Is_Apple_Responding_To_Google%E2%80%99s_Disclosure\" title=\"How Is Apple Responding To Google&#8217;s Disclosure?\">How Is Apple Responding To Google&#8217;s Disclosure?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-websites-have-been-hacking-iphones-for-years\/#Conclusion\" title=\"Conclusion\">Conclusion<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Can_A_Website_Hack_iPhone\"><\/span>How Can A Website Hack iPhone?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>In a lengthy <a href=\"https:\/\/googleprojectzero.blogspot.com\/2019\/08\/a-very-deep-dive-into-ios-exploit.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">blog post<\/a>, Google Project Zero\u2019s Ian Beer says that the attack wasn&#8217;t discriminative to any specific device, in fact, the website had malicious code in it. So when an iPhone user visits that particular website, the website automatically implants malicious software into target&#8217;s iPhone. This malicious software can collect sensitive data like images &amp; contacts.<\/p>\n<p>Searchers also said that the website attracted pretty much thousands of visitors per week. Anywhere an iPhone version between iOS 10 to iOS 12 is vulnerable to this attack.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Do_This_Attack_Works\"><\/span>How Do This Attack Works?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Researchers at Google identified 14 different security flaws across five exploit chains that were used to exploit the famous inbuilt browser of iPhone, Safari. This includes five affected kernels and two separate sandbox escapes.<\/p>\n<p>Once the hacker launches the implant on the victim&#8217;s iPhone, he\/she can gather and transfer information like images, data, GPS location and contacts to an external server which transmits the data every 60 seconds ie 1 minute. This also puts the user&#8217;s device at risk since this also includes passwords in &#8220;data&#8221; as we say. Or who knows what more can be affected? Because there are people who forget their bank passwords so to avoid it, they mostly store it in their notepad apps on their iPhones, which too can be exposed to the hackers.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Is_Apple_Responding_To_Google%E2%80%99s_Disclosure\"><\/span>How Is Apple Responding To Google&#8217;s Disclosure?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>The post says that the vulnerability was disclosed on 1st February 2019 and the company gave 7-day deadline to Cupertino(Apple Headquarters). The giant release was fixed on 7th February 2019 in the form of new iOS version 12.1.4.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Conclusion\"><\/span>Conclusion<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>So if you haven&#8217;t updated your iOS device yet, update it right now to protect yourself against the vulnerability.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Security researchers at Google revealed today how iPhones are vulnerable against a critical exploit. The researchers also revealed the number of websites that have been hacking iPhone since past two years using indiscriminate watering hole attacks. Won&#8217;t Record Your Voice Anymore As Apple Issues Apology To Public"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Apple today announced major changes in it&#8217;s built-in AI, Siri. &#8220;<i>As a result of our review, we realize we haven\u2019t been fully living up to our high ideals, and for that, we apologize<\/i>.&#8221;, said in a blog post via Apple.<\/p>\n<h2>What Was Apology Mainly For?<\/h2>\n<p>For those who don&#8217;t know, Siri listens to their voice conversation. Whenever someone says anything nearby their Apple device, Siri records it and it is automatically uploaded to Apple servers.<\/p>\n<p>Once it is uploaded to Apple servers, it can be listened by private contractors, or in other words, 3rd party companies. Such conversations might contain sensitive information of the user&#8217;s personal life which can be overheard by someone without the user&#8217;s consent.<\/p>\n<p>However, Apple has made some major changes. Some of the changes are as follows &#8211;<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Apple will no longer store people&#8217;s recording in their server by default. To improve, Apple with use computer-generated transcript to improve Siri.<\/li>\n<li>Users can opt-in to allow human reviewers at Apple to record their voices and listen to it in order to improve user experience. Users will have to manually opt-in to allow employees at Apple to record their voices.<\/li>\n<li>Lastly, if you were to opt-in for grading improvement, ie, to allow recordings, it will be only limited to employees of Apple. Third-party contractors are no longer allowed to listen to the recordings and is only limited to employees within Apple.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>As a result of this massive change, it was reported that more than 300+ private contractors lost their job, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.irishtimes.com\/business\/technology\/apple-lays-off-300-contractors-in-cork-hired-to-listen-to-siri-1.3999931\">reported by Irish Times<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Besides this apology, Apple has assured that none of the recordings has been out of the company for any reason.<\/p>\n<p>The next iOS version which will come with the upgrade shall have the opt-out\/opt-in system for grading voice recording. User may choose on their own depending on their preference whether to allow anyone to listen to their voice or no.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hostinger-hacked-reset-password\/\">Hostinger Forces Users To Reset Password Following Massive Data Breach Of 14 Million+ users.<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Apple today announced major changes in it&#8217;s built-in AI, Siri. &#8220;As a result of our review, we realize we haven\u2019t been fully living up to our high ideals, and for that, we apologize.&#8221;, said in a blog post via Apple. Forces Users To Reset Password Following Recent Hack"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Popular web hosting provider Hostinger faced a massive data breach containing user data of 14 Million+ base. Following such critical event, Hostinger has forced it&#8217;s users to change their password into &#8220;random sequence of characters&#8221; as a precautionary measure.<\/p>\n<h2>When And What More Is Affected?<\/h2>\n<p>According to the blog post, Hostinger claimed that the massive data breach took place last Saturday(23rd August 2019). The company received an alert that one of their servers were accessed by an unauthorized party. The server contained authorization access key to their RESTful API mechanism. This API mechanism can be used to obtain personal data like<\/p>\n<p>&#8211; names<br \/>\n&#8211; Hostinger usernames<br \/>\n&#8211; IP addresses<br \/>\n&#8211; home addresses<br \/>\n&#8211; emails<br \/>\n&#8211; phone numbers<br \/>\n&#8211; hashed passwords<\/p>\n<p>and possibly more.<\/p>\n<p>The company also claims that they immediately removed the API access to their server after they were notified about the breach. After removing, they secured their server to avoid any future unauthorized access to their server. Not only the server was secured, but all other API &amp; API related mechanisms were secured too, as the company said.<\/p>\n<h2>What Is The Company Doing After The Data Breach?<\/h2>\n<p>Following the data breach, the company said that they&#8217;re working with their data scientists and forensics department to investigate the data breach. The company claimed to have identified the unknown intruder. As required by the law, the company contacted law enforcement and are now working with them.<\/p>\n<h2>Were All Data Published On The Internet?<\/h2>\n<p>As of now, there have been no traces of data being published on the Internet. Balys Kriksciunas, CEO of Hostinger Group told\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.zdnet.com\/article\/hostinger-resets-customer-passwords-after-security-incident\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\"><em>ZDNet<\/em><\/a> that no unknown crafted API calls were made to extract&#8217;s clients data. However, they&#8217;re considering &#8220;worst-case scenario&#8221; and forced all users to reset their password.<\/p>\n<p>He also told that it is hard to determine the number of clients who&#8217;s data was breached because of the nature of the breach.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Popular web hosting provider Hostinger faced a massive data breach containing user data of 14 Million+ base. Following such critical event, Hostinger has forced it&#8217;s users to change their password into &#8220;random sequence of characters&#8221; as a precautionary measure. When And What More Is Affected? According to the blog post, Hostinger claimed that the massive [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":570,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[12],"tags":[87,21,84,99,101,102,103,100],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/08\/hostinger-data-breach.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hostinger-hacked-reset-password\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Hostinger Forces Users To Reset Password Following Recent Hack\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"Popular web hosting provider Hostinger faced a massive data breach containing user data of 14 Million+ base. Following such critical event, Hostinger has forced it&#8217;s users to change their password into &#8220;random sequence of characters&#8221; as a precautionary measure. When And What More Is Affected? Mines Crypto"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>It is well known fact that Nuclear Power Plants are one of the most powerful solution for providing huge amount of power that can lit up an entire city, or sometimes, a whole country(depending on how big it is). This can sometimes be connected to Internet and fishy things like mining cryptocurrencies is possible using it.<\/p>\n<p>In a surprising event, employees working at Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine were found to have been mining crypto-currencies using the power generated by the Nuclear Plant. This incident happened last month, July in South Ukraine Nuclear Power plant.<\/p>\n<p>Local authorities are investigating about this incident as nuclear power plant is a critical infrastructure and if anything goes wrong, it can cause serious blackouts around the country. There are possible chances that bad guys might have used the mining rigs to grab hold of secrets like the plant\u2019s physical defenses.<\/p>\n<p>This incident came into light when Ukrainian Secret Service or SBU raided nuclear power plant administration offices and found hardware that are meant to be used for mining cryptocurrencies.<\/p>\n<h2>The Report&#8230;<\/h2>\n<p>The authorities confiscated basic computer parts like metal case, video cards and coolers that are mostly used in machines that are used by crypto mining rigs. As per the documents provided by the court to the public, one metal case had 6 Radeon RX 470 GPU video cards and the other had 5 more cards of same type.(Video cards are mostly used to mine cryptocurrencies as they&#8217;re powerful when comes to computing power.)<\/p>\n<p>As per the reports, many employees are charged with connecting the plant to Internet but no arrests have been made so far.<\/p>\n<h2>What might have inspired them to mine?<\/h2>\n<p>It seems that this attempt is inspired by the hike of price of cryptocurrencies trading price. Because since last year, it was quite a bad year for crypto market. However, this year, crypto is seen to have much higher growth. As of today, Bitcoin&#8217;s value per coin is around $10,100+.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cryptovirus-hits-windows-and-linux-kodi-users\/\">Crypto Virus Hits Linux &amp; Windows Kodi Users; 4,700+ Users Affected[September, 2018]<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>It is well known fact that Nuclear Power Plants are one of the most powerful solution for providing huge amount of power that can lit up an entire city, or sometimes, a whole country(depending on how big it is). Back Online<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cloudflare-outage\/#Root_Cause\" title=\"Root Cause\">Root Cause<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cloudflare-outage\/#Analytics_Delays\" title=\"Analytics Delays\">Analytics Delays<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cloudflare-outage\/#Track_Updates\" title=\"Track Updates\">Track Updates<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Cloudflare_Outage\"><\/span>Cloudflare Outage<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Today, 2nd July 2019, at <var data-var=\"time\">13:52<\/var> UTC, Cloudflare reported on its online monitoring status website that Cloudflare has observed network issue which left millions of websites down.<\/p>\n<p>In an official statement at <a href=\"https:\/\/www.cloudflarestatus.com\/\">Cloudflare<\/a> Status, they said,<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>Cloudflare is observing network performance issues. Customers may be experiencing 502 errors while accessing sites on Cloudflare.<\/p>\n<p>We are working to mitigate impact to Internet users in this region.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>24 minutes later, Cloudflare announced that they&#8217;ve fixed their issue and are now monitoring if the issue happens again.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Tweets\"><\/span>Tweets<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Tweets were made about the recent outage and people are going crazy.<\/p>\n<p>A user posted about Cricbuzz, a famous cricket score app, going down too.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-lang=\"en\">\n<p dir=\"ltr\" lang=\"en\">So <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/cricbuzz?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@cricbuzz<\/a> is down as it uses <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/Cloudflare?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@Cloudflare<\/a> \ud83d\ude15 <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/CloudflareDown?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#CloudflareDown<\/a> <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/CloudflareOutage?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#CloudflareOutage<\/a><\/p>\n<p>\u2014 Gaurav Kamboj (@OyeHooye) <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/OyeHooye\/status\/1146058225592098818?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">July 2, 2019<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script>A typical meme type video posted by Chris Holmok.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-lang=\"en\">\n<p dir=\"ltr\" lang=\"en\">Yeah, cloudflare broke the internet!!! I was excited to give it away&#8230; Should I post it to <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/Cloudflare?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@Cloudflare<\/a> \ud83d\ude02 <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/CloudflareOutage?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#CloudflareOutage<\/a> <a href=\"https:\/\/t.co\/8a5c1nyF8U\">pic.twitter.com\/8a5c1nyF8U<\/a><\/p>\n<p>\u2014 willish broadbino (@WillBroadbent) <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/WillBroadbent\/status\/1146055664868974592?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">July 2, 2019<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><script async src=\"https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script>When you realize you cannot even upload screenshot peacefully.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-lang=\"en\">\n<p dir=\"ltr\" lang=\"en\">I was going to upload a screenshot of <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/downdetector?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#downdetector<\/a> being down with a search for <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/cloudflare?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#cloudflare<\/a> on it and a witty caption, but my <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/gyazo?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#gyazo<\/a> is also down. I&#8217;m really not sure what I expected. <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/hashtag\/cloudflareoutage?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">#cloudflareoutage<\/a><\/p>\n<p>\u2014 Alaisha Stodghill (@importantllama) <a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/importantllama\/status\/1146058013624553472?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">July 2, 2019<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Discord_Went_Down_Too!\"><\/span><script async src=\"https:\/\/platform.twitter.com\/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"><\/script>Discord Went Down Too!<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Users have reported issue accessing Discord going down too. issue.<\/p>\n<h2 class=\"color-primary incident-name impact-minor\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Analytics_Delays\"><\/span>Analytics Delays<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Cloudflare has reported analytics delay on their system. This caused users too late delivery of the analytics in their panel. Cloudflare is working on it to get it resolved as soon as possible.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Track_Updates\"><\/span>Track Updates<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>To track any new update on outages, please visit <a href=\"https:\/\/www.cloudflarestatus.com\/incidents\/9wjyx63y2xsy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Cloudflare Status<\/a> web page.<\/p>\n<div><\/div>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/\">100 Million+ Users&#8217; Data Exposed After API access breached.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In a recent event today, Cloudflare, in fact, whole Cloudflare network was reportedly down which caused massive Cloudflare outage. This data includes personally identifiable information like name, age, gender, birthday, occupation, email, company the person currently works in, etc.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#How_Was_The_API_Available_To_The_Researcher\" title=\"How Was The API Available To The Researcher?\">How Was The API Available To The Researcher?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#What_Type_Of_Data_Was_At_Risk\" title=\"What Type Of Data Was At Risk?\">What Type Of Data Was At Risk?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#What_Was_The_Response_By_JustDial\" title=\"What Was The Response By JustDial?\">What Was The Response By JustDial?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#JustDial_Responds_When_Started_Loosing_Share_Holders\" title=\"JustDial Responds When Started Loosing Share Holders\">JustDial Responds When Started Loosing Share Holders<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#True_Story_Behind\" title=\"True Story Behind\">True Story Behind<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#Did_JustDial_Fix_The_Vulnerability\" title=\"Did JustDial Fix The Vulnerability?\">Did JustDial Fix The Vulnerability?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/#Conclusion\" title=\"Conclusion\">Conclusion<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"JustDial_Users%E2%80%99_Data_At_Risk\"><\/span>JustDial Users&#8217; Data At Risk<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>TheHackerNews reported about an independent security researcher named <a href=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/rajaharia\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Rajshekhar Rajaharia<\/a> contacted TheHackerNews privately about the data breach.<\/p>\n<p>These user data could be accessed by the mean of API. To run a search of the user data, the hacker would need target&#8217;s phone number or the &#8216;ref id&#8217; which is a unique numerical ID assigned to each of JustDial user.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Was_The_API_Available_To_The_Researcher\"><\/span>How Was The API Available To The Researcher?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>The researcher, in a report, claimed that the API was found in an older version of the app which was of the year 2015&#8217;s version.<\/p>\n<figure id=\"attachment_543\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-543\" style=\"width: 463px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img data-attachment-id=\"543\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/justdial-data-exposed\/justdialvuln\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"548,165\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"justdialvuln\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln-300x90.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln.jpg\" class=\"wp-image-543\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln-300x90.jpg\" alt=\"JustDial Vulnerability Shows Data At Risk\" width=\"463\" height=\"139\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln-300x90.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/justdialvuln.jpg 548w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 463px) 100vw, 463px\" \/><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-543\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Rajshekhar&#8217;s FB Post<\/figcaption><\/figure>\n<p>Those APIs, were, however, not deleted or disposed of by the JustDial security team after abandoned. This allowed the researcher to find the API and run the checker.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_Type_Of_Data_Was_At_Risk\"><\/span>What Type Of Data Was At Risk?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>The API brought up users&#8217; personal details like name, age, gender, occupation, company he\/she worked in, email address, the language user spoke, and etc.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_Was_The_Response_By_JustDial\"><\/span>What Was The Response By JustDial?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>When the report was released to the public, the researcher said that he tried to contact the company by various means like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and etc but was ignored.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"JustDial_Responds_When_Started_Loosing_Share_Holders\"><\/span>JustDial Responds When Started Loosing Share Holders<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>After a drop in shareholders to the company, the company&#8217;s CFO Bansal had a telephonic conversation with the media live where he explained how the data was very limited to a very small amount of users. &#8220;I wouldn&#8217;t call this as a data breach&#8221;, said the CFO in the report.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"True_Story_Behind\"><\/span>True Story Behind<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>A few days later after the issue was escalated to mainstream media, the company&#8217;s CFO provided the false statement. This is where he says that the data breach was very limited.<\/p>\n<p>But by the report of TheHackerNews, the users&#8217; data were directly accessible. For example, if you call their search engine number &#8216;88888-88888&#8217;, they will help you and collect your details. After then, your details are stored in their database. TheHackerNews provided the researcher with a fresh number which was never used to contact JustDial.<\/p>\n<p>When TheHackerNews contacted JustDial over their customer helpline, they shared random details. Just after the call was completed, Rajshekhar provided him with all the details he provided to helpline agent. This proves that the CFO provided a false statement for the sake to bring back shareholders. The details provided could be accessible in real-time.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Did_JustDial_Fix_The_Vulnerability\"><\/span>Did JustDial Fix The Vulnerability?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Rajshekher said in a <a href=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/rajaharia\/posts\/10157093999684501\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Facebook post<\/a> that the company fixed the vulnerability. But they didn&#8217;t reply after it was fixed thus hiding the issue.<\/p>\n<p>Rajshekhar also said that there are few more unprotected APIs which can be used. These API can trigger false OTPs to a particular phone number in the name of JustDial. This cannot be called a vulnerability but can cost the company a lot. This can also put the company&#8217;s reputation at risk as this bug can be used to spam. It can send up to thousands or lakhs of SMS at a time which causes SMS credit loss to the company.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Conclusion\"><\/span>Conclusion<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>This report was first presented into the media by TheHackerNews which was later followed by other media portals.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/thehackernews.com\/2019\/04\/justdial-hacked-data-breach.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener noreferrer\">Source<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In a recent report by TheHackerNews, it was found that the tech-giant JustDial users&#8217; data were vulnerable to be exposed on the Internet. This data includes personally identifiable information like name, age, gender, birthday, occupation, email, company the person currently works in, etc. Jump To JustDial Users&#8217; Data At RiskHow Was The API Available To [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":544,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[12],"tags":[87,21,83,84,85,86,82],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/JustDial.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"description\" content=\"In a recent report, it was found that JustDial Users&#039; data are currently vulnerable on Internet. To Bypass CloudFlare And Find Real IP Behind Website?"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Cloudflare is a Content Delivery Network as well as a firewall for a website. It protects the website against many attacks. Cloudflare is famous for it&#8217;s DDoS protection at no cost. It provides a thick layer of security over the website&#8217;s real IP and transports all data from origin server to CDN. In simple words, Cloudflare hides the origin IP address of the server. Replacing it with a DDoS-protected based server IP. In this article, we&#8217;re going to learn how can we find the real IP behind the Cloudflare or how to bypass cloudflare. So let&#8217;s begin&#8230;<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#How_CloudFlare_Works\" title=\"How CloudFlare Works\">How CloudFlare Works<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#How_To_Bypass_Cloudflare\" title=\"How To Bypass Cloudflare\">How To Bypass Cloudflare<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#Pinging_SubDomains\" title=\"Pinging SubDomains\">Pinging SubDomains<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#How_can_we_find_that_the_IP_isn%E2%80%99t_hosted_on_Cloudflare\" title=\"How can we find that the IP isn&#8217;t hosted on Cloudflare?\">How can we find that the IP isn&#8217;t hosted on Cloudflare?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#How_can_we_track_it\" title=\"How can we track it?\">How can we track it?<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#Finding_Out_Domain%E2%80%99s_IP\/Nameserver_History\" title=\"Finding Out Domain&#8217;s IP\/Nameserver History\">Finding Out Domain&#8217;s IP\/Nameserver History<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#When_I_Open_The_IP_In_Browser,_It_Shows_Default_Text_Instead_Of_Website%E2%80%99s_Content,_why\" title=\"When I Open The IP In Browser, It Shows Default Text Instead Of Website&#8217;s Content, why?\">When I Open The IP In Browser, It Shows Default Text Instead Of Website&#8217;s Content, why?<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#Using_A_3rd_Party_Cloudflare_Resolver\" title=\"Using A 3rd Party Cloudflare Resolver\">Using A 3rd Party Cloudflare Resolver<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-9\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#ShadowCrypt%E2%80%99s_Cloudflare_Resolver\" title=\"ShadowCrypt&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver\">ShadowCrypt&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-10\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#Crimeflare%E2%80%99s_Cloudflare_Resolver\" title=\"Crimeflare&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver\">Crimeflare&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-11\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#How_To_Protect_Your_Website_Against_Such_Bypassing_Techniques\" title=\"How To Protect Your Website Against Such Bypassing Techniques?\">How To Protect Your Website Against Such Bypassing Techniques?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-12\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/#Conclusion\" title=\"Conclusion\">Conclusion<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_CloudFlare_Works\"><\/span><strong>How CloudFlare Works<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>As mentioned above, Cloudflare provides a layer of security by transporting the data securely between the server and the visitor.<\/p>\n<p>When a website is added to Cloudflare, the website owner is asked to change the nameserver of the website with cloudflare&#8217;s name server. After the website&#8217;s name server is updated, the cloudflare takes over. Cloudflare now provides a shell case between website and the visitor. This is how it works.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"522\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/cloudflareworks\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks.png\" data-orig-size=\"640,320\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"cloudflareworks\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks-300x150.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks.png\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-522\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks-300x150.png\" alt=\"How Cloudflare Works\" width=\"588\" height=\"294\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks-300x150.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/cloudflareworks.png 640w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 588px) 100vw, 588px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works-detailed-explanation\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">What Is Cloudflare? How Does It Work? Detailed Explanation<\/a><\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_To_Bypass_Cloudflare\"><\/span><strong>How To Bypass Cloudflare<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>There isn&#8217;t just one step the bypass cloudflare. If not configured properly after setup, the website is vulnerable to get bypassed. Let&#8217;s see what are the steps through which we can bypass Cloudflare.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Pinging_SubDomains\"><\/span><strong>Pinging SubDomains<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Yes. When someone adds their website to Cloudflare, cloudflare automatically scans over all sub-domains on the domain and shows the list. However, only few of them which are set as default has the cloudflare protection enabled. If other sub-domains are pinged, they might show the server IP of the website&#8217;s origin.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"523\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/pingingsubdomain\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain.png\" data-orig-size=\"640,402\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"pingingsubdomain\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain-300x188.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain.png\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-523\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain-300x188.png\" alt=\"Pinging Sub Domains\" width=\"600\" height=\"376\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain-300x188.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pingingsubdomain.png 640w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>For example, the website with domain example.com is protected with Cloudflare. But it isn&#8217;t configured properly or has been left on default settings, the sub-domains might still be vulnerable to expose the real IP. Maybe &#8220;mail.example.com&#8221; or &#8220;server.example.com&#8221; would still be showing the real IP? Try pinging them all until you find the IP which isn&#8217;t hosted on Cloudflare&#8217;s network.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_can_we_find_that_the_IP_isn%E2%80%99t_hosted_on_Cloudflare\"><\/span><strong>How can we find that the IP isn&#8217;t hosted on Cloudflare?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>By simply tracking it. Cloudflare&#8217;s IP addresses are mostly hosted on their US servers and can be detected easily. Not necessarily USA, they&#8217;ve got many datacenters. You can simply check their ISP. If it is Cloudflare, it will show &#8220;Cloudflare&#8221;, if it doesn&#8217;t show &#8220;Cloudflare&#8221;, it is the real IP. Note that, not every non-cloudflare hosted IP(s) are website&#8217;s origin. Some might be their another server IP or maybe their 3rd party mail server&#8217;s provider IP, so be specific and use your common sense during the operation.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_can_we_track_it\"><\/span><strong>How can we track it?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Tracking might sound a big deal. But actually it is not. Yes, it is hard to find accurate location of the IP address, but still you can use public IP trackers. The best and most accurate(not exact) available for free is <a href=\"https:\/\/shadowcrypt.club\/ip\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ShadowCrypt<\/a>. Just enter the IP address and press &#8220;Submit&#8221; and the results are is raw format!<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Finding_Out_Domain%E2%80%99s_IP\/Nameserver_History\"><\/span><strong>Finding Out Domain&#8217;s IP\/Nameserver History<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>If you manage to find out domain&#8217;s IP address or it&#8217;s name server history, then you might have a chance to assume the real IP. Most of website owners migrate their website and then add Cloudflare. IP History archives keeps the record of which domain has changed to which IP and when. Like your target website was once hosted on Digital Ocean, but then was added to Cloudflare. How can you find that specific IP address of Digital Ocean? You can lookout for it&#8217;s history.<\/p>\n<p>You can use <a href=\"https:\/\/viewdns.info\/iphistory\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">ViewDNS<\/a>. They provide a record of &#8220;most&#8221; of domain&#8217;s IP history. Not all domains, but atleast more then half of your query.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s take a scenario of finding out IP address of the website &#8220;Tech2Hack.com&#8221;. It is currently under Cloudflare but I know it was hosted on NameCheap once. But which IP? I&#8217;ll find it by checking it&#8217;s IP history.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"524\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/iphistorytech2hackcom\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/iphistorytech2hackcom.png\" data-orig-size=\"997,489\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" 856w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/iphistorytech2hackcom.png 997w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 616px) 100vw, 616px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>You can see the past 4 IP address records made by ViewDNS are from Cloudflare. But before those 4 IPs, you can see NameCheap&#8217;s IP. The IP address is &#8220;198.54.115.33&#8221; and when I tracked it with <a href=\"https:\/\/shadowcrypt.club\/ip\/\">ShadowCrypt IP Tracker<\/a>, it shows Namecheap!<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"525\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/how-to-bypass-cloudflare\/tech2hackiptracked\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked.png\" data-orig-size=\"1150,361\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked-300x94.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked-768x241.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked-1024x321.png 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked-696x218.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked-1068x335.png 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/tech2hackiptracked.png 1150w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 559px) 100vw, 559px\" \/><\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"When_I_Open_The_IP_In_Browser,_It_Shows_Default_Text_Instead_Of_Website%E2%80%99s_Content,_why\"><\/span><strong>When I Open The IP In Browser, It Shows Default Text Instead Of Website&#8217;s Content, why?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>But when you open the IP, you see the &#8220;Default&#8221; page. The reason behind this is that the website is hosted on a shared hosting. And Of course, Namecheap provides shared hosting in a very affordable price too! So there might be many websites hosted on the same server. This makes the hosting provider unable to provide dedicated IP so they host them all on a single server. Mostly when a private server is used, the server&#8217;s directory is &#8220;\/var\/www\/html&#8221; but when a shared one is used, it is usually &#8220;\/home\/websiteusername\/public_html&#8221; where &#8220;websiteusername&#8221; defines the cPanel username of the website&#8217;s owner hosting account. There are many users hosted in the same server like &#8220;websiteuser2&#8221; and &#8220;websiteuser3&#8221; or &#8220;randomusername&#8221; or &#8220;websiteownername&#8221;. It depends on the website&#8217;s owner or sometimes hosting provider to assign the username. The website is hosted on same IP you&#8217;ve found.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Using_A_3rd_Party_Cloudflare_Resolver\"><\/span>Using A 3rd Party Cloudflare Resolver<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>You can use a 3rd party cloudflare resolver. Yes, they exist. They do the work for you. You might feel boring to ping all sub-domains. Such resolvers do the work for you for FREE!<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"ShadowCrypt%E2%80%99s_Cloudflare_Resolver\"><\/span><strong>ShadowCrypt&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>You can use <a href=\"https:\/\/shadowcrypt.club\/cloudflare\">ShadowCrypt&#8217;s Cloudflare<\/a> Resolver which automatically brute-forces thousands of sub-domains and pings them. Tracks the IP and lists the providers for you and finally, shows you which sub-domain is active, which has cloudflare and which is not hosted on Cloudflare.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Crimeflare%E2%80%99s_Cloudflare_Resolver\"><\/span><strong>Crimeflare&#8217;s Cloudflare Resolver<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Crimeflare is a strange website. I couldn&#8217;t understand what is their motive behind their website. But whatsoever, their content surely displays their hate towards Cloudflare. You can use <a href=\"http:\/\/crimeflare.org:82\/cfs.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Crimeflare&#8217;s Cloudflare<\/a> Resolver to find the real IP behind website if you fail to find with previous methods.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_To_Protect_Your_Website_Against_Such_Bypassing_Techniques\"><\/span><strong>How To Protect Your Website Against Such Bypassing Techniques?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Not more reading. You can read our previous article on &#8220;<a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/configuring-cloudflare-website-to-avoid-getting-it-bypassed\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Configuring Your Cloudfllare Website To Avoid Getting It Bypassed<\/a>&#8220;.<\/p>\n<p>I would still be searching for more techniques to bypass Cloudflare other then the above mentioned and present you the ways to protect your website against those techniques.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Conclusion\"><\/span><strong>Conclusion<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Here we finally come to an end on &#8220;How To Bypass Cloudflare&#8221;. Testing Service Left Online?<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_Is_%E2%80%98DDoS_For_Hire%E2%80%99_Service\"><\/span>What Is &#8216;DDoS For Hire&#8217; Service?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>&#8216;DDoS for Hire&#8217; is a category of websites that provides DDoS services for few dollars. Buying a subscription of 5-10 USD can avail you so strong DDoS service that can take down government websites.<\/p>\n<p>Despite of recent <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/stresser-markets-falling\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">WebStresser.org&#8217;s take down<\/a>, the market still continued to be on top and new websites would be launched every month.<\/p>\n<p>But it looks like Feds from US Law agencies has recently seized all domains whilst websites that were yet to be defaced were taken down and were non-accessible.<\/p>\n<figure id=\"attachment_532\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-532\" style=\"width: 610px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img data-attachment-id=\"532\" No, but it was used illegally.<\/p>\n<p>Such booters are meant to provide stress testing services for only legal and personal use only. Yes, it would indirectly benefit business owners alot but would also give abusers a new palace. There are some cyber armies that use such booters in order to taken down cheaters and script kiddies. Lets keep them aside because they&#8217;ll find some other ways.<\/p>\n<p>Those who were facing constant DDoS attacks on their website would be relieved for now. Mostly competitors are the one who would DDoS your website by buying such booter&#8217;s subscription.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Does_Booter\/Stresser_Need_Any_ExtraTerrestrial_Skills_To_Be_Operated\"><\/span>Does Booter\/Stresser Need Any Extra-Terrestrial Skills To Be Operated?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Literally? Who Took Down Gaming Companies Pleaded Guilty"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>A hacker from Utah was\u00a0pleaded guilty this week for launching multiple attacks against\u00a0multiple online services, websites, and online gaming companies between 2013 and 2014.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hacker-who-took-down-gaming-companies-pleaded-guilty\/#Hacker_Who_Took_Down_Gaming_Companies_Pleaded_Guilty\" title=\"Hacker Who Took Down Gaming Companies Pleaded Guilty\">Hacker Who Took Down Gaming Companies Pleaded Guilty<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hacker-who-took-down-gaming-companies-pleaded-guilty\/#How_Did_Feds_Got_To_Know_About_The_Hacker\" title=\"How Did Feds Got To Know About The Charged<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" Motive Behind This Attack?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hacker-who-took-down-gaming-companies-pleaded-guilty\/#Conclusion\" title=\"Conclusion\">Conclusion<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Hacker_Who_Took_Down_Gaming_Companies_Pleaded_Guilty\"><\/span><strong>Hacker Who Took Down Gaming Companies Pleaded Guilty<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>According to Department of Justice of USA press release,\u00a0 Austin Thompson also known as DerpTroll took down major gaming platform that includes\u00a0Electronic Arts&#8217; Origin service, the Sony\u00a0PlayStation network, and Valve Software&#8217;s Steam, between December 2013 and January 2014 by flooding their servers with <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/\">DDoS<\/a> attacks.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;Denial-of-service attacks cost businesses millions of dollars annually,&#8221; said U.S. Attorney Adam Braverman while\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.justice.gov\/usao-sdca\/pr\/utah-man-pleads-guilty-denial-service-computer-hacking-attacks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announcing<\/a>\u00a0the plea. &#8220;We are committed to finding and prosecuting those who disrupt businesses, often for nothing more than ego.&#8221;<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Did_Feds_Got_To_Know_About_The_Hacker\"><\/span><strong>How Did Feds Got To Know About The Hacker<\/strong>?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Thompson used his twitter account to show off screenshots of server being down after his attack. His Twitter account was @DerpTroll which he used to announce the down times.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"121\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/liveddos\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"831,631\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;CWZ&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1400342314&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"liveddos\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-300x228.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos.jpg\" class=\"aligncenter  wp-image-121\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-300x228.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"570\" height=\"433\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-300x228.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-768x583.jpg 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-80x60.jpg 80w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-696x528.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos-553x420.jpg 553w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/liveddos.jpg 831w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 570px) 100vw, 570px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The attack has resulted in more then 95,000$ in loss for all companies. This amount doesn&#8217;t include the other companies victims.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"The_Place_Where_Hacker_Was_Charged\"><\/span><strong>The Place Where Hacker Was Charged<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Thompson was pleaded guilty in\u00a0federal court in San Diego on Thursday. He\u00a0was charged with causing damages to a protected computer, which carries a maximum penalty of 10 years prison. And also a fine of $250,000 as well as 3 years of supervised release.<\/p>\n<p>Thompson&#8217;s sentencing is scheduled for March 1, 2019, before United States District Judge Jeffrey Miller.<\/p>\n<p>It was not just Thompson who was charged, there were many teens around the world participating in such attacks. This includes Lizard Squad members and alot more other cyber terrorist groups.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_Was_The_Motive_Behind_This_Attack\"><\/span><strong>What Was The Motive Behind This Attack?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>There wasn&#8217;t any &#8220;special&#8221; motive for the downtimes except just egos. Hackers whosoever took down such companies never had any contractual base for taking down the server. They just wanted to show off.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Conclusion\"><\/span><strong>Conclusion<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>What do you think about the charges? Is that too harsh? What should teens be taught when they&#8217;re online? If you have any thoughts to express, express it in the comment section below!<\/p>\n<p>Also, if you find any mistakes, let us know. Press Agency Reveals World&#8217;s First AI News Anchor"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>A Chinese press agency named named\u00a0Xinhua released world&#8217;s first AI news anchor that actually reads news for you in your TV channel.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>Chinese Press Agency Reveals World&#8217;s First AI News Anchor<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>The AI claims that he can actually reads news 24&#215;7 without getting interrupted. The video of the AI news anchor may actually look like a human, but it is really a human. Just the voice has been edited and the digitally manipulated form has been presented.<\/p>\n<p>However, the AI still lacks many features and doesn&#8217;t actually looks real. The reason behind this is the lack of facial movements and absolute AI based voice. But sooner or later, the same AI can be improved and can be presented as a AI behind a human body.<\/p>\n<p><span class=\"embed-youtube\" style=\"text-align:center; display: block;\"><iframe class='youtube-player' width='696' height='392' src='https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/embed\/GAfiATTQufk?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'><\/iframe><\/span><\/p>\n<p>The digital anchors can be programmed to\u00a0<strong>read news faster<\/strong>\u00a0than the traditional CGI techniques that are used. As per <a href=\"https:\/\/www.scmp.com\/tech\/innovation\/article\/2172235\/xinhua-news-agency-debuts-ai-anchors-partnership-search-engine-sogou\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">South China Morning Post<\/a>, the agency Xinhua has created two AIs at the moment.<\/p>\n<p>This AI has been created by the agency with the collaboration with the local search engine Sogou which helps them collect data that are essential for the presentation of the news reports.<\/p>\n<h2><strong>Are Those AI(s) Has Been Official Yet?<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>Probably yes. The agency has stated the following words which indicates the officially possession of the AI in future.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cAI anchors have officially become members of the Xinhua News Agency reporting team. They will work with other anchors to bring you authoritative, timely and accurate news information in both Chinese and English,\u201d said the news agency.<\/p>\n<p>The AI are presently accessible all through Xinhua&#8217;s web and smartphones, for example, its official Chinese and English applications, WeChat App, and online TV website.<\/p>\n<p>The AI has great impact on modern news media agencies as it can soon take over news anchor&#8217;s jobs. We&#8217;re already near an extent where AI would take over all jobs &#8211; replacing humans and making them unemployed.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/replika\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Replika, An Artificial Intelligence Android &amp; iOS App That Can Be Your Friend In Loneliness<\/a><\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h2><strong>Conclusion<\/strong><\/h2>\n<p>What do you think about the steps taken by the news agency? What are you thoughts regarding the &#8220;official&#8221; use of these AIs? class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default id=\"PUBG_Is_Available_For_Free_On_Xbox_For_Limited_Time\"><\/span><strong>PUBG Is Available For Free On Xbox For Limited Time<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>PUBG, also known as Player&#8217;s Unknown Battle Ground is a battle royale game which has gain an acceleration and a trend in gaming market. The rumor for the game being available for free on PS4 and Xbox came out to be partially true. Microsoft announced that Player Unknown\u2019s Battlegrounds would be free for downloading and playing this weekend.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Long_Would_It_Be_For_Free\"><\/span><strong>How Long Would It Be For Free<\/strong>?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>No, you were thinking wrong. This game wouldn&#8217;t be for free &#8220;forever&#8221;. Users can download it before 11th November.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/PUBG\/status\/1060284944696586240\"><img data-attachment-id=\"510\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/pubg-is-available-for-free-on-xbox\/pubg4free\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free.png\" data-orig-size=\"530,519\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"pubg4free\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free-300x294.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free.png\" class=\"aligncenter  wp-image-510\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free-300x294.png\" alt=\"PUBG available for free to download\" width=\"504\" height=\"494\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free-300x294.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free-429x420.png 429w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/pubg4free.png 530w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 504px) 100vw, 504px\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n<p>The game is actually worth 29.99$(which approximately equals to 2170 INR) on Microsoft&#8217;s Xbox store.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Other_Rumors_About_The_Game\"><\/span><strong>Other Rumors About The Game<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>PUBG is not yet launched on PS4 platform. However, rumors has been spread around the Internet about the game to be soon releasing on PS4 platform too within few months from now. Maybe at the end of January or before the new year.<\/p>\n<p>This availability of game being free on Xbox is mostly called out because of drops in player base. To gain the popularity back, the company must&#8217;ve brought the game for free.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"PUBG_For_Xbox\"><\/span><strong>PUBG For Xbox<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Users can go to Xbox store and purchase the game for free before 11th of November. The freeship is available between 8th November to 11th November only. Users can download the game by going to Xbox or <a href=\"https:\/\/www.microsoft.com\/en-us\/p\/playerunknowns-battlegrounds-full-product-release\/C4FF5WJXXQ2M?activetab=pivot:overviewtab\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">clicking here<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>PUBG on Xbox One has faced severe performance issues with users complaining frame drops and glitches. For now, the game has three stared rating on Xbox download platform.<\/p>\n<p>For more information about this &#8220;freeship&#8221; users can go to <a href=\"https:\/\/www.pubg.com\/2018\/11\/07\/xbox-pubg-free-play-days-nov-8-11\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">PUBG&#8217;s Official website<\/a> to read the announcement.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Conclusion\"><\/span><strong>Conclusion<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>What do you think about the freeship of the game? Did they do it right? If they, why did they do it? awaited foldable smartphone. However, the company has just showed off its prototype in the conference. But it shouldn&#8217;t take much longer for the release of the cool &#8220;foldable smartphones&#8221;.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>Foldable Smartphone<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>Before the reveal, Samsung has introduced\u00a0its new Infinity Flex Display technology. This technology has of course would change the way of mobile phone usage. And would change the whole way of mobile phone possessions.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"505\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/samsung-foldable-smartphone\/foldable\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"1024,569\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"foldable\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-300x167.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-1024x569.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-505 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-300x167.jpg\" alt=\"Samsung's Foldable Smartphone\" width=\"501\" height=\"279\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-300x167.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-768x427.jpg 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable.jpg 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-696x387.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldable-756x420.jpg 756w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 501px) 100vw, 501px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>However, the second reveal of the phone would surely make you shock. For the first glance, you would see the phone like a ordinary Samsung Tab but when it folds, wew!<\/p>\n<h1><strong>How Does It Even Looks Like?<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>But it doesn&#8217;t seem like the previous models. The phone is way too thick compared to previous models.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/gs48725\/status\/1060255973804138496\"><img data-attachment-id=\"506\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/samsung-foldable-smartphone\/foldablegif\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif.png\" data-orig-size=\"529,438\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"foldablegif\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif-300x248.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif.png\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-506\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif-300x248.png\" alt=\"Foldable Smartphone\" width=\"523\" height=\"432\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif-300x248.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif-507x420.png 507w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/foldablegif.png 529w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 523px) 100vw, 523px\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n<p>During the presentation, the company added that the phone is ultra-durable and can be folded hundreds of thousands of times. Messenger Unsend Feature For Chats Rolling Out Soon"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Finally! The most awaited features for Facebook users is rolling out soon. You may now unsend what you&#8217;ve sent mistakenly to your Facebook friends over messenger. Facebook messenger unsend feature rolling out soon!<\/p>\n<p>According to <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/10\/12\/facebook-messenger-unsend\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Techcrunch report<\/a>, the company is working on the prototype feature to unsend messages. This feature was firstly spotted when deleting messages from Mark Zuckerberg&#8217;s account.<\/p>\n<p>Tipster Jane Manchun Wong twitted on Friday about the unsend feature.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"501\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-messenger-unsend-feature\/unsendfeature\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature.png\" data-orig-size=\"505,667\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"unsendfeature\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature-227x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature.png\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-501\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature-227x300.png\" alt=\"Facebook Messenger Unsend Feature\" width=\"409\" height=\"541\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature-227x300.png 227w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature-318x420.png 318w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/unsendfeature.png 505w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 409px) 100vw, 409px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>As of now, when user deletes messages from his\/her inbox, the message gets deleted from the sender&#8217;s inbox only, but not the receiver. This feature would allow to unsend message from both the side.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211;\u00a0<a class=\"jp-relatedposts-post-a\" title=\"These Apps On Google Play Store Can Steal Your Banking Login Details\n\nIt has been reported and flagged by security researchers from ESET about the list of malicious apps that can steal your banking login details. These apps on Google play store can steal your banking login details. Instagram users can delete sent messages anytime without any time limitation while WhatsApp allows only one hour to delete sent messages.<\/p>\n<p>Manchun Wong also noted that the messages that were sent can be deleted within a specific amount of time only. Just like WhatsApp&#8217;s limitation of one hour deletion allowance.<\/p>\n<h2>When will this feature be out to everyone?<\/h2>\n<p>The company hasn&#8217;t confirmed it&#8217;s exact date for the feature to be rolled out. But as per the past record for the feature, it seems like it would be out soon.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p><strong>Conclusion for\u00a0Facebook Messenger Unsend Feature<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>I&#8217;m personally waiting for this feature to roll out. Facebook did it right to put up the time limitation to delete the sent messages to be unsent. This protects users from &#8220;some&#8221; possible cases of messages\/pics being sent mistakenly. For example, in case if you have sent some pics which you shouldn&#8217;t have, you can unsend it.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Also Read &#8211;\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Facebook User&#8217;s Personal Messages Online For Sale. 0.8$ per accounts.<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Finally!
