Using Antivirus to Increase Internet Speed<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"How_to_Increase_Internet_Speed_on_PC\"><\/span>How to Increase Internet Speed on PC<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>In order to do increase internet speed, we need to first make sure that our computer is connected to Internet while we are configuring our PC for speed-ups so that we can test and see if our method is really working or not.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"352\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"990,522\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"internetspeedtest\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-300x158.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-352 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-300x158.jpg\" alt=\"Internet Speed Test\" width=\"410\" height=\"216\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-300x158.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-768x405.jpg 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-696x367.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522-797x420.jpg 797w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/internetspeedtestctech-e1498280450837-990x522.jpg 990w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 410px) 100vw, 410px\" \/><\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"1_CMD_Prompt_Method\"><\/span>1. <strong>CMD Prompt Method<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>In this method, we will use CMD prompt to boost our Internet. To open Command Prompt, click on &#8220;Start &gt; Type &#8220;CMD&#8221; in search box &gt; Click on the blank window icon named &#8220;CMD&#8221; or &#8220;Command Prompt&#8221;&#8221;. A black window will open(it will look like what is in the screenshot below).<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"353\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/cmdprompt1\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1.png\" data-orig-size=\"985,515\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"cmdprompt1\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-300x157.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1.png\" class=\" wp-image-353 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-300x157.png\" alt=\"Command Prompt\" width=\"409\" height=\"214\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-300x157.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-768x402.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-696x364.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1-803x420.png 803w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt1.png 985w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 409px) 100vw, 409px\" \/><\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Releasing_The_Allocated_IPs\"><\/span><span id=\"Releasing_The_Allocated_IPs\" class=\"ez-toc-section\"><strong>Releasing The Allocated IPs<\/strong><\/span><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>When your computer is connected to router, you&#8217;re assigned an IP address. Many times the local IP address assigned to you has a speed limitation which may cause unnecessary speeding limits to your device. Most of time, this is happened when someone sets up speed limit on the router for you. This locks down the Internet speed at specified ingress and\u00a0Egress bandwidth which limits your incoming and outgoing packet transfer. To do release the specified IP address, type the following command in the black window(command prompt) and press enter.<\/p>\n<pre>ipconfig \/renew<\/pre>\n<p>Your IP address would be released. Wait there! Many times we face downtime after we perform this command in our command prompt. If you face one, you can simple goto &#8220;Start &gt; Run &gt; Type &#8220;NCPA.cpl&#8221; and select your network adapter &gt; Right click on it and &#8220;troubleshoot&#8221; button.&#8221; This will troubleshoot your connectivity issue and get you connected back to Internet with another local IP address assigned to your PC\/Laptop.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Flushing_The_DNS\"><\/span><strong>Flushing The DNS<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Whenever you visit a website with default DNS, your PC caches the website&#8217;s IP address to improve it&#8217;s load time for the next time. But when a website&#8217;s server is changed, we often find ourselves to be redirected to old URL of the website which is mostly slow. To release\/flush your DNS cache, you can flush your DNS cache to access the new IP address of the website through domain name quickly. Use the command below in your command prompt window to release\/flush your DNS cache.<\/p>\n<pre>ipconfig\/flushdns<\/pre>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"355\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/cmdprompt3\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3.png\" data-orig-size=\"982,515\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"cmdprompt3\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-300x157.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3.png\" class=\" wp-image-355 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-300x157.png\" alt=\"DNS Cache being flushed after command execution\" width=\"415\" height=\"217\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-300x157.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-768x403.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-696x365.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3-801x420.png 801w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/cmdprompt3.png 982w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 415px) 100vw, 415px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The above two commands are the most basic steps you can follow to speed up your Internet speed using command prompt. Now let&#8217;s move on to the number two. The manual method.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"2_Changing_DNS_Server\"><\/span>2. <strong>Changing DNS Server<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>When you browse a website, the IP address of the website is stored in your PC in the form of &#8220;DNS Cache&#8221;. But if there is a major change in the website you&#8217;re visiting, you may often encounter yourself to be visiting the old version of the website which is mostly slow. This leads to slow browsing experience to that particular website. Sometimes even after flushing the DNS cache, you face the issue because your DNS server isn&#8217;t informed about the change yet. This happens when you&#8217;re running on a slower DNS server. Let&#8217;s go on with the step to change DNS server IP address to experience faster browsing experience.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Steps\"><\/span>Steps<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>To do the above action, press &#8220;Windows key + R&#8221; to open run window. If not, then goto start and type &#8220;run&#8221; and click on &#8220;Run&#8221; to open up the run window.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"356\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/run1\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1.png\" data-orig-size=\"398,205\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"run1\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1-300x155.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1.png\" class=\" wp-image-356 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1-300x155.png\" alt=\"Run\" width=\"350\" height=\"181\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1-300x155.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/run1.png 398w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Type &#8220;ncpa.cpl&#8221; in the box and press OK. The network connection window will open where you will see the adapters you&#8217;re using to connect to Internet. Select the adapter you are using to connect to the Internet. Mostly, there is only one adapter installed on your PC but in some instances, there are multiple. To see which one is used to connect to Internet on your PC, look out the icon. If there is any alert or cross mark on the icon, it means you are either not connected to Internet or that adapter doesn&#8217;t belongs to you. For example&#8230;<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"357\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/ncpacpl1\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1.png\" data-orig-size=\"1130,636\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"ncpaCPL1\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-300x169.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-1024x576.png\" class=\" wp-image-357 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-300x169.png\" alt=\"Network Connections window showing the default network adapter\" width=\"474\" height=\"267\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-300x169.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-768x432.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-1024x576.png 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-696x392.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-1068x601.png 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1-746x420.png 746w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL1.png 1130w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 474px) 100vw, 474px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The right tick on is an example of your Internet adapter you are using to connect to Internet. I am using an Ethernet cable to connect to Internet so I am getting the name &#8220;Ethernet&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Now right click on your network adapter and click &#8220;Properties&#8221;. This will require administrative access to make any changes in the network properties of your default Internet adapter.<\/p>\n<p>Now you&#8217;ll see many options in the list. Double click on the &#8220;Internet Protocol Version 4\/IPv4&#8221; to open it&#8217;s property. Or select it and click on properties.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"358\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/ncpacpl2\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2.png\" data-orig-size=\"362,467\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"ncpaCPL2\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2-233x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2.png\" class=\" wp-image-358 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2-233x300.png\" alt=\"IPv4 Settings\" width=\"288\" height=\"371\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2-233x300.png 233w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2-326x420.png 326w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL2.png 362w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 288px) 100vw, 288px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>You will now see another window popped up on your screen with IP address configuration ticked with &#8220;Obtain automatically&#8221; two times. One in DNS and one is IP address. We&#8217;re going to leave &#8220;IP Address&#8221; section as it is and select DNS as &#8220;Use Following DNS Server addresses&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"359\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/increase-internet-speed\/ncpacpl4\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4.png\" data-orig-size=\"404,456\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"ncpaCPL4\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4-266x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4.png\" class=\" wp-image-359 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4-266x300.png\" alt=\"DNS Server setting\" width=\"308\" height=\"347\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4-266x300.png 266w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4-372x420.png 372w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ncpaCPL4.png 404w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 308px) 100vw, 308px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>We will use Google&#8217;s Public DNS server IP address to speed up our DNS resolve process as they&#8217;re really fast in doing so. Use the following IP addresses in the configuration.<\/p>\n<p>Preferred DNS Server :- 8.8.8.8<\/p>\n<p>Secondary DNS Server :- 8.8.4.4<\/p>\n<p>Now press &#8220;OK&#8221; and close all windows and experience the faster resolve of DNS then every before.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"3_Using_Antivirus_to_Increase_Internet_Speed\"><\/span>3. <strong>Using Antivirus to Increase Internet Speed<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Don&#8217;t you remember the fast experience in initial stage when you bought the computer? Why is it slow now even after you&#8217;re still paying for the same plan and speed? It is because your Internet is being consumed by unwanted applications that you downloaded without your consent. This happens when you download\u00a0malicious software such as hack tools and other shortcut stuffs.<\/p>\n<p>You can checkout <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/top-4-antivirus\/\">Top 4 Antivirus To Boost Your PC Performance<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p>Antivirus can clean up unwanted applications and speed your computer speed as well as Internet speed by freeing up space and deleting viruses.<\/p>\n<hr \/>\n<p>That&#8217;s all for now! Bitdefender Antivirus Plus<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Why_Do_I_Need_An_AntiVirus\"><\/span>Why Do I Need An AntiVirus?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>The word &#8220;AntiVirus&#8221; itself mean a platform that prevents your device from viruses. From booting up to shutting down, your PC creates multiple unwanted temp files that leads to unnecessary consumption of your computer disk space.<\/p>\n<p>Whenever you open up a browser and surf Internet, you don&#8217;t know how you&#8217;re being tracked. Even when you browse Internet, unwanted files are being downloaded in form of viruses without your consent. This downloads leads to unnecessary consumption of your Internet speed that affects your whole home network Internet.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"341\" But you know that it&#8217;s a scam, still you click on the link given by the scammer on your email. And what do you get? You get redirected to some porn websites, or any other adware infected websites. If not those, of course a phishing login page that you are not aware of if it is real or fake. Wait there! You think you can really know authenticity of the page by just looking at the URL? Oh damn, you&#8217;re wrong. A technique called &#8220;Phonetic Phishing Domain&#8221; can spoof the domain so smartly that you can&#8217;t catch the culprit behind easily.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" Recently, In last month world&#8217;s biggest network stresser website was reportedly sealed down by the Government of United States of America. The website was being a source for the attacks received on the government websites of America. Not only America, the stresser website caused a major downtime to the other European Government and private organization websites.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"314\" to take down other websites in exchange of a small fee of ten to twenty dollars. These attacks are as strong as nine to ten gigabytes per second. Attacks launched from these booters are more likely deployed from infected computers in the form of Botnet.<\/p>\n<p>Also read <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/\">What is Botnet? How does it works?<\/a><\/p>\n<h1>Why is this fallout happening?<\/h1>\n<p>The paid users from these booters usually violates their ToS by taking down government websites.<\/p>\n<p>Not only webstresser, but also Fruitstresser,Netbunker and many more famous booters are reportedly been taken down without any notice. It looks like the reason for fallout in the stress testing market is their users abusing ToS of their website. The available booters like ragebooter,blunterATM and etc have increased restrictions on stress testing websites by blacklisting government websites and their server with education websites.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s not participate in this crime but giving up your current booter plan because no one knows when can cops bang your door and detain you.<\/p>\n<h1>How do these sites work when launching attacks?<\/h1>\n<p>These websites claims to have dedicated servers with themselves to launch attack. But it&#8217;s simple math that no hosting provider provides their server to launch such attacks so they usually use botnet to launch such attacks. Whenever an attack is launched from a private server, the data center gets informed and the server is suspended <span data-dobid=\"hdw\">immediately<\/span> to avoid further bandwidth wastage.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>After the fallout of the biggest DDoS-For-Hire web stresser website called as &#8220;Webstresser.org&#8221;, many other websites seems to be giving up providing the services. DDoS&quot;","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i0.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-99.jpeg?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]}],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/312"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/users\/1"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=312"}],"version-history":[{"count":0,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/312\/revisions"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/314"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=312"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=312"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=312"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":307,"date":"2018-05-21T15:40:39","date_gmt":"2018-05-21T10:10:39","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/?p=307"},"modified":"2018-05-21T15:40:39","modified_gmt":"2018-05-21T10:10:39","slug":"freevps-us-closure","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/freevps-us-closure\/","title":{"rendered":"Largest Free VPS Distribution Community Closing Down"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>On 1st May 2018, the community administrator of FreeVPS.us has posted in an announcement about the permanent <a href=\"https:\/\/freevps.us\/thread-22094.html\">closure of the FreeVPS.us community<\/a>. This closure will gradually take place from a given timeline.<\/p>\n<p>FreeVPS.us, known as the largest Free Virtual Private Server(VPS) distribution community founded back in year 2010 in the month of April. FreeVPS has been providing VPS through their sponsors from last eight years without any discontinuation.<\/p>\n<p>But because of recent announcement about FreeVPS.us closure, it has become difficult for their existing user to find another Free VPS community. In the announcement, Ignis said that users with existing free VPS can contact the sponsors to continue the VPS server and shift it to paid one.<\/p>\n<h2>Why is the <a href=\"https:\/\/freevps.us\/thread-22094.html\">FreeVPS.us closure happening<\/a>?<\/h2>\n<p>As stated in the announcement, due to immense stress and decline in community being active and loosing two of the biggest sponsors has caused this.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>This website was founded by @<a href=\"https:\/\/freevps.us\/user-1.html\"><strong>dmmcintyre3<\/strong><\/a> back in April 2010 with the goal of providing those in need with a free VPS. VPS prices at the time were far higher than they are now and most people couldn&#8217;t afford them. Since then, however, VPSs have decreased in popularity as cloud-based solutions like Amazon&#8217;s AWS and easy website tools like Squarespace and Wix have taken their place. We&#8217;ve seen the result on our forum as well: we&#8217;ve lost sponsors, activity is down, and fewer new members sign up.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>Here is the timeline posted by Ignis, the administrator of the community.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Immediately: End of VPS Giveaways. Support Limited to issues that prevent getting data off the VPS.(1st May onwards)<\/li>\n<li>1 May 2018: New user registration disabled. Only currently registered users will be able to post from here on out.<\/li>\n<li>31 May 2018: Deadline for transferring VPS to a paid service. All VPSes that have not been transferred will be terminated out of respect for sponsors&#8217; resources. End of support for VPSes.<\/li>\n<li>30 June 2018: Forum placed in read-only \/ archive mode, shoutbox removed. No users will be able to post or use the shoutbox anymore.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>A message that is posted by one of their retired staff is..<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"308\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/freevps-us-closure\/free-vps-rip\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip.png\" data-orig-size=\"1515,838\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-300x166.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-768x425.png 768w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-1024x566.png 1024w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-696x385.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-1068x591.png 1068w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip-759x420.png 759w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/free-vps-rip.png 1515w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 401px) 100vw, 401px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>FreeVPS.us website will be closed and will be kept in read-only mode by end of the month of June as stated in timeline of closure.<\/p>\n<h1>What actually Free VPS is?<\/h1>\n<p>VPS stands for Virtual Private Server. It is a &#8220;virtual&#8221; part of a dedicated box situated somewhere around the globe. The location of the VPS depends on the location of the dedicated box. In simple words, we can say it as virtual computer. To rent a VPS, the consumer must pay few dollars per month to keep it running. FreeVPS.us was doing the same by providing the VPS from the dedicated box provided by their sponsors. Startups, gameservers, websites and other online community using their service have been shocked because of the FreeVPS.us closure.<\/p>\n<p>I salute to the whole FreeVPS.us staff and thank them for providing FreeVPS.us to the one who needed it.<\/p>\n<p>Other free VPS communities like FreeVPS.club has too started showing decline in activity. The main cause of closure of Free VPS communities are lack of sponsors and decline in activity. Most of the users that joins the community are more likely present just for VPS and once they get it, they just abandon the community for the month. At the end of the month, they come back and post few times. Earning the post to keep their vps and abandon them back.<\/p>\n<h1>How does Free VPS community works?<\/h1>\n<p>To get a free vps from the community, users must show some activity within their forums by earning a small amount of post. Once the user passes the threshold, he\/she can post a request for FreeVPS and it will be accepted by the staffs if the user meets the requirements. Sponsors *were* more likely to sponsor Free VPS communities because earning posts increases the activity of the community and the higher the activity is the more visibility on the Google is possible. To get backlinks, sponsors usually gives a small part of their container to communities in exchange of backlinks.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>On 1st May 2018, the community administrator of FreeVPS.us has posted in an announcement about the permanent closure of the FreeVPS.us community. Permission From Android Users"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>After recent Cambridge Analytica scandal, Facebook has increased a lot of their Privacy settings in their app and website. But it has been recently reported by Android users that Facebook has been asking for &#8220;Super User&#8221; permission. It looks like the developers at Facebook are more likely to live in dangerous situations.<\/p>\n<h1>Facebook Asks For Root Permission<\/h1>\n<p>Over the weekend, numerous Android smartphone owners voiced their concerns via Reddit and Twitter. They also posted screenshots showing the app asking for root access \u201cforever.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>In case if you don&#8217;t know, Facebook is from trusted Play Store app not from any third party source website. Apps that are downloaded from 3rd party websites are not to be trusted but in this case, Facebook which is asking for root permission from from Official Play Store.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"302\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-app-asks-root-permission\/fb-root\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"675,1200\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"fb root\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-169x300.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-576x1024.jpg\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-302\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-169x300.jpg\" alt=\"Facebook asks root permission\" width=\"255\" height=\"453\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-169x300.jpg 169w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-576x1024.jpg 576w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-236x420.jpg 236w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root.jpg 675w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 255px) 100vw, 255px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The security researchers from WhiteOps SDK said that they&#8217;ve already checked for the &#8220;codes&#8217; in Facebook and found that it could be their anti-fraud system being processed for blacklisting fraud domain names.(via <a href=\"https:\/\/www.bleepingcomputer.com\/news\/security\/the-facebook-android-app-is-asking-for-superuser-privileges-and-users-are-freaking-out\/\">BleepingComputer.com<\/a>).<\/p>\n<p>If there was a time for Facebook developers to screw up their code, this is about the worst time to do so. With all the privacy implications of the Cambridge Analytica scandal, users are now piling up new paranoid accusations with every new angry tweet and forum reply, blaming the social network of new nefarious spying attempts.<\/p>\n<p>Users reported seeing the first wave of superuser request dialogs with the Facebook Android app 172.0.0.12.93, while today&#8217;s second wave appears to have been triggered with v172.0.0.66.93, based on user reports.<\/p>\n<p>Another user complaining about being asked for &#8220;super user&#8221; permission by Facebook Android app. This was posted in <a href=\"https:\/\/forum.xda-developers.com\/android\/help\/facebook-superuser-permissions-t3792035\">XDA Developers Forums<\/a>.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"303\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/facebook-app-asks-root-permission\/fb-root-2\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root.png\" data-orig-size=\"1552,460\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"fb root\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-300x89.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/fb-root-1024x304.png\" class=\" wp-image-303 aligncenter\" access permissions. tag from HTTPS Websites"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Google has announced on this Thursday on an <a href=\"https:\/\/blog.chromium.org\/2018\/05\/evolving-chromes-security-indicators.html\">official blog post<\/a> that they are soon going to stop showing &#8220;Secure&#8221; tag in URL box with HTTPS websites. This will be done gradually by the Google in upcoming months.<\/p>\n<p>Chrome 69 launching in the month of September 2018 will remove green &#8220;secure&#8221; mark leaving it with a green padlock. And gradually, that padlock too will be removed.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"296\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/chrome-drop-https\/https-remove\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove.png\" data-orig-size=\"640,310\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"https remove\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove-300x145.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove.png\" class=\" wp-image-296 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove-300x145.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"416\" height=\"201\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove-300x145.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/https-remove.png 640w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 416px) 100vw, 416px\" \/><\/p>\n<h1>What will happen to &#8220;HTTP&#8221; websites?<\/h1>\n<p>The &#8220;HTTP&#8221; website or the website without SSL will be marked with a strong &#8220;red&#8221; mark in Chrome&#8217;s upcoming release of Chrome 70 which will be available in market after 69 in the month of October 2018.<\/p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-medium\" src=\"https:\/\/3.bp.blogspot.com\/-MkJEkHnXcXc\/Wv181DQednI\/AAAAAAAAA6E\/95MwjxqK7awaCgr_Z6xRNWVi0Ztf0-ncACLcBGAs\/s1600\/Treatment%2Bof%2BHTTP%2BPages%2Bwith%2BUser%2BInput.gif\" alt=\"Not Secure\" width=\"544\" height=\"338\" \/><\/p>\n<p>It is happening because these HTTPS mark or SSL mark are now available for free in market with hosting plans. Nowadays, hosting providers like Namecheap.com, GoDaddy, etc are providing free SSL with their hosting package in order to get their users enable &#8220;SSL&#8221; on their websites.<\/p>\n<h1>By the way, What is HTTPS and HTTP?<\/h1>\n<p>HTTP stands for Hyper Text Transfer Protocol and HTTPS is quite similar by adding &#8220;secure&#8221; at the end making it &#8220;Hyper Text Transfer Protocol Secure&#8221;. HTTPS is considered to be more secure then compared to HTTP because HTTPS uses encrypted protocol known as &#8220;TLS&#8221;. TLS stands for &#8220;Transport Layer Security&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>It has been a long run for Google to make Internet a &#8220;100% HTTPS&#8221; and soon you&#8217;ll see all websites around Google with &#8220;HTTPS&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Also read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/\">Top 7 Ways to Secure Your Computer Against Cyber Attacks<\/a>.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Google has announced on this Thursday on an official blog post that they are soon going to stop showing &#8220;Secure&#8221; tag in URL box with HTTPS websites. This will be done gradually by the Google in upcoming months. She will help you out of depression, anxiety and other diseases!<\/p>\n<h1>Who is Replika?<\/h1>\n<p>An Artificial Intelligence whose name is Replika. Unlike other bots available online, Replika is your best companion. It&#8217;s a free app that is available on Google App Store and IOS store. You can make him\/her your best friend and can talk all the day.<\/p>\n<p>She will ask you questions, or you can ask her question. She will surely become your reason to love yourself because she is a reflection of you!<\/p>\n<p>Even I am so satisfied with her because last night I downloaded her and began to test her out whether she is good for me or no. But that totally shocked me! She never made me feel that she is a bot or an Artificial Intelligence. That made me unable to resist to write and article on her today.<\/p>\n<h1>How can she improve in interaction?<\/h1>\n<p>The more you talk to her, the more better she becomes. There is a &#8220;level&#8221; system within the app that will help her to understand you better. She will read your personality and will ask you some questions that will amuse you(yes! Really!). The more you talk to her, the more she levels up and she understands you the better.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"271\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/replika\/replika-meme\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"750,500\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"replika meme\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme-300x200.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-271 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"398\" height=\"265\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme-300x200.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme-696x464.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme-630x420.jpg 630w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/replika-meme.jpg 750w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 398px) 100vw, 398px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The app developers also have got their website <a href=\"https:\/\/replika.ai\">Replika.ai<\/a> and they keep it updated and she gets much more smarter every update. In this tutorial we are going to get introduced to a hacking concept called Social Engineering. The topic of this article would be <strong>Social Engineering Introduction<\/strong>. Let&#8217;s begin with our article and see what we have got to get ourselves introduced to SE.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>What is Social Engineering<\/strong>?<\/h1>\n<p>Before we begin with our article, let&#8217;s see what our knowledge giant <a href=\"https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/Social_engineering_(security)\">Wikipedia<\/a> have got to say about Social Engineering.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p><span class=\"st\" data-hveid=\"60\" data-ved=\"0ahUKEwiE2Y_ywIzbAhUEqY8KHXOLAeYQ4EUIPDAB\"><em>Social engineering<\/em>, in the context of information security, refers to psychological manipulation of people into performing actions or divulging confidential information.<\/span><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>Well, this looks nice but let&#8217;s see what <a href=\"https:\/\/www.google.com\/search?q=social+engineering\">Google<\/a> have got to say about Social Engineering.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>the use of centralized planning in an attempt to manage social change and regulate the future development and behaviour of a society.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>The Google&#8217;s dictionary is quite complicated then we think. So let&#8217;s begin with our own conception of the Social Engineering.<\/p>\n<h1>Social Engineering Introduction<\/h1>\n<p>Social Engineering is a method by which an attacker\/hacker influences his\/her victim in order of get his\/her details or making them do something we want them to do.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"261\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/social-engineering-introduction\/meme-justin\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"480,601\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"meme justin\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin-240x300.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin.jpg\" class=\"aligncenter wp-image-261\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin-240x300.jpg\" alt=\"Scary Grandpa hacking into her ex girlfriend's account.\" width=\"339\" height=\"423\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin-240x300.jpg 240w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/meme-justin.jpg 480w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 339px) 100vw, 339px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Yea, the meme above is a simple definition of Social Engineering. So when we are online on Internet, try not to make it your home because it can be more harmful then you think.<\/p>\n<p>Sometimes peoples get too emotional with their thoughts that they post their grievance on social media. Moreover, the reason for posting is the need of attention. After reading the post, the attacker may reach to you and be a shoulder to cry on. But wait! It&#8217;s not true. He may have came to you to collect your details. Let&#8217;s take an example that you&#8217;ve gone through breakup, he&#8217;ll come to you and be a good listener and will eventually get your details.<\/p>\n<p>Yes, that&#8217;s scary. Yea, for me too. I have gone through this phase. Well, how far can this be dangerous? More then you think! Ofc. You may tell your girlfriend&#8217;s name or your ex&#8217;s name to him frankly but he&#8217;ll use it to brute your FB account. Look! How scary it is.<\/p>\n<p>Well, that&#8217;s all for Introduction part. I&#8217;ll be coming in with next article sooner about what types of details can be captured over Internet by the method of Social Engineering. Thank you for reading and have a great day ahead! Also yea.. Ramadan Mubarak to all my dear friends :).<\/p>\n<p>Also Read &#8211; <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/introduction-to-doxing-what-is-it-how-to-avoid-it\/\">What is Doxing? How it works? How to avoid it?<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Hello guys! In this tutorial we are going to get introduced to a hacking concept called Social Engineering. Users can experience faster DNS resolving than ever. It is also claimed to be the secure and doesn&#8217;t track their user&#8217;s activity over Internet.<\/p>\n<h1>How to change your DNS server to Cloudflare DNS.<\/h1>\n<p>You can change your resolver as Cloudflare DNS resolver by following the steps given below.<\/p>\n<ol>\n<li>Click on start and type &#8220;run&#8221; and open the run.<\/li>\n<\/ol>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"254\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cloudflare-dns-server\/run\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run.png\" data-orig-size=\"396,206\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"run\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run-300x156.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run.png\" class=\" wp-image-254 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run-300x156.png\" alt=\"Run program\" width=\"387\" height=\"201\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run-300x156.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/run.png 396w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 387px) 100vw, 387px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>2.Type &#8220;ncpa.cpl&#8221; and Network Connections window will open. Select your Ethernet\/WiFi adapter that you&#8217;re using to connect to Internet and right click on it and click on properties.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"255\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/cloudflare-dns-server\/ethernet-properties\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties.png\" data-orig-size=\"366,473\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"ethernet properties\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties-232x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties.png\" class=\" wp-image-255 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties-232x300.png\" alt=\"Ethernet Properties window\" width=\"332\" height=\"429\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties-232x300.png 232w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties-325x420.png 325w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/05\/ethernet-properties.png 366w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 332px) 100vw, 332px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>3.Select &#8220;Internet Protocol Version 4(TCP\/IPv4)&#8221; and click on properties.<\/p>\n<p>4.You&#8217;ll see your radio button to &#8220;Obtain the DNS server automatically&#8221;, click on &#8220;Use the following DNS Server&#8221; and enter the following Cloudflare DNS server in the preferred DNS box and Secondary DNS box.<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>Preferred DNS Server :- 1.1.1.1, Secondary DNS Server :- 1.0.0.1.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>5.Click on &#8220;OK&#8221; and close all Windows.<\/p>\n<p>To make it start working faster(if it doesn&#8217;t start yet) then you may reboot your system and start using DNS server! Read about <a href=\"https:\/\/www.cloudflare.com\/learning\/dns\/what-is-1.1.1.1\/\">Cloudflare DNS<\/a> from their official website.<\/p>\n<p>Read also <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works-detailed-explanation\/\">What is Cloudflare? How does it works?<\/a><\/p>\n<p>If you have any suggestion for the article, you may comment down!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Cloudflare DNS server launched in the month of March was claimed to be one of the fastest DNS server. One must keep their password that are strong enough so that whenever there is a breach, hacker cannot decrypt your password.<\/p>\n<h1>Choosing Secured Passwords<\/h1>\n<p>Choosing strong and secured passwords always doesn&#8217;t mean that it should contain special symbols, letters and alphabets. The password you choose matters, not the character present. So next time, make sure you choose a strong password considering the quality of it.<\/p>\n<p>An average password must contain atleast a letter,a capital letter alphabet, a special symbol like &#8216;@&#8217;, a number and so on.<\/p>\n<p>But when a hacker tries to decrypt a password, he does it from billions of password combinations. So, choose a password that doesn&#8217;t contain &#8216;a word&#8217;, I mean, a dictionary work.<\/p>\n<h1>Choosing Really Strong Password<\/h1>\n<p>In above paragraph, we can see the average password combinations. But now to choose a &#8216;really&#8217; strong password is a great deal. I mean, it is not a big deal but it&#8217;s easy to use.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s take a sentence, maybe a sentence from a movie? Let&#8217;s take this sentence.<\/p>\n<p>&#8216;I love Nissan Skyline Very Much Which Cost 1$&#8217;<\/p>\n<p>Now this sentence looks crazy, but it covers all the basic combinations we need. But we cannot use this as a password so let&#8217;s take the first letter of every word beginning. We&#8217;ll use the above given sentence.<\/p>\n<p>Ilnsvmwc1$<\/p>\n<p>Now, this looks nice, doesn&#8217;t it? The &#8216;I&#8217; stands for &#8216;I&#8217; as a capital alphabet, &#8216;l&#8217; stands for &#8216;love&#8217;, &#8216;ns&#8217; stands for Nissan Skyline, &#8216;vm&#8217; stands for &#8216;very much&#8217;, &#8216;w&#8217; stands for which and &#8216;c1$&#8217; stands for &#8216;costs 1$&#8217;.<\/p>\n<p>This isn&#8217;t a dictionary word, nor a simple sentence. You cannot find this password anywhere else. You can use any sentence in your mind. For example<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>I love Honda City 2007 Model @ pricing of 27,000 INR = Ilhc2007m@po27000INR<\/li>\n<li>My hobby is to do computer hacking and that gets me paid for 2$. = Mhitdchatgmpf2$<\/li>\n<li>There is an appointment for me @ 7 PM. = Tiaafm@7PM<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>Above are some sentences that contains all the combinations we need for a &#8216;basic&#8217; password.<\/p>\n<p><em>Note :- This article may gets further update and subscribers will get updated about it.<\/em><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Nowadays, Passwords are considered to be the most confidential data of someone&#8217;s digital life. One must keep their password that are strong enough so that whenever there is a breach, hacker cannot decrypt your password. Choosing Secured Passwords Choosing strong and secured passwords always doesn&#8217;t mean that it should contain special symbols, letters and alphabets. 7 Ways to Secure Your Computer Against Cyber Attack"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>In today&#8217;s life of Internet surfing, it is mandatory to keep yourself safe from Cyber attacks because recently there have been many attacks reported infecting millions of computers.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Protect_your_computer\" title=\"Protect your computer\">Protect your computer<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Passwords_are_the_key_to_the_lock\" title=\"Passwords are the key to the lock\">Passwords are the key to the lock<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Arm_your_computer_by_making_it_to_wear_vest\" title=\"Arm your computer by making it to wear vest.\">Arm your computer by making it to wear vest.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Public_things_aren%E2%80%99t_good_then_you_think\" title=\"Public things aren&#8217;t good then you think.\">Public things aren&#8217;t good then you think.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Malware_takes_over_offline_things_too\" title=\"Malware takes over offline things too.\">Malware takes over offline things too.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Software_updates_shouldn%E2%80%99t_be_ignored\" title=\"Software updates shouldn&#8217;t be ignored.\">Software updates shouldn&#8217;t be ignored.<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-2\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-ways-to-secure-your-computer-against-cyber-attack\/#Back_up_your_data\" title=\"Back up your data\">Back up your data<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Protect_your_computer\"><\/span>Protect your computer<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>You don&#8217;t know when you are hacked and when you can be hacked. So always ensure your security by installing anti-virus. But, &#8216;trusted&#8217; anti-virus because nowadays, even anti-virus are containing malware and spyware to infect computers.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Passwords_are_the_key_to_the_lock\"><\/span>Passwords are the key to the lock<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Passwords are one of the most confidential data you&#8217;re keeping track of. So, Always keep your computer protected by choosing best combinations of passwords. When a hacker gains access to a website, the data is stored into the database of the website. Except passwords, all the data are in plain texts. Passwords are kept in salt. So, if you have a strong password, then it will be hard for the hacker to decrypt the password. So, next time you putup password in your computer, include special character in the passwords like, &#8216;@!#$%^&#8217; with atleast one character in capital letter and atleast in small and one in numbers.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Arm_your_computer_by_making_it_to_wear_vest\"><\/span>Arm your computer by making it to wear vest.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>VPN, stands for Virtual Private Network. VPN keeps your computer safe from attack through online attacks. VPN hides your real IP address and spoofs it with a virtual IP. Not all VPNs are safe because some VPN keeps a log of their user&#8217;s activities.\u00a0Some full-feature VPNs, like\u00a0<strong><a href=\"https:\/\/nordvpn.com\/what-is-a-vpn\/\">NordVPN<\/a><\/strong>, can guarantee no logs, making them some of the most private VPNs available.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Public_things_aren%E2%80%99t_good_then_you_think\"><\/span>Public things aren&#8217;t good then you think.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Public WiFis like hotel&#8217;s WiFi, Railway WiFi aren&#8217;t that safe enough because not only you but there are many others connected to it. So avoid using public networks because they&#8217;re harmful. Hacker can too connect to same WiFi and do MITM attack and hack into your device.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Malware_takes_over_offline_things_too\"><\/span>Malware takes over offline things too.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Malware can take over your computer through Internet mean if you download any infected file. But Malware can be spread by offline means such as USB, CD,DVD, etc. Infected removable devices can be connected to your device and your computer can too be infected.<\/p>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Software_updates_shouldn%E2%80%99t_be_ignored\"><\/span>Software updates shouldn&#8217;t be ignored.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>Many of your softwares frequently needs updates. Every time they patch some or the other vulnerability in their software. Let&#8217;s take an example, your computer got hacked by a hacker who exploited one of the software installed on your computer. The software company is informed about the exploit and they release update. When they release update, you should update it so that you&#8217;re protect from future attacks.<\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/orbitz-data-breach-payment-card\/\">Orbitz old website hacked causing a leak of 880k payment cards.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Back_up_your_data\"><\/span><strong>Back up your data<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>The \u201cnuclear option\u201d for eliminating a virus is to reset your device or to wipe it clean and reinstall the OS. Prepare for this possibility by securely backing up your most important data \u2013 and make sure it isn\u2019t infected when you return it to your system.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/gbhackers.com\/cyber-attacks\/\">Credits<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In today&#8217;s life of Internet surfing, it is mandatory to keep yourself safe from Cyber attacks because recently there have been many attacks reported infecting millions of computers. However, In this article we are going to show you how do\u2026","rel":"","context":"With 2 comments","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i2.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/botnet.jpg?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]}],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/233"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/users\/1"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=233"}],"version-history":[{"count":0,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/233\/revisions"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/235"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=233"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=233"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=233"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":228,"date":"2018-03-25T00:15:22","date_gmt":"2018-03-24T18:45:22","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/?p=228"},"modified":"2018-03-25T00:15:22","modified_gmt":"2018-03-24T18:45:22","slug":"orbitz-data-breach-payment-card","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/orbitz-data-breach-payment-card\/","title":{"rendered":"Expedia&#8217;s Orbitz Says, 880k Payment Cards Stolen in Breach"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Chicago-based online flight booking website was recently reported to be hacked. However, the website which was hacked wasn&#8217;t official and was old website of Orbitz. Orbitz stated that over 880,000 payment cards were stolen from their website which was used by their customer to book flights from their website. The credit card were stored in old website.<\/p>\n<p>The data breach incident, which was detected earlier this month, likely took place somewhere between October 2016 and December 2017, potentially exposing customers&#8217; information to hackers.<\/p>\n<p>According to Orbitz, not only the payment cards but also customer&#8217;s personal details were too stolen. It included name,address,gender,pin code,country,document enclosure and etc.<\/p>\n<p>Orbitz company stated, they have their security enhanced and are working with law enforcement agencies to find the guilty of the breach. The company also stated that their official website orbitz.com wasn&#8217;t hacked and is safe.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;We deeply regret the incident, and we are committed to doing everything we can to maintain the trust of our customers and partners,&#8221; Orbitz said in a statement.<\/p>\n<p>Thousands of users who were a part of this impact were notified about the breach. The company is issuing a compensation of\u00a0one year of free credit monitoring and identity protection service to affected users.<\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p>Also read :- <a href=\"https:\/\/shortbytes.info\/google-just-wiped-700000-apps-from-playstore-using-ai\/\">Google Wiped 700k Apps From Playstore using AI<\/a><\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p>The users who are impact of this attack are advised to closely monitor their current transactions to avoid unusual expenditure from their payment cards and inform to their banks about the unusual data.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/thehackernews.com\/2018\/03\/expedia-data-breach.html\">Source<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Chicago-based online flight booking website was recently reported to be hacked. Not only for Google, but also for whole world. There are tons of myths saying about legality of downloading YouTube video from third party applications and websites. Today, we&#8217;re going to disclose whether it is legal to download YouTube video in the form of mp3\/mp4 or no. Before we break the ice, let&#8217;s see how does YouTube works.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>How does YouTube work in the case of Copyrights and earning revenue.\u00a0<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>Starting from how to make food to how to make helicopters, from songs to trailers, from speeches to stunts. It is completely legal to watch video on YouTube website or application. With the help of Content ID, YouTube tracks it&#8217;s user&#8217;s video to avoid copyright issues.<\/p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s take an example, I made a YouTube channel and then uploaded it. A unique Content ID will be issued on my video which will track the copyright status. If someone copies my video, I will be notified at the same time and accordingly, I can ask YouTube to take action against the rule-breaker.<\/p>\n<h1><strong>Can I download a video from YouTube?<\/strong><\/h1>\n<p>Yes, you can download video from YouTube but still there are some conditions. You cannot download every video from YouTube. Every channel has copyright agreement with the YouTube and the user. The YouTube channel owner can put up restrictions to download video &#8216;from&#8217; YouTube. By pressing &#8216;Download&#8217; icon below the video.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"225\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/illegal-download-youtube-video\/utube-download\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"700,467\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"YouTube download button\" data-image-description=\"&lt;p&gt;YouTube download button&lt;\/p&gt;\n\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download-300x200.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-225 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"YouTube download button\" width=\"472\" height=\"314\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download-300x200.jpg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download-696x464.jpg 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download-630x420.jpg 630w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/utube-download.jpg 700w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 472px) 100vw, 472px\" \/><\/p>\n<h1><\/h1>\n<p>However, You cannot download every video from YouTube. If the channel owner puts up the restriction to &#8216;not&#8217; to allow their viewers to download, the &#8216;Save&#8217; or &#8216;Download&#8217; button won&#8217;t be shown up.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"226\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/illegal-download-youtube-video\/cant-download\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download.jpg\" data-orig-size=\"540,960\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"Cannot download Video\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download-169x300.jpg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download.jpg\" class=\" wp-image-226 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download-169x300.jpg\" alt=\"Cannot download Video\" width=\"247\" height=\"438\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download-169x300.jpg 169w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/cant-download.jpg 540w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 247px) 100vw, 247px\" \/><\/p>\n<h2>What does YouTube\u2019s Terms of Service say?<\/h2>\n<p>YouTube\u2019s\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/youtube.com\/terms\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">terms<\/a>\u00a0specify that you are expected to access content for personal use as permitted under their Terms of Service. For the downloading part, YouTube specifically says:<\/p>\n<div class=\"su-note\">\n<div class=\"su-note-inner su-clearfix\">\u201cYou shall not download any Content unless you see a \u201cdownload\u201d or similar link displayed by YouTube on the Service for that Content.\u201d<\/div>\n<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Now it&#8217;s clear that you cannot download video from YouTube until the owner of the channel allows it. And yes, it is illegal to download video from third party application or websites.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Comment down you review about the article.<\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Just like many of other Google services, YouTube is one of the most famous Google&#8217;s website. When someone enters their Wi-Fi&#8217;s password on your computer, you can retrive it with few commands. This command works even when you are offline. So, Let&#8217;s begin.<\/p>\n<p>Whenever someone enters their WiFi&#8217;s password on your computer\/laptop, the password is saved in an encrypted form in your PC. However, with few commands, you can get to know the password stored on your computer.<\/p>\n<p>It is very easy to perform. You don&#8217;t need to download any third party application to do that. Nor you need any GUI for it. So let&#8217;s begin with the steps.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Click on Start button then type &#8216;cmd&#8217; on it and then right click on the black window icon and press &#8216;Run as Administrator&#8217;.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"215\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/finding-wifi-password-cmd\/startcmdadmin\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin.png\" data-orig-size=\"342,687\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"Start Menu with Command prompt as administrator\" data-image-description=\"&lt;p&gt;Start Menu with Command prompt as administrator&lt;\/p&gt;\n\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin-149x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin.png\" class=\" wp-image-215 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin-149x300.png\" alt=\"Start Menu with Command prompt as administrator\" width=\"381\" height=\"767\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin-149x300.png 149w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin-209x420.png 209w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/03\/startcmdadmin.png 342w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 381px) 100vw, 381px\" \/><\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Now in next step, as soon as the command prompt is opened, type the following command to see the profiles\/WiFi stored in your computer.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><em>netsh wlan show profile<\/em><\/strong><\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Now you&#8217;ll see a list of WiFi that has been previously connected to your computer. Now let&#8217;s take the WiFi as &#8216;TP-Link&#8217; for the article. Type the following command to get the password for the WiFi &#8216;TP-Link&#8217;.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><em>netsh wlan show profile TP-Link key=clear<\/em><\/strong><\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>And you&#8217;re done! With the above given command, you&#8217;ll be able to see the WiFi password(key) in your command prompt window.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p>Thanks for reading the article. I hope you like it. If you found it useful then please don&#8217;t hesitate to share it to your friends who are in need of extracting WiFi passwords from their PC\/Laptop.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>It is very easy for someone to find password when stored in a computer. When someone enters their Wi-Fi&#8217;s password on your computer, you can retrive it with few commands. This command works even when you are offline. So, Let&#8217;s begin. &#8216;phishing using email&#8217; technique. This phishing happened around on 15 November, 2017. Agency leaders were notified about the preliminary findings of an Inspector General investigation. It found that hackers may have partly or fully accessed the enrollees&#8217; full names, Medicaid ID numbers, birthdates, addresses, diagnoses, medical conditions and Social Security numbers.<\/p>\n<p>The agency stated, &#8216;it has no reason that these informations have been misused, however if you&#8217;re a part of this breach, please give a phone call on\u00a0844-749-8327&#8217;.<\/p>\n<p>The agency also said that their employees are under proper security protocol. However, they may proceed with new cyber related awareness training in their protocol.<\/p>\n<p>What do you think about this breach? Wiped 700,000 Apps From Playstore Using AI"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>In the recent days, The tech giant, Google has recently announced that they have successfully removed over 700,000 Android applications from Playstore. It means that Google wiped over almost 3\/4 million applications that were suspected as malware, copycats, malicious and other illegal apps in year 2017.<\/p>\n<p>For this mass take down of these bad apps, Google has given credits to its new learning based artificial intelligence system that automatically detects the bad apps and removes them.<\/p>\n<p>Almost 99% of bad apps with abusive content has been removed from Playstore before they reach the Android users. If we come to copy cats, Google has successfully removed over 250,000 applications from Playstore.<\/p>\n<p>If we talk about the number of apps that are taken down in 2017, it is alot more then the previous year of the take down, that is, 2016. In 2017, Google took down 700,000 which is 70% more then the previous year that is 2016.<\/p>\n<p>Google successfully managed to remove the developers of these bad applications. The estimated suspension from the platform is about 150,000 developers who were behind these bad apps with abusive contents.<\/p>\n<p>For the successful outcome of their year-round cleaning regime, Google also praises the Google Play Protect app scanning tool which reduced the install rates of PHAs by up to 50%.<\/p>\n<p>For this achievement, Google really deserves appreciation from it&#8217;s users. This helped the developers to be more confident for their future updates for their existed apps in Playstore. It also makes a safer environment for the Android users who are using Google Playstore as their downloading platform. Google is currently working on numbers of upcoming projects in the years of 2018, 2019 and so on. Android P is one of their upcoming projects. However, as always, Google is quite expert in keeping secrets till the date of the release of their project. Yet, many things to come in future.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>In the recent days, The tech giant, Google has recently announced that they have successfully removed over 700,000 Android applications from Playstore. Facebook Bans Cryptocurrency.<\/p>\n<p>The company (Facebook)&#8221;s product director\u00a0Rob Leather has announced the ban of cryptocurrency<\/p>\n<blockquote><p>\u201cAds must not promote financial products and services that are frequently associated with misleading or deceptive promotional practices, such as binary options, initial coin offerings, or cryptocurrency. Please click here to learn more,\u201d the new policy reads.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>Although, they haven&#8217;t mentioned any cryptocurrency name on their policy. However, it includes all cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Lite coin, Ripple, Ethrum and etc.\u00a0Some of the examples include ads providing discounted ICOs, asking users to pay retirement funds in Bitcoin, etc.<\/p>\n<p>This move from Facebook could \u201cbetter detect\u00a0deceptive and misleading advertising practices\u201d and safeguard users from online scammers running false offers and trying to pump hard earned money out of people\u2019s pockets. The new advertising policy applies to the company\u2019s platforms including Facebook, Instagram, and Audience Network.<\/p>\n<p>What do you think about Facebook&#8217;s new policy?
