In this article we are going to learn about what is botnet and how does it works. You may have heard about peoples saying that they DDoS\u2019ed their target\/victims with their botnet and took them down. However, In this article we are going to show you how do\u2026","rel":"","context":"With 2 comments","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i2.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/botnet.jpg?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]}],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/192"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/users\/1"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=192"}],"version-history":[{"count":0,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/192\/revisions"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/193"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=192"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=192"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=192"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":187,"date":"2018-01-30T00:09:39","date_gmt":"2018-01-29T18:39:39","guid":{"rendered":"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/?p=187"},"modified":"2018-01-30T00:09:39","modified_gmt":"2018-01-29T18:39:39","slug":"google-fined-2-7-billion-manipulating-search-results","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/google-fined-2-7-billion-manipulating-search-results\/","title":{"rendered":"Google Fined For $2.7 Billion For Manipulating Search Results"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Google has been fined by\u00a0European antitrust officials for unfairly manipulating search results since 2008. Google fined over 2.7 billion USD which has broken all the records.<\/p>\n<p>After a long, seven year investigation that began in 2007, after several rival complaints, the European commission imposed a record breaking fine to tech giant of over 2.7 billion USD for breaking EU competition law.<\/p>\n<p>by using its search dominance to distort search-engine results to promote own shopping comparison service at the top of all search results.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p>&#8220;Comparison shopping services rely to a large extent on traffic to be competitive.&#8221; European Commission says in a\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/europa.eu\/rapid\/press-release_IP-17-1784_en.htm\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">press release<\/a>.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p>&#8220;The evidence shows that consumers click far more often on results that are more visible, i.e. the results appearing higher up in Google&#8217;s search results. More traffic leads to more clicks and generates revenue.&#8221;<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>The Commission says the amount of penalty has been calculated from Google\u2019s income from its comparison shopping service in Europe. Google\u2019s total revenue in the year 2016 was almost $90 Billion.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"190\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/google-fined-2-7-billion-manipulating-search-results\/google-antitrust-fine\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine.png\" data-orig-size=\"728,380\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"google-antitrust-fine\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine-300x157.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine.png\" class=\"size-medium wp-image-190 aligncenter\" src=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine-300x157.png\" alt=\"Google manipulating\" width=\"300\" height=\"157\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine-300x157.png 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine-696x363.png 696w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/google-antitrust-fine.png 728w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>On other hand, EU commission has ordered Google to stop it&#8217;s illegal conduct and anti-competitive practice before 3 months or would have to face more penalty to the Google&#8217;s parent company, The Alphabet.<\/p>\n<p>So now Google will have to change its search ranking algorithm. However, the tech giant may appeal to the EU court to delay the resolutions till 2019 or further years.<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p>&#8220;We respectfully disagree with the conclusions announced today. We will review the Commission\u2019s decision in detail as we consider an appeal, and we look forward to continuing to make our case.&#8221; Google Spokesperson said in a statement.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote><p>What do you think? Comment down!<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote><p><a href=\"https:\/\/thehackernews.com\/2017\/06\/google-search-antitrust-fine.html?m=1\">Source<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Google has been fined by\u00a0European antitrust officials for unfairly manipulating search results since 2008. Google fined over 2.7 billion USD which has broken all the records. Google launches &#8216;Google Bulletin&#8217; platform as a news platform on Google.<\/p>\n<p>Google Bulletin is an effort to provide more relevant news to its readers by letting netizens to write their news and post it on Google Bulletin. It allows the author to add post, edit, add media pictures, add thumbnail and alot more using an application. So normally, Bulletin is a people-powered platform until Google hires a number of reporters.<\/p>\n<p>Once the author posts his news, he\/she can share his\/her news via any social networking platform such as Facebook, Google, Twitter, etc.<\/p>\n<p>However, one of the things that are of concern is how Google would ensure the authenticity of the content shared by those self-declared neighborhood reporters. Also, they aren\u2019t the first to come up with a citizen reporter app, but the Google branding might make it easier for Bulletin to cover a large ambit and get a strong user base.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"184\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/google-bulletin-launched\/images-96\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96.jpeg\" data-orig-size=\"444,332\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"Author writing\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96-300x224.jpeg\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96.jpeg\" class=\"size-medium wp-image-184 aligncenter\" src=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96-300x224.jpeg\" alt=\"Author\" width=\"300\" height=\"224\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96-300x224.jpeg 300w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96-80x60.jpeg 80w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96-265x198.jpeg 265w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/01\/images-96.jpeg 444w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>Before making it public and being possessed around the globe, Google is currently running &#8216;Google Bulletin&#8217; in\u00a0Nashville, Tennessee, and Oakland, California as a trial run. If anyone like to enroll themselves earlier, they may follow the link given below.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/posts.google.com\/bulletin\/share\">https:\/\/posts.google.com\/bulletin\/share<\/a><\/p>\n<p>What do you think about it&#8217;s recent release? 2018:Intel Launches Its First 8th Gen Chips With AMD Graphics"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>At the\u00a0Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2018, Intel has <a href=\"https:\/\/newsroom.intel.com\/news\/8th-gen-intel-core-radeon-rx-vega-m-graphics\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">officially released its first 8th Generation Intel Core processor with AMD Radeon RX Vega M Graphics.<\/a><\/p>\n<p>This unrivalled release of Intel was reported earlier and it was presumed as an effort of tackling down the increasing competition against Nividia.<\/p>\n<p>This 8th Gen Intel Core Chip will be available with the following specifications such as :-<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>8<sup>th<\/sup>\u00a0Gen Intel Core processor with Radeon\u2122 RX Vega M GL Graphics (65W total power)<\/li>\n<li>8<sup>th<\/sup>\u00a0Gen Intel Core processor with Radeon\u2122 RX Vega M GH Graphics (100W total power)<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p><a title=\"\" chip combines Intel quad-core CPU, Radeon RX Vega M graphics, and 4GB of dedicated HBM2 using Intel\u2019s\u00a0Embedded Multi-Die Interconnect Bridge (EMIB) technology.<\/p>\n<p>Any suggestions? But finding out admin login is of no use if you don&#8217;t even know what the actual URL is? Finding out admin panel login is now pain in the ass for security researchers. Manually searching out for admin login may take 5-6 hours for finding. But there are many tools available on the Internet that gets your thing done!<\/p>\n<p>Breacher is a admin panel finder which helps the individual to find out the admin panel in seconds.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-1\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/breacher-an-advanced-admin-panel-finder\/#Breacher\" title=\"Breacher\">Breacher<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/breacher-an-advanced-admin-panel-finder\/#Features\" title=\"Features\">Features<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/breacher-an-advanced-admin-panel-finder\/#Usages\" title=\"Usages\">Usages<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/breacher-an-advanced-admin-panel-finder\/#Video_Demo\" title=\"Video Demo\">Video Demo<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h1><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Breacher\"><\/span>Breacher<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h1>\n<p>A script to find admin login pages and EAR vulnerabilites.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Features\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-features\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/UltimateHackers\/Breacher#features\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>Features<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<ul class=\"contains-task-list\">\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Multi-threading on demand<\/li>\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Big path list (482 paths)<\/li>\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Supports php, asp and html extensions<\/li>\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Checks for potential EAR vulnerabilites<\/li>\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Checks for robots.txt<\/li>\n<li class=\"task-list-item\"><input id=\"\" class=\"task-list-item-checkbox\" checked=\"checked\" disabled=\"disabled\" type=\"checkbox\" \/>\u00a0Support for custom patns<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Usages\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-usages\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/UltimateHackers\/Breacher#usages\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>Usages<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Check all paths with php extension<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<pre><code>python breacher -u example.com --type php\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<ul>\n<li>Check all paths with php extension with threads<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<pre><code>python breacher -u example.com --type php --fast\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<ul>\n<li>Check all paths without threads<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<pre><code>python breacher -u example.com\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<ul>\n<li>Adding a custom path. For example if you want all paths to start with \/data (example.com\/data\/&#8230;) you can do this:<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<pre><code>python breacher -u example.com --path \/data\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<p><b>Note:\u00a0<\/b>When you specify an extension using\u00a0<b>&#8211;type<\/b>\u00a0option, Breacher includes paths of that extension as well as paths with no extensions like\u00a0<b>\/admin\/login<\/b><\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Video_Demo\"><\/span><a id=\"user-content-video-demo\" class=\"anchor\" href=\"https:\/\/github.com\/UltimateHackers\/Breacher#video-demo\" aria-hidden=\"true\"><\/a>Video Demo<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/youtu.be\/BEpt5JmcWPk\"><img src=\"https:\/\/camo.githubusercontent.com\/7218447f90eb626477f4c38921f6ee2ede3583a7\/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f44396d793941352e706e67\" alt=\"Breacher\" data-canonical-src=\"https:\/\/i.imgur.com\/D9my9A5.png\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Many security researchers are nowadays engaged in security testing. Finding out admin panel login is now Shodan is named after evil computer in a video game called &#8220;System Shock&#8221;. As in present, Shodan is named after the evil computer of the video game of System Shock. Also Shodan is considered as the scariest search engine on the Internet for IoT devices.<\/p>\n<p>Shodan shows you what Google doesn&#8217;t. It is designed for an aim to connect all the IoT devices to its website. It takes less then a second to search thousands of databases around the world and check for the query. Shodan works by collecting the HTTP requests from various devices linked to the Internet and indexes it. The indexing is based on Country,OS, Brand and etc.<\/p>\n<p>Shodan&#8217;s power can be assumed by its ability to collect datas. It can collect the data of traffic light,CCTV cameras,control system of the gas stations, power grids around the globe. Not only these things, but it can also get access to the nuclear power plants which are running on default or no passwords on their system. Most of these public services don&#8217;t even bother to change their default passwords and leave it for possession. And once this is exposed to the hackers,terrorist organizations, it can be disastrous.<\/p>\n<p>If a security camera have telnet installed on its server, then you might want to get it off. Hackers can exploit your camera and access it if it&#8217;s hub is exposed to the Internet using this Search Engine. It isn&#8217;t easy but nor impossible.<\/p>\n<p>There are thousands of devices that are running on default passwords or no password on it at all. Shodan crawls and collects the device&#8217;s IP address and check for the default password, if your system is exposed to the Internet with a default password, and if shodan crawls it, it will get indexed on their search engine.<\/p>\n<p>Shodan is a website that connects all the IoT devices around the globe and also called a paradise for hackers. We hope you don&#8217;t use it for bad purposes! Cheers!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Shodan is called the paradise of hackers which is created by\u00a0John Matherly. About Phone &gt; System Update.&#8221;\u00a0The update of Nokia for Nougat 7.1.2 was firstly reported by GSMArena.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/nokia-new-update-nougat\/#To_recall_the_price,_the_price_of_Nokia_6_is_Rs_14,999_in_India_It_features_an_aluminium_unibody_design,_dual_speakers_with_Dolby_Atmos_audio,_and_a_fingerprint_sensor_As_for_specifications,_the_dualSIM_Nokia_6_sports_a_5_5inch_fullHD_(1080%C3%971920_pixels)_IPS_display_with_Corning_Gorilla_Glass_protection_It_is_powered_by_a_Qualcomm_Snapdragon_430_SoC_coupled_with_3GB_of_RAM_The_smartphone_features_a_16megapixel_rear_camera_with_PDAF,_an_f\/2_0_aperture,_a_1micron_pixel_sensor,_and_dualtone_LED_flash_The_Nokia_6_has_an_8megapixel_autofocus_front_camera_with_an_f\/2_0_aperture_and_an_84degree_wideangle_lens\" title=\"To recall the price, the price of Nokia 6 is Rs.14,999 in India. It features an aluminium unibody design, dual speakers with Dolby Atmos audio, and a fingerprint sensor. As for specifications, the dual-SIM Nokia 6 sports a 5.5-inch full-HD (1080&#215;1920 pixels) IPS display with Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 SoC coupled with 3GB of RAM. The smartphone features a 16-megapixel rear camera with PDAF, an f\/2.0 aperture, a 1-micron pixel sensor, and dual-tone LED flash. The Nokia 6 has an 8-megapixel autofocus front camera with an f\/2.0 aperture and an 84-degree wide-angle lens.\">To recall the price, the price of Nokia 6 is Rs.14,999 in India. It features an aluminium unibody design, dual speakers with Dolby Atmos audio, and a fingerprint sensor. As for specifications, the dual-SIM Nokia 6 sports a 5.5-inch full-HD (1080&#215;1920 pixels) IPS display with Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 SoC coupled with 3GB of RAM. The smartphone features a 16-megapixel rear camera with PDAF, an f\/2.0 aperture, a 1-micron pixel sensor, and dual-tone LED flash. The Nokia 6 has an 8-megapixel autofocus front camera with an f\/2.0 aperture and an 84-degree wide-angle lens.<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Nokia_licensee_HMD_Global_seems_to_keep_its_promise_to_bring_regular_update_for_its_users_Nokia_6_is_a_great_comeback_of_Nokia_company_It_also_holds_the_record_of_selling_over_6_million_phone_in_30_seconds_in_China\"><\/span>Nokia licensee HMD Global seems to keep its promise to bring regular update for its users. Nokia 6 is a great comeback of Nokia company. It also holds the record of selling over 6 million phone in 30 seconds in China.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Apart_from_the_new_update_of_Nokia%E2%80%99s_Nougat_of_7_1_2,_it%E2%80%99s_total_data_is_over_665_MB_It_is_now_available_in_public_also\"><\/span>Apart from the new update of Nokia&#8217;s Nougat of 7.1.2, it&#8217;s total data is over 665 MB. It is now available in public also.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"As_the_update_has_just_rolled_out,_it_would_take_few_weeks_to_reach_to_all_the_Nokia_users\"><\/span>As the update has just rolled out, it would take few weeks to reach to all the Nokia users.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"If_Nokia_users_when_to_update_their_android_to_Nougat_7_1_2,_they_may_go_to_%E2%80%9CSetting_%3E_About_Phone_%3E_System_Update_%E2%80%9D_The_update_of_Nokia_for_Nougat_7_1_2_was_firstly_reported_by_GSMArena\"><\/span>If Nokia users when to update their android to Nougat 7.1.2, they may go to <strong>&#8220;Setting &gt; About Phone &gt; System Update.&#8221;\u00a0<\/strong>The update of Nokia for Nougat 7.1.2 was firstly <a href=\"https:\/\/www.gsmarena.com\/android_712_update_starts_hitting_nokia_6-news-27681.php\">reported<\/a> by GSMArena.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"To_recall_the_price,_the_price_of_Nokia_6_is_Rs_14,999_in_India_It_features_an_aluminium_unibody_design,_dual_speakers_with_Dolby_Atmos_audio,_and_a_fingerprint_sensor_As_for_specifications,_the_dualSIM_Nokia_6_sports_a_5_5inch_fullHD_(1080%C3%971920_pixels)_IPS_display_with_Corning_Gorilla_Glass_protection_It_is_powered_by_a_Qualcomm_Snapdragon_430_SoC_coupled_with_3GB_of_RAM_The_smartphone_features_a_16megapixel_rear_camera_with_PDAF,_an_f\/2_0_aperture,_a_1micron_pixel_sensor,_and_dualtone_LED_flash_The_Nokia_6_has_an_8megapixel_autofocus_front_camera_with_an_f\/2_0_aperture_and_an_84degree_wideangle_lens\"><\/span>To recall the price, the price of Nokia 6 is Rs.14,999 in India. It features an aluminium unibody design, dual speakers with Dolby Atmos audio, and a fingerprint sensor. As for specifications, the dual-SIM Nokia 6 sports a 5.5-inch full-HD (1080&#215;1920 pixels) IPS display with Corning Gorilla Glass protection. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 SoC coupled with 3GB of RAM. The smartphone features a 16-megapixel rear camera with PDAF, an f\/2.0 aperture, a 1-micron pixel sensor, and dual-tone LED flash. It is made by a team called &#8220;Ultimate Hackers&#8221; which have once been in the trending list of github for their great repos.<\/p>\n<p>The HashBuster have the following features.<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Detects the hash type.<\/li>\n<li>MD5 Supported<\/li>\n<li>SHA1 Supported<\/li>\n<li>SHA2 Supported<\/li>\n<li>Time efficient decryption<\/li>\n<li>Doesn&#8217;t consume your CPU resources as it is a API based hash cracker.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<h2>Installing and Using Hash Buster<\/h2>\n<p>Open your terminal and enter<\/p>\n<pre><code>git clone https:\/\/github.com\/UltimateHackers\/Hash-Buster\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<p>Now enter the following command<\/p>\n<pre><code>cd Hash-Buster\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<p>Now run Hash Buster by entering<\/p>\n<pre><code>python hash.py\n<\/code><\/pre>\n<p>Now you can enter any non-salter MD5\/SHA1\/SHA2 hash to\u00a0<em>crack<\/em>\u00a0it.<\/p>\n<p><a href=\"https:\/\/camo.githubusercontent.com\/61259f5a4e9bd3a9f4caab8dc447c0682e038424\/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f524356767758362e706e67\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><img src=\"https:\/\/camo.githubusercontent.com\/61259f5a4e9bd3a9f4caab8dc447c0682e038424\/68747470733a2f2f692e696d6775722e636f6d2f524356767758362e706e67\" data-canonical-src=\"https:\/\/i.imgur.com\/RCVvwX6.png\" \/><\/a><\/p>\n<p>Thank you for reading, share your view in the comment box below!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>What is HashBuster? Types Of DDoS Attacks Used By Hackers"},"content":{"rendered":"<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#What_is_Distributed_Denial_of_Service(DDoS)_attack\" title=\"What is Distributed Denial of Service(DDoS) attack?\">What is Distributed Denial of Service(DDoS) attack?<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-3\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#Common_types_of_DDoS_attacks_used_by_hackers\" title=\"Common types of DDoS attacks used by hackers.\">Common types of DDoS attacks used by hackers.<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#UDP_Flood\" title=\"UDP Flood\">UDP Flood<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#SYN_Flood\" title=\"SYN Flood\">SYN Flood<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#Ping_of_Death\" title=\"Ping of Death\">Ping of Death<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#Reflected_Attacks\" title=\"Reflected Attacks\">Reflected Attacks<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#Slowloris\" title=\"Slowloris\">Slowloris<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-ddos-attacks\/#Application_Based_Attacks\" title=\"Application Based Attacks\">Application Based Attacks<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_is_Distributed_Denial_of_Service(DDoS)_attack\"><\/span>What is Distributed Denial of Service(DDoS) attack?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Distributed Denial of Services are a type of cyber attack that is mostly used by hackers to take down servers or websites. It has been a threat for big organizations and companies because in today&#8217;s generation many organizations put up competition against other companies that are making progress then their own&#8217;s. They hire hackers and make them take down their competitors. Not only for competitors, but there are many other reasons why a hacker may take down servers or websites. Like rivalry,paid tasks,just for fun and etc.<\/p>\n<p>Denial of services occurs when a targeted computer\/server is flooded with malicious traffic until the resources are exhausted and the system goes offline. Distributed Denial of Services are much similar with Denial Of Services but the difference is the DDoS i.e Distributed Denial of Service the attack is amplified by enlisting other machines\/servers in the attack to take down the target. Most of large-scale attacks depends on <a href=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/\">botnets<\/a>.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Common_types_of_DDoS_attacks_used_by_hackers\"><\/span>Common types of DDoS attacks used by hackers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"UDP_Flood\"><\/span>UDP Flood<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>User Datagram Protocol that is UDP is a sessionless connection to a network. It is one of the most common type of DDoS attack that can be used in same DoS and DDoS attacks. Random ports are flooded on the target machine and that results the machine to go down.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"SYN_Flood\"><\/span>SYN Flood<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>A &#8220;three type of handshake&#8221;, which is a reference to show how TCP connections work. The SYN-ACK communication type works in three steps and those steps are as follows:<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li>Firstly a &#8220;synchronize&#8221; message is sent to the target machine to start the conversation with the machine.<\/li>\n<li>Secondly, the connection is &#8220;acknowledged&#8221; by the host machine i.e the target machine. After this process, it sends a &#8220;handshake&#8221; request and waits for the host machine to close the connection.<\/li>\n<li>Now if the machine accepts the request of the handshake, it closes down the connection.<\/li>\n<\/ul>\n<p>A SYN flood attack will send repeated spoofed request to the machine from many sources and instead of the machine to go offline, it timesout. Eventually, when a strong attack is sent i.e many sources are involved in it, the server have higher chances to go offline.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Ping_of_Death\"><\/span>Ping of Death<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Ping of Death that is also called as &#8220;POD&#8221; is Denial of Service that manipulates IP sending larger packet then minimum allowance under IPv6 that is 65535 bytes. Larger packets are divided across multiple IPs but when they are reassembled, they become a strong one and that is what we call it as &#8220;fragment&#8221; attack that is also known as &#8220;FRAG&#8221; in many booter services.<\/p>\n<p>Note:POD isn&#8217;t affective nowadays because the firewall that are installed in routers now block the &#8220;ICMP&#8221; packets that comes in flood.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Reflected_Attacks\"><\/span>Reflected Attacks<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>A reflection attack is where an attacker sends forged packets from many different sources. The target machine accepts and replies the attacking machine but as we already mentioned, the attack is made up from many different sources and when the target machine are overloaded by replying the packets from attacking machine, it closes down or goes offline.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Slowloris\"><\/span>Slowloris<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Slowloris is the one of the most powerful attack that are very difficult to mitigate. Slowloris is a tool used by the attacker which uses fewer resources. During this attack, the Slowloris opens a partial connection with the target and stay online for as much time as possible. It also sends HTTP headers when the connection is established. This HTTP request is added in the connection. The session lasts long until the server&#8217;s resources are exhausted and the system goes offline.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Application_Based_Attacks\"><\/span>Application Based Attacks<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Application based attacks are the attack that is used by the attacker to target a specific application installed on the server. Rather then taking down whole of the server, it exploits the\u00a0vulnerability and takes down the application. The most of applications that are targeted by this attack are WordPress, MyBB, Joomla and other CMS and web forum applications.<\/p>\n<p>We&#8217;ve written down all the basic types of DDoS attacks that occurs nowadays. Write your reviews in the comment box!<\/p>\n<p>Also read<\/p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/booter-stresser-methods\/\">Types of Methods in Booter\/stresser.<\/a><\/li>\n<li><a href=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/\">What is Botnet? How does it works?<\/a><\/li>\n<\/ul>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Jump To What is Distributed Denial of Service(DDoS) attack?Common types of DDoS attacks used by hackers.UDP FloodSYN FloodPing of DeathReflected AttacksSlowlorisApplication Based Attacks What is Distributed Denial of Service(DDoS) attack? Distributed Denial of Services are a type of cyber attack that is mostly used by hackers to take down servers or websites. Today we are going to learn the methods that is provided by network stressers\/booters to stress test your target.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#What_is_Booter\/Network_stresser\" title=\"What is Booter\/Network stresser?\">What is Booter\/Network stresser?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-3\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#Methods_present_in_it\" title=\"Methods present in it.\">Methods present in it.<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-5\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-5\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#DNS_AMPLIFICATION_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_uses_vulnerable_OPENDNS_servers_to_amplifiy_the_traffic_that_reaches_the_attacked_IP_You_can_use_any_port_becouse_it_always_hits_on_multiple_ports_This_is_usually_our_hardest_hitting_method_when_hitting_home_connections\" title=\"DNS AMPLIFICATION\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses vulnerable OPENDNS servers to amplifiy the traffic that reaches the attacked IP. You can use any port becouse it always hits on multiple ports.This is usually our hardest hitting method when hitting home connections.\">DNS AMPLIFICATION\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses vulnerable OPENDNS servers to amplifiy the traffic that reaches the attacked IP. You can use any port becouse it always hits on multiple ports.This is usually our hardest hitting method when hitting home connections.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#CHARGEN_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_uses_chargen_service_to_amplify_and_reflect_the_attack_to_the_targeted_IP_addres\" title=\"CHARGEN\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses chargen service to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP addres.\">CHARGEN\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses chargen service to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP addres.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#NTP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_used_to_amplify_and_reflect_the_attack_to_the_targeted_IP_address_It_exploits_the_%E2%80%9Cmonlist%E2%80%9D_query_of_the_NTP_service\" title=\"NTP\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method used to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP address. It exploits the &#8220;monlist&#8221; query of the NTP service.\">NTP\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method used to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP address. It exploits the &#8220;monlist&#8221; query of the NTP service.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-6\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#TCPACK_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Cack%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_for_the_acknowledgement_of_synchronization_acknowledgement_request_when_establishing_a_tcp_connection_Usually_it_is_good_for_lagging\/downing_a_server\" title=\"TCP-ACK\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;ack&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for the acknowledgement of synchronization acknowledgement request when establishing a tcp connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.\">TCP-ACK\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;ack&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for the acknowledgement of synchronization acknowledgement request when establishing a tcp connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-7\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#FRAG_%E2%80%93_Fragmented_TCP_It_is_useful_when_hitting_servers\" title=\"FRAG\u00a0&#8211; Fragmented TCP. It is useful when hitting servers.\">FRAG\u00a0&#8211; Fragmented TCP. It is useful when hitting servers.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#TCPRST_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Crst%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_when_a_client_in_an_ongoing_tcp_session_wants_to_end_the_session\/connection_Usually_it_is_good_for_lagging\/downing_a_server\" title=\"TCP-RST\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;rst&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header. That specific flag is used when a client in an ongoing tcp session wants to end the session\/connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.\">TCP-RST\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;rst&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header. That specific flag is used when a client in an ongoing tcp session wants to end the session\/connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-9\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#TCPSYN_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Csyn%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_for_synchronization_request_which_is_the_first_request_a_TCP_connection_should_have_Therefore_it_is_the_first_packet_when_establishing_a_new_connection_and_is_highly_effective_for_lagging\/downing_servers\" title=\"TCP-SYN\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;syn&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for synchronization request which is the first request a TCP connection should have. Therefore it is the first packet when establishing a new connection and is highly effective for lagging\/downing servers.\">TCP-SYN\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;syn&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for synchronization request which is the first request a TCP connection should have. Therefore it is the first packet when establishing a new connection and is highly effective for lagging\/downing servers.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-10\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#DOMINATE_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_packets_with_random_flags_enabled_in_the_header_which_makes_it_highly_effective_even_against_medium_protected_hosts\" title=\"DOMINATE\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty packets with random flags enabled in the header which makes it highly effective even against medium protected hosts.\">DOMINATE\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty packets with random flags enabled in the header which makes it highly effective even against medium protected hosts.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-11\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#KILLTCP_%E2%80%93_This_method_is_also_TCP_based_and_is_%E2%80%9Csister_method%E2%80%9D_to_DOMINATE_becouse_they_work_on_a_very_similiar_concept_Therefor_if_one_doesnt_take_down_the_server_you_should_try_the_other\" title=\"KILL-TCP\u00a0&#8211; This method is also TCP based and is &#8220;sister method&#8221; to DOMINATE becouse they work on a very similiar concept.Therefor if one doesnt take down the server you should try the other.\">KILL-TCP\u00a0&#8211; This method is also TCP based and is &#8220;sister method&#8221; to DOMINATE becouse they work on a very similiar concept.Therefor if one doesnt take down the server you should try the other.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-12\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#COD_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_can_take_down_even_highly_protected_Call_of_Duty_servers\" title=\"COD\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which can take down even highly protected Call of Duty servers.\">COD\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which can take down even highly protected Call of Duty servers.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-13\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#PORTMAP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_used_to_reflect_and_amplify_the_traffic_towards_the_targeted_IP_Its_very_useful_for_downing_4G_hotspots_and_even_some_highly_protected_hosts!\" title=\"PORTMAP\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is used to reflect and amplify the traffic towards the targeted IP. Its very useful for downing 4G hotspots and even some highly protected hosts!\">PORTMAP\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is used to reflect and amplify the traffic towards the targeted IP. Its very useful for downing 4G hotspots and even some highly protected hosts!<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-14\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#VOX_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_best_used_for_downing_highly_protected_servers\" title=\"VOX\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is best used for downing highly protected servers.\">VOX\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is best used for downing highly protected servers.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-15\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#Teamspeak_3_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_TS3_servers\" title=\"Teamspeak 3\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers.\">Teamspeak 3\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-16\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#Teamspeak_3(KILL)_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_TS3_servers_and_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_Teamspeak_3_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\" title=\"Teamspeak 3(KILL)\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers and the only diffrence between it and Teamspeak 3 is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.\">Teamspeak 3(KILL)\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers and the only diffrence between it and Teamspeak 3 is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-17\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#RAND_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_applications_which_networking_done_over_UDP\" title=\"RAND\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against applications which networking done over UDP.\">RAND\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against applications which networking done over UDP.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-18\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#_KILL_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_similiar_to_UDP_RANDand_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_UDP_RAND_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\" title=\"\u00a0KILL\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.\">\u00a0KILL\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-19\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#UDP_KILL_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_similiar_to_UDP_RANDand_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_UDP_RAND_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\" title=\"UDP KILL\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.\">UDP KILL\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-20\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#ICMP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_application_level_method_that_utilizes_HTTP_protocol_to_drain_the_resources_of_the_targeted_webserver\" title=\"ICMP\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.\">ICMP\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-21\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#ZUDP_(LDAP)_%E2%80%93_One_of_the_most_powerful_methods_on_the_webstresser_at_the_moment_Currently_hits_harded_than_most_others\" title=\"ZUDP (LDAP)\u00a0&#8211; One of the most powerful methods on the webstresser at the moment. Currently hits harded than most others.\">ZUDP (LDAP)\u00a0&#8211; One of the most powerful methods on the webstresser at the moment. Currently hits harded than most others.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-22\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#HTTPGET_%E2%80%93_Its_an_application_level_method_that_utilizes_HTTP_protocol_to_drain_the_resources_of_the_targeted_webserver\" title=\"HTTP-GET\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.\">HTTP-GET\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-5\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-23\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/booter-stresser-methods\/#HTTPKILL_%E2%80%93_Custom_made_HTTP_based_method_which_uses_smart_user_mimicking_techniques_to_bypass_some_non_JS_based_protections_Also_it_is_extremly_useful_when_testing_login_register_pages\" title=\"HTTP-KILL\u00a0&#8211; Custom made HTTP based method which uses smart user mimicking techniques to bypass some non JS based protections. Also it is extremly useful when testing login &amp; register pages.\">HTTP-KILL\u00a0&#8211; Custom made HTTP based method which uses smart user mimicking techniques to bypass some non JS based protections. Also it is extremly useful when testing login &amp; register pages.<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_is_Booter\/Network_stresser\"><\/span><strong>What is Booter\/Network stresser?<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Booter or you can say it as Network stresser. They are a kind of website that provides you Distributed Denial Of Service(DDoS) to you to stress test your website\/server against DDoS attacks.<\/p>\n<h3><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Methods_present_in_it\"><\/span><strong>Methods present in it.<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h3>\n<p>Booters provides you many method when you go to their stress hub. You can see a section that is usually provided as a drop down menu that shows you various types of methods to select before you start your stress testing. Those methods helps you to determine in which protocol you would like to stress test like SSH, FTP and etc.<\/p>\n<p>Here are the types of method that you find in most of booters\/network stressers.<\/p>\n<p><center><\/p>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"DNS_AMPLIFICATION_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_uses_vulnerable_OPENDNS_servers_to_amplifiy_the_traffic_that_reaches_the_attacked_IP_You_can_use_any_port_becouse_it_always_hits_on_multiple_ports_This_is_usually_our_hardest_hitting_method_when_hitting_home_connections\"><\/span><b><u>DNS AMPLIFICATION<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses vulnerable OPENDNS servers to amplifiy the traffic that reaches the attacked IP. You can use any port becouse it always hits on multiple ports.This is usually our hardest hitting method when hitting home connections.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"CHARGEN_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_uses_chargen_service_to_amplify_and_reflect_the_attack_to_the_targeted_IP_addres\"><\/span><b><u>CHARGEN<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which uses chargen service to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP addres.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"NTP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_used_to_amplify_and_reflect_the_attack_to_the_targeted_IP_address_It_exploits_the_%E2%80%9Cmonlist%E2%80%9D_query_of_the_NTP_service\"><\/span><b><u>NTP<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method used to amplify and reflect the attack to the targeted IP address. It exploits the &#8220;monlist&#8221; query of the NTP service.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"TCPACK_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Cack%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_for_the_acknowledgement_of_synchronization_acknowledgement_request_when_establishing_a_tcp_connection_Usually_it_is_good_for_lagging\/downing_a_server\"><\/span><b><u>TCP-ACK<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;ack&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for the acknowledgement of synchronization acknowledgement request when establishing a tcp connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"FRAG_%E2%80%93_Fragmented_TCP_It_is_useful_when_hitting_servers\"><\/span><b><u>FRAG<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Fragmented TCP. It is useful when hitting servers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"TCPRST_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Crst%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_when_a_client_in_an_ongoing_tcp_session_wants_to_end_the_session\/connection_Usually_it_is_good_for_lagging\/downing_a_server\"><\/span><b><u>TCP-RST<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;rst&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header. That specific flag is used when a client in an ongoing tcp session wants to end the session\/connection. Usually it is good for lagging\/downing a server.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"TCPSYN_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_tcp_packets_with_%E2%80%9Csyn%E2%80%9D_flag_enabled_in_the_packets_header_That_specific_flag_is_used_for_synchronization_request_which_is_the_first_request_a_TCP_connection_should_have_Therefore_it_is_the_first_packet_when_establishing_a_new_connection_and_is_highly_effective_for_lagging\/downing_servers\"><\/span><b><u>TCP-SYN<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty tcp packets with &#8220;syn&#8221; flag enabled in the packets header.That specific flag is used for synchronization request which is the first request a TCP connection should have. Therefore it is the first packet when establishing a new connection and is highly effective for lagging\/downing servers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"DOMINATE_%E2%80%93_Its_an_TCP_based_method_which_sends_empty_packets_with_random_flags_enabled_in_the_header_which_makes_it_highly_effective_even_against_medium_protected_hosts\"><\/span><b><u>DOMINATE<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an TCP based method which sends empty packets with random flags enabled in the header which makes it highly effective even against medium protected hosts.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"KILLTCP_%E2%80%93_This_method_is_also_TCP_based_and_is_%E2%80%9Csister_method%E2%80%9D_to_DOMINATE_becouse_they_work_on_a_very_similiar_concept_Therefor_if_one_doesnt_take_down_the_server_you_should_try_the_other\"><\/span><b><u>KILL-TCP<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; This method is also TCP based and is &#8220;sister method&#8221; to DOMINATE becouse they work on a very similiar concept.Therefor if one doesnt take down the server you should try the other.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"COD_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_can_take_down_even_highly_protected_Call_of_Duty_servers\"><\/span><b><u>COD<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which can take down even highly protected Call of Duty servers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"PORTMAP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_used_to_reflect_and_amplify_the_traffic_towards_the_targeted_IP_Its_very_useful_for_downing_4G_hotspots_and_even_some_highly_protected_hosts!\"><\/span><b><u>PORTMAP<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is used to reflect and amplify the traffic towards the targeted IP. Its very useful for downing 4G hotspots and even some highly protected hosts!<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"VOX_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_best_used_for_downing_highly_protected_servers\"><\/span><b><u>VOX<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is best used for downing highly protected servers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Teamspeak_3_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_TS3_servers\"><\/span><b><u>Teamspeak 3<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Teamspeak_3(KILL)_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_TS3_servers_and_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_Teamspeak_3_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\"><\/span><b><u>Teamspeak 3(KILL)<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against TS3 servers and the only diffrence between it and Teamspeak 3 is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"RAND_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_works_very_well_against_applications_which_networking_done_over_UDP\"><\/span><b><u>RAND<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which works very well against applications which networking done over UDP.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"_KILL_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_similiar_to_UDP_RANDand_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_UDP_RAND_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\"><\/span><b><u>\u00a0KILL<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"UDP_KILL_%E2%80%93_Its_an_UDP_based_method_which_is_similiar_to_UDP_RANDand_the_only_diffrence_between_it_and_UDP_RAND_is_that_this_method_hits_on_all_ports_instead_of_only_one\"><\/span><b><u>UDP KILL<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an UDP based method which is similiar to UDP RANDand the only diffrence between it and UDP RAND is that this method hits on all ports instead of only one.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"ICMP_%E2%80%93_Its_an_application_level_method_that_utilizes_HTTP_protocol_to_drain_the_resources_of_the_targeted_webserver\"><\/span><b><u>ICMP<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<p><\/center><\/p>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"ZUDP_(LDAP)_%E2%80%93_One_of_the_most_powerful_methods_on_the_webstresser_at_the_moment_Currently_hits_harded_than_most_others\"><\/span><b><u>ZUDP (LDAP)<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; One of the most powerful methods on the webstresser at the moment. Currently hits harded than most others.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"HTTPGET_%E2%80%93_Its_an_application_level_method_that_utilizes_HTTP_protocol_to_drain_the_resources_of_the_targeted_webserver\"><\/span><b><u>HTTP-GET<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Its an application level method that utilizes HTTP protocol to drain the resources of the targeted webserver.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<h5 class=\"box-title m-b-20\"><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"HTTPKILL_%E2%80%93_Custom_made_HTTP_based_method_which_uses_smart_user_mimicking_techniques_to_bypass_some_non_JS_based_protections_Also_it_is_extremly_useful_when_testing_login_register_pages\"><\/span><b><u>HTTP-KILL<\/u><\/b>\u00a0&#8211; Custom made HTTP based method which uses smart user mimicking techniques to bypass some non JS based protections. Also it is extremly useful when testing login &amp; register pages.<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h5>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<p>The following methods are collected over from various booters.<\/p>\n<p>There can be some different types of methods or custom made methods by different booters. This methods are used usually in most of booters.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Hey folks! Today we are going to learn the methods that is provided by network stressers\/booters to stress test your target. How does it works?"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>DNS Amplification is a reflection based distributed denial of service attack.<\/p>\n<p>The attacker spoofs look-up requests to domain name system (DNS) servers to hide the source of the exploit and direct the response to the target. Through various techniques, the attacker turns a small DNS query into a much larger payload directed at the target network.<\/p>\n<p>The attacker sends a DNS look-up request using the spoofed IP address of the target to vulnerable DNS servers. Most commonly, these are DNS servers that support open recursive relay. The original request is often relayed through a botnet for a larger base of attack and further concealment. The DNS request is sent using the EDNS0 extension to the DNS protocol allowing for large DNS messages. It may also use the DNS security extension (DNSSEC) cryptographic feature to add to the size of the message.<\/p>\n<p><strong>What is reflection based attack?<\/strong><\/p>\n<p>In computer security, a\u00a0<b>reflection attack<\/b>\u00a0is a method of attacking a challenge-response authentication system that uses the same protocol in both directions. That is, the same challenge-response protocol is used by each side to authenticate the other side.<\/p>\n<p>DNS Amplification Attacks are a way for an attacker to magnify the amount of bandwidth they can target at a potential victim. Imagine you are an attacker and you control a botnet capable of sending out 100Mbps of traffic. While that may be sufficient to knock some sites offline, it is a relatively trivial amount of traffic in the world of DDoS. In order to increase your attack&#8217;s volume, you could try and add more compromised machines to your botnet. That is becoming increasingly difficult. Alternatively, you could find a way to amplify your 100Mbps into something much bigger.<\/p>\n<h2>MITIGATION<\/h2>\n<p>Unfortunately, due to the massive traffic volume that can be produced by one of these attacks, there is often little that the victim can do to counter a large-scale DNS amplification-based distributed denial-of-service attack. However, it is possible to reduce the number of servers that can be used by attackers to generate the traffic volumes.<\/p>\n<p>While the only effective means of eliminating the use of recursive resolvers in this type of attack is to eliminate unsecured recursive resolvers, this requires an extensive effort by various parties. According to the Open DNS Resolver Project, of the 27 million known DNS resolvers on the Internet, approximately \u201c25 million pose a significant threat\u201d of being used in an attack [1]. However, several possible techniques are available to reduce the overall effectiveness of such attacks to the Internet community as a whole. Where possible, configuration links have been provided to assist administrators with making the recommended changes. The configuration information has been limited to BIND9 and Microsoft\u2019s DNS Server, which are two widely deployed DNS servers on federal networks. If you are running a different DNS server, please consult your vendor\u2019s documentation for configuration details.<\/p>\n<p>If you found out our article to be useful then please leave a feedback in comment!<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>DNS Amplification is a reflection based distributed denial of service attack. The attacker spoofs look-up requests to domain name system (DNS) servers to hide the source of the exploit and direct the response to the target. Through various techniques, the attacker turns a small DNS query into a much larger payload directed at the target [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":115,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[4,9,11],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/dnsampi.png","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"description\" content=\"In this article, you&#039;re being explained what is domain name system(DNS) amplification attacks works. In simple words, any software program that is intended to cause direct or indirect harm to the computer system is referred to as a malware.<\/p>\n<p>Some malware programs cause serious problems such as destroying the system files, causing disruption to the computer operation or gathering sensitive information while others may only have a light impact such as redirecting websites to pornographic content or annoying the users with pop-ups and banners.<\/p>\n<p>In the normal\u00a0routine,\u00a0we have often seen every malicious program being referred to as a virus, but this is not correct! In fact, as mentioned earlier, there exists several malicious programs where virus is one among them. Now, many of you may be wondering to know what\u2019s the difference between them. Well, this article gives a detailed information on\u00a0different types of malware\u00a0that exist, how they work and how they differ from each other:<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Worms\" title=\"Worms:\">Worms:<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-8\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Mode_of_operation-3\" title=\"Mode of operation:\">Mode of operation:<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-9\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Damage_caused\" title=\"Damage caused:\">Damage caused:<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-10\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Spyware\" title=\"Spyware:\">Spyware:<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-11\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Mode_of_operation-4\" title=\"Mode of operation:\">Mode of operation:<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-12\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Damage_caused-2\" title=\"Damage caused:\">Damage caused:<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-13\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Adware\" title=\"Adware:\">Adware:<\/a><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><ul class=\"ez-toc-list-level-4\"><li class=\"ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-14\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Mode_of_operation-5\" title=\"Mode of operation:\">Mode of operation:<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-4\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-15\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/types-of-malwares-and-how-do-they-work\/#Damage_caused-3\" title=\"Damage caused:\">Damage caused:<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Computer_Virus\"><\/span>Computer Virus:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>As we all know, this is the type of malware that has become highly popular and is one of the most widely discussed topic in the field of computer security. A virus is just a computer program that is designed to take\u00a0unauthorized control of the infected computer so as to cause harm to the system\u2019s data or degrade its performance.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Mode_of_operation\"><\/span>Mode of operation:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Computer viruses operates by attaching themselves to an already\u00a0existing file or program and replicates itself to spread from one computer to another. In most cases, they tend to infect executable files that are parts of legitimate programs. So, whenever the infected file is executed on a new computer, the virus gets activated and begins to operate by further replication or causing the intended damage to the system.<\/p>\n<p>A virus cannot perform its task of harming and replication\u00a0unless it is allowed to execute. This is the reason why viruses often choose an executable file as its host and get attached to them. Viruses are mainly classified into two types:<\/p>\n<p><strong>Non-Resident Viruses:<\/strong>\u00a0This kind of virus will execute along with its host, perform the needful action of finding and infecting the other possible files and eventually transfers the control back to the main program (host). The operation of the virus will terminate along with that of its host.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Resident Viruses:<\/strong>\u00a0In case of resident viruses, whenever the infected program is run by the user, the virus gets activated, loads its replication module into the memory and then transfers the control back to the main program. In this case, the virus still remains active in the memory waiting for an opportunity to find and infect other files even after the main program (host) has been terminated.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Damages_caused\"><\/span>Damages caused:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Viruses are known to cause destruction of data and software programs.\u00a0In some cases, a virus may do nothing other than just replicating itself. However, they are responsible for using a large portion of the system\u00a0resources\u00a0such as CPU and memory which results in the performance degradation of the computer.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Trojan_horse\"><\/span>Trojan horse:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>A Trojan horse or simply called as Trojan is a type of malicious program that disguises itself as something that is legitimate or useful. The main purpose of a trojan is to gain the trust of the user from the front end, so that it gets the permission to be installed. But, from the back end, it is designed to grant unauthorized control of the computer to the hacker.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Mode_of_operation-2\"><\/span>Mode of operation:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>A Trojan horse do not depend on the host to carry out its operation. So, unlike a computer virus,\u00a0it does not tend to attach itself to other files. Trojans are often disguised as video codecs, software cracks, keygens and other similar programs downloaded from untrusted sources. So, one has to be careful about those untrusted websites that offer free downloads.<\/p>\n<p>One of the most popular example is the\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/DNSChanger\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>DNSChanger<\/strong><\/a>\u00a0trojan that was designed to hijack the DNS servers of the victimized computers. It was distributed by some of the rogue pornographic websites as a video codec needed to view online content.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Damages_caused-2\"><\/span>Damages caused:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Trojan horses are known to cause a wide variety of damages such as stealing passwords and login details, electronic money theft, logging keystrokes, modify\/delete files, monitor user activity etc.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Worms\"><\/span>Worms:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Worms are standalone computer programs with a malicious intent that spread from one computer to another. Unlike viruses, worms have the ability to operate independently and hence do not attach themselves to another program.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Mode_of_operation-3\"><\/span>Mode of operation:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Worms often use a computer network to spread itself by exploiting the security vulnerabilities that exist inside the individual computers. In most cases, worms are designed only to spread without causing any serious change to the computer system.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Damage_caused\"><\/span>Damage caused:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Unlike viruses, worms do not cause damage to the system files and other important programs. However, they are responsible for consuming the bandwidth thereby degrading the performance of the network.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Spyware\"><\/span>Spyware:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Spyware is a type of malicious software that can collect information about the activities of the target computer without the knowledge of its users. Spywares such as keyloggers are often installed by the owner or administrator\u00a0of the computer in order to monitor the activities of the users. This can be a parent trying to monitor his child, a company owner trying to monitor his employee or someone trying to spy on his\/her spouse.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Mode_of_operation-4\"><\/span>Mode of operation:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Spywares are designed to operate in a totally stealth mode so that its presence is completely hidden from the users of the computer. Once installed, they silently monitor all the activities on the computer such as keystrokes, web activity, IM logs etc. These logs are stored secretly for later access or uploaded online so that the installer of the spyware program can have access to them.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Damage_caused-2\"><\/span>Damage caused:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Apart from monitoring, spywares do not cause any damage to the computer. However, in some cases the affected computer may experience degradation in its performance.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Adware\"><\/span>Adware:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Adware is a software program that automatically renders\u00a0advertisements\u00a0to the users without their consent. Most common examples are pop-ups, pop-unders and other annoying banner ads. The prime reason behind the design of adware is to generate revenue for its author.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Mode_of_operation-5\"><\/span>Mode of operation:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Adwares are often bundled up with some of the free utilities such as a browser toolbars, video downloaders etc. When such programs are installed, the adware may take over and distract user activity by displaying annoying advertisements.<\/p>\n<h4><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Damage_caused-3\"><\/span>Damage caused:<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h4>\n<p>Adware is harmless in most of the occasions. However, some\u00a0are known to contain spywares that are used to monitor the surfing habits of users. This may pose a threat to the privacy of the users.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Malware is a collective term used to represent virus, worms, spyware and other malicious programs out there on the Internet. In simple words, any software program that is intended to cause direct or indirect harm to the computer system is referred to as a malware. Group Cobra Command Claims To Have Taken Down Flipkart"},"content":{"rendered":"<p><em><strong>Introduction<\/strong>:<\/em> <em>The hackers group Cobra Command now have claimed to have taken down Flipkart. As per their recent post on Facebook, it was for security testing and was down for just 5 minutes.<\/em><\/p>\n<p>Today in the after noon, that is 12:50 PM of India. We got an update from the hacker group of Cobra Command. They&#8217;ve recently claimed that they have taken down the biggest shopping website of India, that is Flipkart.<\/p>\n<p>Flipkart is an Indian shopping website with a net worth of 1.4 billion American dollars. It was recently claimed to be taken down for 5 minutes by a hacker&#8217;s group named &#8220;Cobra Command&#8221;.<\/p>\n<p>Cobra Command had recently claimed to have taken down big websites likes NASA, Pakistani Government, Cybrary and etc. You can read\u00a0the <a href=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/new-hacking-group-cobra-command-takes-down-big-websites\/\">article of their recent attack.<\/a><\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"105\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/hackers-group-cobra-command-claims-to-have-taken-down-flipkart\/flipkart-down-ch-report-ss\/\" 481w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 360px) 100vw, 360px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>After investigating the check-host provided by them, it was revealed that the downtime was for real. The screenshot of check-host report is given below.<img data-attachment-id=\"106\" Takes Down Big Websites."},"content":{"rendered":"<p><strong><em>SmallBytes :\u00a0<\/em><\/strong><em>An Indian Hackers group have claimed that they have taken down big websites like Pakistan Government websites and other big e-commerce websites. But the most important thing is they&#8217;ve claimed to take down NASA.<\/em><\/p>\n<p>Last week, an Indian Hackers group launched a Facebook page with a description of &#8220;security testing&#8221;. They have claimed to have taken down big websites like International Airport of Pakistan Karachi, International Airport of Pakistan Islamabad. But as per the CH\/check-host report, it was meant to be really down. No one knows whether it was a DDoS attack or a system failure from the vendor of those websites.<\/p>\n<p>But the things have gone crazy when they claimed to have taken down NASA. They&#8217;ve posted on 11:15 PM on 26th of September that NASA.gov was taken down by them.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"98\"
