But taking down NASA isn&#8217;t that easy because NASA is one of the biggest space association website.<\/p>\n<p>Not only NASA but websites like Cybrary, the one of the most popular website for learning hacking was too down as per their claim.<\/p>\n<p><img data-attachment-id=\"101\" data-permalink=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/new-hacking-group-cobra-command-takes-down-big-websites\/cybrary-down\/\" data-orig-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down.png\" data-orig-size=\"506,762\" data-comments-opened=\"1\" data-image-meta=\"{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}\" data-image-title=\"cybrary down\" data-image-description=\"\" data-medium-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down-199x300.png\" data-large-file=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down.png\" class=\" wp-image-101 aligncenter\" src=\"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down-199x300.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"323\" height=\"487\" srcset=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down-199x300.png 199w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down-279x420.png 279w, https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cybrary-down.png 506w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 323px) 100vw, 323px\" \/><\/p>\n<p>The recent post of &#8220;Cobra Command&#8221; In this article we are going to learn about what is botnet and how does it works. You may have heard about peoples saying that they DDoS\u2019ed their target\/victims with their botnet and took them down. However, In this article we are going to show you how do they execute attack over botnet.<\/p>\n<div id=\"ez-toc-container\" class=\"ez-toc-v2_0_11 counter-hierarchy counter-decimal ez-toc-grey\">\n<div class=\"ez-toc-title-container\">\n<p class=\"ez-toc-title\">Jump To<\/p>\n<span class=\"ez-toc-title-toggle\"><a class=\"ez-toc-pull-right ez-toc-btn ez-toc-btn-xs ez-toc-btn-default ez-toc-toggle\"><i class=\"ez-toc-glyphicon ez-toc-icon-toggle\"><\/i><\/a><\/span><\/div>\n<nav><ul class=\"ez-toc-list ez-toc-list-level-1\"><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-1\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/#What_is_Botnet\" title=\"What is Botnet?\">What is Botnet?<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-2\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/#Botnet_C_Cs\" title=\"Botnet C&amp;Cs\">Botnet C&amp;Cs<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-3\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/#Botnet_Communications\" title=\"Botnet Communications\">Botnet Communications<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-4\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/#Botnet_attacks\" title=\"Botnet attacks\">Botnet attacks<\/a><\/li><li class=\"ez-toc-page-1 ez-toc-heading-level-2\"><a class=\"ez-toc-link ez-toc-heading-5\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/#Preventing_botnet_attacks\" title=\"Preventing botnet attacks\">Preventing botnet attacks<\/a><\/li><\/ul><\/nav><\/div>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"What_is_Botnet\"><\/span>What is Botnet?<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Before we start in our own words, Let\u2019s see what our beloved\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/\">Wikipedia described about botnet.<\/a><\/p>\n<blockquote><p>A botnet is a number of Internet-connected devices, each of which is running one or more bots. Botnets can be used to perform distributed denial-of-service attack (DDoS attack), steal data, send spam, and allow the attacker access to the device and its connection.<\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p>So let\u2019s start. As mentioned above, Botnet is a network of \u201chacked\u201d computers\/servers that are used to execute Distributed Denial of Server(DDoS attack), steal data, send spam mails\/viruses and etc. Botnet is controlled by a single individual who have access to all of his bots that have been under controlled by the virus the victim have downloaded. When a Internet user are being baited to download hack tools like \u201cCOC Hack tool latest 2017\u2033,\u201dFacebook Hack tool 100% working for all Windows.\u201d, and etc, all those hack tools are fake and 75% of files are infected by viruses which helps the attacker to gain access to your PC without the permission of the user.<\/p>\n<p>The graphic below explains 3 types of baiting done by the attacker to infect PC(s).<\/p>\n<p><img class=\" wp-image-1217 aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/teamultimate.in\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/07\/botnet3-300x232.png\" sizes=\"(max-width: 398px) 100vw, 398px\" srcset=\"https:\/\/teamultimate.in\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/07\/botnet3-300x232.png 300w, https:\/\/teamultimate.in\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/07\/botnet3.png 650w\" alt=\"\" width=\"398\" height=\"308\" \/><\/p>\n<p>If your computer is part of a botnet, it\u2019s infected with a type of malware. The bot contacts a remote server \u2014 or just gets into contact with other nearby bots \u2014 and waits for instructions from whoever is controlling the botnet. This allows an attacker to control a large number of computers for malicious purposes.<\/p>\n<p>Computers in a botnet may also be infected with other types of malware, like keyloggers that record your financial information and send it to a remote server. What makes a computer part of a botnet is that it\u2019s being controlled remotely along with many other computers. The botnet\u2019s creators can decide what to do with the botnet later, direct the bots to download additional types of malware, and even have the bots act together.<\/p>\n<p>You might become infected with a bot in the same way you\u2019d become infected with any other piece of malware \u2014 for example, by running out-of-date software, using the extremely insecure Java browser plug-in, or downloading and running pirated software.<\/p>\n<p>&nbsp;<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Botnet_C_Cs\"><\/span>Botnet C&amp;Cs<span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>The C&amp;Cs are the servers that deliver commands to the bots, directing them to targets and instructing them what to do. Traditionally, botnets operate under a client-server model, wherein the bots act as the botnet clients and the C&amp;Cs act as the servers. There can be one or more Command and Control servers in a botnet.<\/p>\n<p>Having multiple C&amp;Cs provides redundancy and enables botnets to acquire high availability capabilities. Meaning, if one C&amp;C goes down, the botnet clients can still receive commands from the other C&amp;Cs. Nevertheless, having multiple C&amp;Cs doesn\u2019t make a client-server-type botnet indestructible. Its survival still relies heavily on the C&amp;Cs. If the C&amp;Cs are identified and eventually brought down, the entire botnet will be no more.<\/p>\n<p>This is how massive botnets like Mariposa and Bredolab were dismantled. After their C&amp;Cs were tracked down, the end of these malicious networks became imminent.<\/p>\n<p>Today, many botnets follow a different architecture. To avoid total reliance on a group of C&amp;Cs, these botnets now use a P2P model, wherein each botnet client also functions as a C&amp;C. This type of botnet is much harder to take down.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Botnet_Communications\"><\/span><strong>Botnet Communications<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Most bots communicate with their C&amp;Cs using mostly these three communications protocols \u2013 Telnet, IRC (Internet Relay Chat) or HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol). Other botnets also employ other communication methods but these two are definitely the most commonly used.<\/p>\n<p>IRC communications can be easily automated (using scripts). In addition, open source IRC servers are readily available. That\u2019s why this protocol used to be a perfect fit for botnet creation and deployment. During infection, a typical botnet malware would install an IRC client, which in turn would then communicate with the IRC server on the C&amp;C.<\/p>\n<p>The characteristics of IRC, while a boon for botnet operations, has ironically also become many a botnet\u2019s undoing. If you really think about it, Internet Relay Chat is no longer a common method of communication (most people now use Instant Messaging applications). And so, ever since IRC became associated with botnets, the presence of IRC packets has often raised red flags. Some system admins even started blocking IRC packets in their firewalls.<\/p>\n<p>It is for this reason that malware writers have started to turn to a more firewall-friendly option as their botnet communication protocol of choice. And what network protocol can be more firewall-friendly than HTTP? All websites (including popular ones like Google, Facebook, and Amazon) all communicate via HTTP. So if a botnet uses HTTP, there\u2019s a lower chance of it getting flagged down because, unlike IRC packets, HTTP packets don\u2019t easily stand out.<\/p>\n<p>Zeus, one of the most notorious botnets ever, communicated via HTTP. In fact, several exploit kits incorporate HTTP communications into their botnet malware payloads.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Botnet_attacks\"><\/span><strong>Botnet attacks<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>One of the most common botnet attacks is the DDoS or Distributed Denial of Service attack. In this type of attack, all bots send out requests to a target server with the purpose of overwhelming it and preventing legitimate requests from getting through or processed.<\/p>\n<p>Another common botnet attack \u2013 in fact, arguably the most common cyber attack that employs botnets \u2013 is sending out tons of spam. In a typical spam attack, bots send out spam emails to target email addresses with the purpose of getting click-throughs and, ultimately, generating ad revenue.<\/p>\n<p>Botnets can also be used to steal information from enslaved devices. Some bot clients operate as keyloggers that record end user keystrokes. Keyloggers can, for example, record the password characters an end user enters during login and then send this information to the bot herders.<\/p>\n<p>Lastly, botnets can also be used for click fraud activities. Bot clients can click on ads and trick ad networks that the clicks came from legitimate end users.<\/p>\n<h2><span class=\"ez-toc-section\" id=\"Preventing_botnet_attacks\"><\/span><strong>Preventing botnet attacks<\/strong><span class=\"ez-toc-section-end\"><\/span><\/h2>\n<p>Botnet malware infections can be avoided by educating end-users about the risks and best practices of downloading email attachments and visiting web sites. Of course, this countermeasure has its limitations. Most end users find security practices too tedious and time consuming, and often disregard them. Further, some threats (like drive-by-downloads) are just too difficult to avoid.<\/p>\n<p>The best way would is to employ advanced malware protection solutions. These solutions typically combine advanced network behaviour analysis and real time intelligence to detect even the most stealthy malware infections.<\/p>\n<p>That\u2019s all for now.<\/p>\n<p><strong>Also Read:\u00a0<\/strong><a href=\"http:\/\/teamultimate.in\/functionality-of-stressers\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Difference between DoS and DDoS.<\/a><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Hello everyone! In this article we are going to learn about what is botnet and how does it works. You may have heard about peoples saying that they DDoS\u2019ed their target\/victims with their botnet and took them down. However, In this article we are going to show you how do they execute attack over botnet. [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":90,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[13],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/botnet.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-botnet-and-how-does-it-works\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"What is Botnet and How does it works? - The Shadow Press\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"Hello everyone! Distributed Denial of Services are a type of cyber attack that is mostly used by hackers to take down servers or websites. your CloudFlare website to avoid getting it bypassed"},"content":{"rendered":"<p><i>Short Introduction: CloudFlare is a Content Delivery Network(CDN) which builds up a wall between the website and the visitor. Due to miss config in CloudFlare settings, The CloudFlare wall can be bypassed. Today we&#8217;re gonna learn how to configure CloudFlare properly.\u00a0<\/i><br \/>\n<i><br \/>\n<\/i><b>What is CloudFlare? What does CloudFlare do with my website after I activate my website on CloudFlare?<\/b><br \/>\nCloudFlare is a Content Delivery Network which builds up a wall between the website and the visitor. Only visitors are allowed to go through CloudFlare and even search engine crawlers are allowed but not attackers. CloudFlare covers the real IP address of the website with their IP address. Mostly CloudFlare IP(s) starts with 104.x.x.x.<\/p>\n<p><b>How do CloudFlare works?<\/b><\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/3.bp.blogspot.com\/-un3i9jC7_00\/WRQG2niNQFI\/AAAAAAAAALM\/IDn_x5_mhd4TWBCzXK2d01d9VhgtXpEdQCPcB\/s1600\/cloudflare%2Bfunction.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/3.bp.blogspot.com\/-un3i9jC7_00\/WRQG2niNQFI\/AAAAAAAAALM\/IDn_x5_mhd4TWBCzXK2d01d9VhgtXpEdQCPcB\/s400\/cloudflare%2Bfunction.png\" width=\"400\" height=\"200\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"500\" data-original-width=\"1000\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<p>The chart above explains how the attacker gets the access to the website when the website is not under CloudFlare protection and at the right side, you can see how does CloudFlare protects the website from the attacker.<\/p>\n<p><b>Setting up CloudFlare to avoid getting it bypassed.<\/b><br \/>\nCloudFlare needs to be configured properly so that no one can bypass it. You may think that after adding your website to CloudFlare, you are protected. But you are wrong. Ever heard of that quote? &#8220;<b><i>With great powers, comes great responsibility<\/i><\/b>&#8220;. Yes, You need to configure its DNS. Now you are thinking, how to do that? Let&#8217;s start.<\/p>\n<p>Step one 1. Login to your CloudFlare account by going to the\u00a0<a href=\"https:\/\/www.cloudflare.com\/a\/login\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CloudFlare login portal.<\/a><\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-tda9k1_Equo\/WSkrgL2uRCI\/AAAAAAAAAPQ\/q0t9jMhiDFAHUpxFeL9WbuSefA-LN9kTACLcB\/s1600\/cf-login.PNG\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-tda9k1_Equo\/WSkrgL2uRCI\/AAAAAAAAAPQ\/q0t9jMhiDFAHUpxFeL9WbuSefA-LN9kTACLcB\/s320\/cf-login.PNG\" width=\"320\" height=\"279\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"405\" data-original-width=\"463\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">Now as you know, you must be\u00a0logged in to access the control panel of your website(CloudFlare control panel).<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/3.bp.blogspot.com\/-XDuHY6UJ2wo\/WSkr-b15dZI\/AAAAAAAAAPU\/x9Od_DB5jng7LZ9hJ12VdiCaZLn5Z4LOQCLcB\/s1600\/cf-weblist.PNG\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/3.bp.blogspot.com\/-XDuHY6UJ2wo\/WSkr-b15dZI\/AAAAAAAAAPU\/x9Od_DB5jng7LZ9hJ12VdiCaZLn5Z4LOQCLcB\/s400\/cf-weblist.PNG\" width=\"400\" height=\"163\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"453\" data-original-width=\"1100\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">2. Now select the website you want to configure.<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">You may now come up with many options.<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">Step 3. Go to DNS section<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-tGDXqpUgJeI\/WSks--0jbuI\/AAAAAAAAAPc\/qa_4YaLOeKInJREDvb_C-WWuyVc4a0-ugCLcB\/s1600\/cf-dnssec.PNG\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-tGDXqpUgJeI\/WSks--0jbuI\/AAAAAAAAAPc\/qa_4YaLOeKInJREDvb_C-WWuyVc4a0-ugCLcB\/s640\/cf-dnssec.PNG\" width=\"640\" height=\"96\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"177\" data-original-width=\"1166\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<p>Now you will see your subdomain which is protected. Go to your origin web hosting provider&#8217;s control panel and go to &#8220;DNS Settings&#8221; and check for all the sub names which are put up in the domain with their records. Example, cname.example.com. Record = CNAME. And now, as per the record, set it up with CloudFlare.<\/p>\n<p>And you&#8217;re all done! Make sure all the Orange tick are done. Check the screenshot below.<br \/>\nWhen the website is not under CloudFlare&#8217;s protection, it will look like this :<\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/2.bp.blogspot.com\/-cFMWvPS2Pro\/WSkuJWLSD9I\/AAAAAAAAAPk\/bf-6UIQtFt0bYwDhRi-RuHsEz6tXGUPCQCLcB\/s1600\/cf-withoutdns.PNG\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/2.bp.blogspot.com\/-cFMWvPS2Pro\/WSkuJWLSD9I\/AAAAAAAAAPk\/bf-6UIQtFt0bYwDhRi-RuHsEz6tXGUPCQCLcB\/s400\/cf-withoutdns.PNG\" width=\"400\" height=\"205\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"493\" data-original-width=\"961\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<p>And when it is under CloudFlare DNS setting then it will be in orange like the below one.<\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-b5wbE_XOeYY\/WSkuRg49gcI\/AAAAAAAAAPo\/NpjRtek9RLkLyeWO2J2llzQJPIgZ2s5BQCLcB\/s1600\/cf-underdns.PNG\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-b5wbE_XOeYY\/WSkuRg49gcI\/AAAAAAAAAPo\/NpjRtek9RLkLyeWO2J2llzQJPIgZ2s5BQCLcB\/s400\/cf-underdns.PNG\" width=\"400\" height=\"195\" border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"471\" data-original-width=\"961\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<p>Now check for the upper screenshot. You will see how it looks when the website is under CloudFlare.<br \/>\nTo enable the DNS, check click the grey cloud and when it turns to orange that means the website is under CloudFlare!<\/p>\n<p>Note:- If you put SMTP record(MX alias) under CloudFlare, then you won&#8217;t be able to send email from your Web app or cPanel. You need to get another email server which is totally different from the host.<\/p>\n<p>More articles are on its way!<\/p>\n<p><i>(Hey! If you found any mistake then please suggest in the comment box below!. We&#8217;re pleased for your feedback and suggestions! Thank you!)<\/i><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Short Introduction: CloudFlare is a Content Delivery Network(CDN) which builds up a wall between the website and the visitor. How to avoid it?"},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Doxing? Ever heard about it? Yea, Probably you have heard about it. What is it? Is it dangerous? How to avoid it if it is dangerous? Let&#8217;s go through all these questions.<\/p>\n<p>Doxing is a term which means an Online user being exposed by a hacker.\u00a0search for and publish private or identifying information about (a particular individual) on the Internet, typically with malicious intent.<\/p>\n<p><b>How do hackers dox us or any other victim?<\/b><br \/>\nDoxing is performed when a hacker have a single and a small clue through which he can find out all details about him. Example a hacker wants to Dox a guy named &#8220;Somdev&#8221;. Is he on facebook? If yes then we can use his facebook username. http:\/\/facebook.com\/somdev.sangwan. So at the end, somdev.sangwan is the username of that victim. Now the hacker will paste the username on Google or any other search engine. If the victim is a blogger then he may surely have updated his information on his blog. It may contain his email or any other information. Through that information he will find out more. He will do\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.shieldsec.org\/2017\/05\/information-gathering-of-domain-name.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Information gathering of the victim&#8217;s domain<\/a>\u00a0and find out his name, address, email, and other information.<\/p>\n<p><b>How to avoid Doxing?\u00a0<\/b><br \/>\nTo avoid Doxing, you should always hide your information from Internet. If you own a domain name then you should invest a little and buy WHOIS Guard through which domain&#8217;s WHOIS Information would get changed. Never post up personal details like email, phone number or etc on your article or blog. Try to not to earn fame because sooner or later it will result for you being a lame.<\/p>\n<p><b>How can Doxing be dangerous?<\/b><br \/>\nDoxing can be very dangerous. After hacker gets the detail about you, he can use it to make fake accounts. Even nowadays details are being sold online on Dark Web. You wouldn&#8217;t really know but if the details are authentic then it can be sold on Internet and can be used for any illegal purposes. It all depends on hacker who have doxed you. It depends on him for what purposes he will use your information for&#8230;.<\/p>\n<p>So be careful and take some precautions while getting yourself online.<\/p>\n<p><i>(Hey! If you found out any mistakes in our article or if you want to add someone else in it then we&#8217;re pleased to you to post your comment down! Thank you!)<\/i><\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Doxing? Ever heard about it? Yea, Probably you have heard about it. What is it? Is it dangerous? Here is your answer."},"content":{"rendered":"<p>Nowadays, We see many links provided to various groups mentioning &#8220;Clash of Clans hack tool!&#8221; like these staffs are being posted on daily basis. The truth behind those links are phishing and social engineering.<\/p>\n<p>It&#8217;s truth that in Clash of Clans it takes alot of time to build your empire and you get fraustrated by waiting of your &#8220;storage&#8221; being upgraded and other things. And you want a shortcut of reach a top level in a very short period of time. Some gives their login information to those phishing page claiming &#8220;The one and only backdoor in CoC Server&#8221; and most of people get hunted by a technique &#8220;Social Engineering&#8221; which baits people and crawl their information.<\/p>\n<p>The answer is, NO! Clash of Clans cannot be hacked with third party website or application. All those applications are fake. Some may give you screenshot as a proof but the reality behind it is its a private server in which you are alone playing Clash of Clans, on one else. Public server is global server in which millions of players play daily and private is where one or two plays up there.<\/p>\n<p>Still, Yes, Clash of Clans can be hacked by not by 3rd party system but by hacking into their server and editing their values. Now hacking into such a big server is quite hard because SuperCell isn&#8217;t a small company.<\/p>\n<p>I hope you got the answer if Clash of Clans can be hacked or no.<\/p>\n<p><i>(Hey! However, In this article we are going to show you how do\u2026","rel":"","context":"With 2 comments","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i2.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/botnet.jpg?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]},{"id":340,"url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/top-4-antivirus\/","url_meta":{"origin":62,"position":3},"title":"Top 4 Antivirus To Boost Your PC Performance","date":"September 9, 2018","format":false,"excerpt":"Imagine that you've got an idea to implement it on your website. What&#8217;s that? DoS stands for Denial of Service. Moreover taking down a website or a server is called a DoS attack. But there are 2 techniques through which we can put down a website or a server. DoS and DDoS. What the difference between them?<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><b>DoS &#8211; Denial Of Service Attack<\/b><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">This means that one computer and one internet connection is used to flood a server with packets (TCP \/ UDP).\u00a0The point of such a denial of service attack is to overload the targeted server\u2019s bandwidth and other resources.\u00a0This will make the server inaccessible to others, thereby blocking the website or whatever else is hosted there. Such attacks are called DoS attack.<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><b>DDoS -Distributed Denial of Service Attack<\/b><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">In most respects it is similar to a DoS attack but the results are much, much different. Instead of one computer and one internet connection the DDoS attack utilises many computers and many connections. The computers behind such an attack are often distributed around the whole world and will be part of what is known as a botnet. The main difference between a DDoS attack vs a DoS attack, therefore, is that the target server will be overload by hundreds or even thousands of requests in the case of the former as opposed to just one attacker in the case of the latter.<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">So which one is powerful?<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">As we can see, DoS is a term through which packets are sent from one computer or a connection meanwhile DDoS mean Distributed Denial of Service attack. &#8220;Distributed&#8221; itself defines that the attack&#8217;s responsibility is given to many computers or connections to take down the target.\u00a0<b>Common sense is the more you are the higher you get.<\/b><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><b>\u00a0<\/b><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\">Also read about\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.shieldsec.org\/2017\/05\/what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">CloudFlare<\/a>\u00a0and\u00a0<a href=\"http:\/\/www.shieldsec.org\/2017\/05\/an-introduction-to-dos-denial-of-service.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">DoS<\/a>.<\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><i>(Hey! If you think there should be any edit or if you found any mistake in our article then we&#8217;re pleased to you to suggest us down in the comment section! Thank you!)<\/i><\/div>\n<\/div>\n<\/div>\n<\/article>\n<div><\/div>\n<div class=\"post-footer\"><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>DoS? What&#8217;s that? DoS stands for Denial of Service. Moreover taking down a website or a server is called a DoS attack. But there are 2 techniques through which we can put down a website or a server. DoS and DDoS. What the difference between them? DoS &#8211; Denial Of Service Attack This means that [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":69,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[4],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/difference-between-dos-and-ddos\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Difference between DoS and DDoS - The Shadow Press\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"DoS? Denial-Of-Service"},"content":{"rendered":"<p><b>What is DoS?<\/b><br \/>\nIn computing, a denial-of-service attack (DoS attack) is a cyber-attack where the perpetrator seeks to make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a host connected to the Internet. Denial of service is typically accomplished by flooding the targeted machine or resource with superfluous requests in an attempt to overload systems and prevent some or all legitimate requests from being fulfilled.<br \/>\nIn a distributed denial-of-service attack (DDoS attack), the incoming traffic flooding the victim originates from many different sources. This effectively makes it impossible to stop the attack simply by blocking a single source.<br \/>\nA DoS or DDoS attack is analogous to a group of people crowding the entry door or gate to a shop or business, and not letting legitimate parties enter into the shop or business, disrupting normal operations.<br \/>\nCriminal perpetrators of DoS attacks often target sites or services hosted on high-profile web servers such as banks or credit card payment gateways. Revenge, blackmail and activism can motivate these attacks.<br \/>\n<b>Types of DoS Attacks<\/b>.<br \/>\nDenial-of-service attacks are characterized by an explicit attempt by attackers to prevent legitimate users of a service from using that service. In a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack, the incoming traffic flooding the victim originates from many different sources \u2013 potentially hundreds of thousands or more. This effectively makes it impossible to stop the attack simply by blocking a single IP address; plus, it is very difficult to distinguish legitimate user traffic from attack traffic when spread across so many points of origin. There are two general forms of DoS attacks: those that crash services and those that flood services. The most serious attacks are distributed.[6] Many attacks involve forging of IP sender addresses (IP address spoofing) so that the location of the attacking machines cannot easily be identified and so that the attack cannot be easily defeated using ingress filtering.<br \/>\nCourt testimony shows that the first demonstration of DoS attack was made by Khan C. Smith in 1997 during a DEFCON event disrupting Internet access to the Las Vegas Strip for over an hour and the release of sample code during the event led to the online attack of Sprint, EarthLink, E-Trade, and other major corporations in the year to follow.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>What is DoS? In computing, a denial-of-service attack (DoS attack) is a cyber-attack where the perpetrator seeks to make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a host connected to the Internet. Denial of service is typically accomplished by flooding the targeted machine or resource [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":69,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[4],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/an-introduction-to-dos-denial-of-service\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"An Introduction to DoS - Denial-Of-Service - The Shadow Press\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"What is DoS? In computing, a denial-of-service attack (DoS attack) is a cyber-attack where the perpetrator seeks to make a machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a host connected to the Internet. Denial of service is typically accomplished by flooding the targeted machine or resource [&hellip;]\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:url\" content=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/an-introduction-to-dos-denial-of-service\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:site_name\" content=\"The Shadow Press\" \/>\n<meta property=\"article:publisher\" content=\"https:\/\/facebook.com\/manalshaikh.info\" \/>\n<meta property=\"article:author\" content=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/shaikhmanal0\" \/>\n<meta property=\"article:published_time\" content=\"2017-09-27T12:58:25+00:00\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:image\" content=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/ddos.jpg\" \/>\n\t<meta property=\"og:image:width\" content=\"640\" \/>\n\t<meta property=\"og:image:height\" content=\"425\" \/>\n<meta name=\"twitter:card\" content=\"summary_large_image\" \/>\n<meta name=\"twitter:creator\" content=\"@manalshaikhINFO\" \/>\n<meta name=\"twitter:site\" content=\"@manalshaikhINFO\" \/>\n<script type=\"application\/ld+json\" class=\"yoast-schema-graph\">{\"@context\":\"https:\/\/schema.org\",\"@graph\":[{\"@type\":\"WebSite\",\"@id\":\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/#website\",\"url\":\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/\",\"name\":\"The Shadow Press\",\"description\":\"Hacking News &amp; We don&#8217;t know who owns which domain. In this tutorial, we are going to learn how to find the owner name of a domain and his information.<\/p>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Is it legal or illegal to find the owner&#8217;s detail?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Yes, This method is totally legal and open source. Everyone has access to this feature.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>How can be Information gathering be useful?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Information gathering can be useful in many ways, it can be useful for Law Enforcement agencies to catch the owner of a domain who runs an illegal website, Useful for a website&#8217;s visitor to know about the owner of the website which he\/she is visiting.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>What type of information we can get about the domain owner?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>We can get to know about his\/her name,phone number,mobile number, fax number, residential address and etc.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Can the owner of that specific domain hide his private information?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Yes, He\/she can hide those information by going in his\/her registrar control panel. However some of registrar costs a small amount of money to hide his\/her information from the Internet. The service which hides the information of the owner is called &#8220;WHOIS Guard&#8221;,<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>What is the service name provided by the Internet through which we can find the owner&#8217;s information?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>The service provided by the Internet through which we find the owner of that specific domain is called &#8220;<b>WHOIS<\/b>&#8220;. WHOIS is a service through which we can find the name of the owner of that specific domain.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>How can I find the name of the owner and his information?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>It is very easy to find the information of the domain&#8217;s owner. You can Google &#8220;Whois&#8221; and many website who provides WHOIS service will come up in the search result. But for this tutorial, we have selected whois.com. You can go to http:\/\/whois.com\/whois and input the domain name and press enter. A simpler way is just add the domain name without http:\/\/ after the above URL. Example http:\/\/whois.com\/whois\/teamultimate.in . If you visit this link, you will go to a web page in which you can find the owner&#8217;s detail of the website teamultimate.in.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><i>\u00a0<\/i><\/div>\n<div><i>(Note :- This tutorial is just for educational purpose, we are not responsible for your useage of the article above. Thank you!)<\/i><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Found any mistake or is there anymore more to be added in this article? Don&#8217;t hesitate to post your suggestion in the comment box below!<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Daily thousands of domains are being registered and and a total of billions of domains are registered overall. We don&#8217;t know who owns which domain. In this tutorial, we are going to learn how to find the owner name of a domain and his information. Is it legal or illegal to find the owner&#8217;s detail? Through various techniques, the attacker turns a small DNS query into a much larger\u2026","rel":"","context":"In &quot;DoS &amp; DDoS&quot;","img":{"alt_text":"","src":"https:\/\/i1.wp.com\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/10\/dnsampi.png?resize=350%2C200&ssl=1","width":350,"height":200},"classes":[]}],"_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/72"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/types\/post"}],"author":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/users\/1"}],"replies":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/comments?post=72"}],"version-history":[{"count":0,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts\/72\/revisions"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media\/73"}],"wp:attachment":[{"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/media?parent=72"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/categories?post=72"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags?post=72"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":76,"date":"2017-09-27T14:30:37","date_gmt":"2017-09-27T09:00:37","guid":{"rendered":"http:\/\/shortbytes.net\/?p=76"},"modified":"2017-09-27T14:30:37","modified_gmt":"2017-09-27T09:00:37","slug":"what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works-detailed-explanation","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works-detailed-explanation\/","title":{"rendered":"What is CloudFlare? How does it works? Detailed explanation."},"content":{"rendered":"<p>CloudFlare? What is it? How does it works? Let&#8217;s get the questions to be solved up here.<\/p>\n<p><b>What is cloudflare?<\/b><br \/>\nCloudFlare is a CDN(Content Delivery Network) which protects website from attacker. Does it host website on their webserver? No, They don&#8217;t host website but in simple way we can say that it builds a wall between the Host and the visitor of that specific website. The picture below explains the chart when a site is not under CloudFlare protection and when it is under protection.<\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/4.bp.blogspot.com\/-un3i9jC7_00\/WRQG2niNQFI\/AAAAAAAAALM\/-D4mx6Ly0k0MP0Gvg5AdTLzaOMNJgLU6wCEw\/s1600\/cloudflare%2Bfunction.png\"><img src=\"https:\/\/4.bp.blogspot.com\/-un3i9jC7_00\/WRQG2niNQFI\/AAAAAAAAALM\/-D4mx6Ly0k0MP0Gvg5AdTLzaOMNJgLU6wCEw\/s640\/cloudflare%2Bfunction.png\" width=\"640\" height=\"320\" border=\"0\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<p>It means when a website is under CloudFlare, visitors and crawlers are given access to the website but attackers aren&#8217;t given the access.<br \/>\nHere is the explanation by CloudFlare team &#8220;How does CloudFlare works?&#8221;<\/p>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\">\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>Cloudflare is designed to accelerate and secure any website. Our system works somewhat like a Content Delivery Network (CDN), but is designed to be much easier to setup and configure.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>To explain how the system works, imagine you have a website (allen.com) and it&#8217;s running a web server with the IP address of 1.1.1.1. Before Cloudflare, if someone typed your website&#8217;s domain (allen.com) into their browser, the first thing that visitor&#8217;s computer would do is send a query to the DNS system and get back your web server&#8217;s IP address (1.1.1.1).<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>In order to make Cloudflare easy to set up, we take advantage of how this basic function of the Internet works. Rather than having you add hardware, install software, or change your code, we have you designate two Cloudflare nameservers as the authoritative nameservers for your domain (e.g., bob.ns.cloudflare.com and sara.ns.cloudflare.com). You make this change with the registrar from which you bought your domain (e.g., GoDaddy, Network Solutions, Register.com, etc.).<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>Designating Cloudflare as your authoritative nameservers doesn&#8217;t change anything about your website. Your registrar remains your registrar, your hosting provider remains your hosting provider, and so on. However, because we are your authoritative nameserver, we can begin cleaning and accelerating your web traffic.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>To make this happen we use a network routing technology called Anycast (and some other fancy tricks) to route initial DNS lookups for your domain to a Cloudflare data center closest to the visitor. We have data centers around the world and we\u2019re growing every month. The data center that receives the request returns an answer in the form of an IP address (e.g., 99.99.99.99), which directs all the visitor&#8217;s subsequent requests to the best data center for them.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>After a visitor&#8217;s browser has done the initial DNS lookup, it begins making requests to retrieve the actual content of a website. These requests are directed to the IP address that was returned from the DNS lookup. Before Cloudflare, that would have been 1.1.1.1, with Cloudflare as the authoritative nameserver that would be 99.99.99.99 (or some other address depending on what Cloudflare data center is closest to the user). Cloudflare&#8217;s edge servers running on that IP address receive the request and perform analysis on it. We scan to see if the visitor appears to be a threat based a number of characteristics including the visitor&#8217;s IP address, what resource they are requesting, what payload they are posting, how frequently they&#8217;re making requests, etc.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>To speed up the response time for a request that goes to one of our frontline servers, Cloudflare caches parts of websites that are static in these servers. For example, we cache things like images, CSS, and JavaScript. We are very conservative with our caching because we never want to mess up dynamic content. So, for example, as a general rule we do not cache HTML. We also refresh the cache relatively frequently, so files are never more than a few hours old. Even being conservative, however, typically 50% of the resources on any given web page are cacheable.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>Assuming the visitor is not a threat, the frontline checks the request against the Cached resources on our front line servers to see if the resource being requested is in Cloudflare\u2019s local cache. If we have a local copy of the file being requested, then we can deliver it directly to the visitor from a local data center greatly increasing request response time.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>If the request is for a type of resource we don&#8217;t cache, or if we don&#8217;t have a current copy in our cache, then we make a request from our data center (99.99.99.99) back to your origin server (1.1.1.1). Because of our scale, we can get premium routes from our data centers back to most places on the Internet. As a result, while it may seem counter-intuitive, it is sometimes the case that the number of &#8220;hops&#8221; a visitor\u2019s request makes going through the Cloudflare network is less than the number of &#8220;hops&#8221; that they would have made going to the origin web server directly, even when we aren&#8217;t able to return a result from our cache.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<blockquote class=\"tr_bq\"><p><i>The combination of these systems means that we can protect sites from malicious visitors by stopping them before they even get to the origin web server, save over 60% of the bandwidth that a site would otherwise have to pay for, save over 65% of the requests that would otherwise have to be handled by a site, and cut in half average page load times. In order to make performance even better, we also do web content optimization.<\/i><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<\/blockquote>\n<p>But their is an increase in terrorism through CloudFlare, What? How can be terrorism spread behind CloudFlare? As per media and some activist cyber groups, Terrorists organisation like LeT, ISIS and etc are protecting website under CloudFlare and they are paying to CloudFlare to make themselves protective against the attack by Law Enforcement agencies. CloudFlare is bad-rated in these cases.<\/p>\n<p><b>How to bypass CloudFlare?<\/b><br \/>\nIf the owner of the website haven&#8217;t configured CloudFlare carefully, it can be bypassed and we can get the real IP of that website which is hiding behind CloudFlare. Like if subdomain&#8217;s DNS isn&#8217;t protected under cloudflare then we can ping those subdomains and get real IP.<\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><a href=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-HHAwBjXkjHg\/WRQKvA3uOcI\/AAAAAAAAALU\/N22l2mKkFqgAqyOHGp4cfHNwob-zYeETACLcB\/s1600\/cloudflare%2Bpinging%2Bsubdomain.png\"><img src=\"https:\/\/1.bp.blogspot.com\/-HHAwBjXkjHg\/WRQKvA3uOcI\/AAAAAAAAALU\/N22l2mKkFqgAqyOHGp4cfHNwob-zYeETACLcB\/s640\/cloudflare%2Bpinging%2Bsubdomain.png\" width=\"640\" height=\"400\" border=\"0\" \/><\/a><\/div>\n<p>One of a service called &#8220;CrimeFlare&#8221; does the same for you in an easier way.<br \/>\nThe video tutorial below will help you bypass CloudFlare using &#8220;CrimFlare&#8221;.<\/p>\n<div class=\"separator\"><iframe class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" src=\"https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/embed\/bp__ta2ttFQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\" height=\"266\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"allowfullscreen\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https:\/\/i.ytimg.com\/vi\/bp__ta2ttFQ\/0.jpg\" data-mce-fragment=\"1\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"separator\"><i>(Thanks for reading, If you think there should be any changes in this article then please comment below! thank you!)<\/i><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>CloudFlare? No, They don&#8217;t host website but in simple way we can say that it builds a wall [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":77,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[11],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/cloudflare-logo.png","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/what-is-cloudflare-how-does-it-works-detailed-explanation\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"What is CloudFlare? on &#8220;how to become a hacker?&#8221;"},"content":{"rendered":"<div><b>How to?<\/b><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>Nowadays peoples which are engaged on social networking sites and some joins hacking groups and gets impressed by them. It&#8217;s actually a cool thing, also bad thing and depending on how you use your knowledge. For helping peoples, for bad purposes, for hacking government as a sign of protest and etc. Some thinks that they are hacker when they hack games like candy crush or clash of clans or whatsoever by third party apps. Actually hacking is a term where no one can become a perfect hacker. Some noobs think that they installed Kali Linux and became hacker, what? Now do you even know how to operate the thing you installed? No, you don&#8217;t know. So for becoming a hacker needs you to be a person with willingness to learn everything in terms of &#8220;hacking&#8221; because 95\/100 peoples just wants to become hacker to know &#8220;how to hack wifi&#8221;,&#8221;how to hack clash of clans and get unlimited golds,elixar,gems&#8221;,&#8221;how to hack fb&#8221;and etc. To become a hacker, you must have willingness and paitence at most. Now let&#8217;s start with our basics need to become a hacker.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Joining groups<\/b><\/div>\n<div>Joining groups is the first thing that will inspire you for becoming a hacker. You will see hackers doing activities like defacing websites, getting access to the server, hacking into public wifi and doing MITM(man in the middle attack) and etc. This is make you understand what you can do in future after becoming a hacker and what you need to learn as a hacker.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Using Linux regularly<\/b><\/div>\n<div>Why to use Linux? It is because nowadays 95% of hacking activities are executed using Linux computing. It&#8217;s just like you started using Windows, you came to know about games, you hacked them via third party applications like &#8220;Cheat engine&#8221; and etc. It&#8217;s just the same. Linux will provide you many modules which will help you to sharpen your knowledge in Linux computing and becoming a hacker. Also another reason is 90% of hacking scripts are made of python, perl and other linux programming languages. Yes, You can use them on windows too but installing them on Linux is way easier then you think. Just few words command on terminal and you are all done!<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Use search engines for your needs<\/b>.<\/div>\n<div>Using search engine is one of the most important thing that will optimize your way of learning in cyber world. Disturbing someone else for your questions is the worst thing. The person whom you are asking may get angry. You know how they become hacker? The thing is using search engine. Search Engine digs out whole Internet and finds you the relevant results for your query. If you have a problem with your Internet connection, how to boost it? If you ask your friend who is expert in these, do you even know when will he reply? Or maybe get angry from you because you kept asking him &#8220;how to do this&#8221;, &#8220;how to do that?&#8221;. Using search engine isn&#8217;t a big deal. Open them, type in what you want to search! It&#8217;s that simple! Also you can do research on your topic using search engine.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><b>Getting Anonymous<\/b><\/div>\n<div>Hiding yourself is a big deal. You can&#8217;t become a hacker sitting in jail. When you do hacking, you do on servers, websites and mostly without permission which can result in jail. So hiding yourself in this Cyber world is the most important thing in Cyber world. Because Law Enforcement agencies like CIA, NSA, FBI and etc are having a watch on you and your activities. Also as per Rule 45, FBI have permission to hack any computer around the world. So to avoid yourself being exposed or hacked, You need to hide your identities using VPNs, RDPs,Proxies and etc..<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<h3>Learning To Code<\/h3>\n<div>Learning to code is another most important thing. You need to learn how to code because you may need it. You need to understand the algorithm and learn how do they actually work. It is the most important thing because if you understand the algorithm and you know how to code, then you can code anything, any program, any exploit which will help you hack anything. Various types of coding which will help you in writing exploits and programs are C,C++,Python,Perl,Ruby,PHP(WebI) and etc.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>We will continue with our topic and explore more points through which we can become a great hacker.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div><i>(If you think that this article needs any improvement then you are welcomed in our comment box below! We&#8217;re pleased to you to suggest us. Thank you!&#8221;)<\/i><\/div>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>How to? Nowadays peoples which are engaged on social networking sites and some joins hacking groups and gets impressed by them. It&#8217;s actually a cool thing, also bad thing and depending on how you use your knowledge. For helping peoples, for bad purposes, for hacking government as a sign of protest and etc. Some thinks [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":1,"featured_media":79,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"amp_status":"","spay_email":"","jetpack_publicize_message":""},"categories":[6],"tags":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2017\/09\/How-to-become-hacker.jpg","jetpack_publicize_connections":[],"yoast_head":"<!-- This site is optimized with the Yoast SEO plugin v14.4.1 - https:\/\/yoast.com\/wordpress\/plugins\/seo\/ -->\n<meta name=\"robots\" content=\"index, follow\" \/>\n<meta name=\"googlebot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<meta name=\"bingbot\" content=\"index, follow, max-snippet:-1, max-image-preview:large, max-video-preview:-1\" \/>\n<link rel=\"canonical\" href=\"https:\/\/theshadowpress.com\/guide-on-how-to-become-a-hacker\/\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:locale\" content=\"en_US\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:type\" content=\"article\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:title\" content=\"Guide on &quot;how to become a hacker?&quot; - The Shadow Press\" \/>\n<meta property=\"og:description\" content=\"How to? There are IP addresses but what are ports for? Well then let&#8217;s get started to a simple knowledge of ports. Ports are numerical protocols of a server which divides the server&#8217;s protocol in many different modules like HTTP, FTP, SSH, HTTPS and etc. In simple, it addresses them in numerical of a server.Well here is the point where the Ports come into play.<\/div>\n<div>Every data packet has a number with it ranging from 0 to 65536.<\/div>\n<div><\/div>\n<div>\n<h3>How to stay safe?<\/h3>\n<div>If you want to protect yourself from these Open Port problems you need a\u00a0Firewall.<br \/>\nWell firewall is a program which scans the data coming in and out of your system and it can detect malicious data packets and block them before they reach your computer.<\/div>\n<h3>Ports and their usages.<\/h3>\n<div>1 TCP Port Service Multiplexer (TCPMUX)<br \/>\n5 Remote Job Entry (RJE)<br \/>\n7 ECHO<br \/>\n18 Message Send Protocol (MSP)<br \/>\n20 FTP \u2014 Data<br \/>\n21 FTP \u2014 Control<br \/>\n22 SSH Remote Login Protocol<br \/>\n23 Telnet<\/div>\n<div>25 Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP)<br \/>\n29 MSG ICP<br \/>\n37 Time<br \/>\n42 Host Name Server (Nameserv)<br \/>\n43 WhoIs<br \/>\n49 Login Host Protocol (Login)<br \/>\n53 Domain Name System (DNS)<br \/>\n69 Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP)<br \/>\n70 Gopher Services<br \/>\n79 Finger<br \/>\n80 HTTP<br \/>\n103 X.400 Standard<br \/>\n108 SNA Gateway Access Server<br \/>\n109 POP2<br \/>\n110 POP3<br \/>\n115 Simple File Transfer Protocol (SFTP)<br \/>\n118 SQL Services<br \/>\n119 Newsgroup (NNTP )<br \/>\n137 NetBIOS Name Service<br \/>\n139 NetBIOS Datagram Service<br \/>\n143 Interim Mail Access Protocol (IMAP)<br \/>\n150 NetBIOS Session Service<br \/>\n156 SQL Server<br \/>\n161 SNMP<br \/>\n179 Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)<br \/>\n190 Gateway Access Control Protocol (GACP)<br \/>\n194 Internet Relay Chat (IRC)<br \/>\n197 Directory Location Service (DLS)<br \/>\n389 Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)<br \/>\n396 Novell Netware over IP<br \/>\n443 HTTPS<br \/>\n444 Simple Network Paging Protocol (SNPP)<br \/>\n445 Microsoft-DS<br \/>\n458 Apple QuickTime<br \/>\n546 Client<br \/>\n547 DHCP Server<br \/>\n563 SNEWS<br \/>\n569 MSN<br \/>\n1080 Socks<br
